loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, está conformado por 2 mujeres y un hombre emprendedor (Mariana, Derlin y Anastasio), pertenecen a la etnia miskita, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se unieron hace 2 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana,  para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de granos básicos, incrementar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.Decidieron nombrar al Grupo Solidario El Paraíso, en honor a la capilla de la iglesia que visitan.

Anastacio: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, es un señor jovial y luchador, casado con 4 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo y madera. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar: Granos násicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This is a mixed loan group. It is made up of 2 women and an enterprising man (Mariana, Derlin and Anastasio). They belong to the Miskito ethnicity, from the town of Puerto Cabezas. They got together 2 months ago with the purpose of working integrally to access loans with Pana Pana, to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses selling basic grains, increase their income, and, therefore, improve their families' quality of life. They decided to name the group "El Paraíso (The Paradise)" in honor of the chapel of the church they go to.

Anastasio is the coordinator of the group. He is young, cheerful, and determined. He is married with 4 young children who are in secondary school. With the purpose of having his own income and supporting his family, he established a small grocery store in his stilt and wood home. He is asking for funding to buy basic grains, snacks, and other products. He dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, and other products.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a Babban Gona farmer from Kargo Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. 

Since joining Babban Gona, Micah no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably.  This season Micah has ambitious plans to harvest 15 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Micah now has the opportunity to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start up a retail store

loans.name: Gónzalo Armando

texts.es:
Gonzalo está casado con Feliciana de Jesús y han procreado 3 hijos Gonzalo a sus 63 años vive solo con su esposa ya que sus hijos se casaron, Él se dedica a la producción de café rubro en el cual tiene 50 años de experiencia y que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos, A sus 63 años Gonzalo sueña con trabajar para contribuir al mejoramiento del planeta, “Es importante reparar un poco el daño que hemos realizado al planeta” menciona don Gonzalo.
La producción de café bajo sello de certificación es la opción que la caficultura está adoptando para hacer las fincas más sostenibles y amigables con el ambiente, Gonzalo está interesado en iniciar en su finca un proceso de conversión para producir café orgánico.
En la actualidad Gonzalo solicita un crédito para comprar equipos necesarios para un buen tratamiento de las fincas orgánicas estos equipos le harán más fácil la aplicación de los insumos  y por lo tanto harán que la finca sea más fácil de manejar. 
El crédito le ayudara a Gonzalo a adquirir equipos necesarios para hacer más fácil el manejo de su parcela que está en proceso de conversión a producción orgánica y por lo tanto tendrá la posibilidad de hacer su cafetal más productivo y rentable.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is married to Feliciana de Jesús, and together they have three children. At 63 years of age, Gonzalo lives only with his wife, since his children are already married. He works growing coffee, and has fifty years of experience in this trade. This business has become his only source of income. Gonzalo wants to work in ways that help improve our planet. "It's important to repair somewhat the damages we've caused on the planet," he says.

Producing certified organic coffee is the option coffee growers are choosing in order to make plantations more sustainable and environment-friendly. Gonzalo is interested in starting the process of switching over to organic production on his farm.

Gonzalo is requesting this loan to buy the equipment he needs in order to properly treat organic crops. The equipment will make it easier for him to apply supplies and in turn will make the farm more manageable. This loan will help Gonzalo get what he needs in order to run his farm, which is in the process of transitioning to organic production. This will allow him to make his coffee crops more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy the farm supplies and machinery he needs.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a 41-year-old widowed mother of three children. She started, almost a year ago, working in beauty care specializing in laser to cover her children's needs and expenses. She is her family's only breadwinner now. 

Khawla is a hardworking and ambitious lady who is trying to attract avlarge number of customers and become well-known in her region. She would like a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary updated beauty tools, and to maintain her car.

Khawla hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary updated beauty tools and maintain her car.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
Zebo is a generous and bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1970. 

She is living in a small city with her family. She is married and has three children. She has 24 years of experience working at the hospital. She has two daughters. She supported her first daughter with an education and now she has become a professional nurse at a hospital. 

Zebo is willing to support her second daughter's entry to the university. Zebo is planning to pay for her education. She is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders to pay the education costs of her second daughter. She wishes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay education costs for her daughter.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is 39 years old with two children, one of whom is in school. Jelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Jelyn has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Jelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 55 years old and married with six children aged between 15 and 33 years. They all go to school. 

She is a group leader of a group called TUZAMURANE which means “SUPPORT EACH OTHER." They sell different products and wish to expand their businesses to improve their lives. She owns a shop and has been running the business for 13 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and rice to sell.

loans.name: Lisambra Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres alegres y sonrientes, pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la comunidad de lamlaya, que se localiza a 10 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de granos básicos y bastimentos; se organizaron hace 4 años para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

Noemy Jovelka: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven cordial, con deseos de superación y cualidades de líder, soltera. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, apoyar a su mamá en los estudios de sus hermanos, estableció una pulpería y elabora helados naturales. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, pan, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener una distribuidora.
texts.en:
This loan group is made up of three happy and smiling women. They belong to the Miskito ethnicity in the community of Lamlaya, which is located 10 kilometers from the city of Bilwi, in the town of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who fight day-by-day to make their small businesses grow, selling basic grains and provisions. They got together 4 years ago to access loans with joint guarantee with Pana Pana.

Noemy Jovelka is the coordinator of the loan group. She is a cheerful young woman, single, with desire to excel and qualities of a leader. With the purpose of having her own income, contributing to the household expenses, and supporting her mom with the education of her siblings, she set up a grocery store and makes natural ice creams. She is asking for funding to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, soft drinks, and other products. She dreams of having a distributing business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, soft drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 30-year-old woman and the mother of a daughter and two sons, living in a small area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very skilled and loves her business as it is not just a business for her but a passion too. She stitches clothes for several ladies from the surroundings and these ladies are quite satisfied from her work. With this she also designs clothes and sells them in the market but has fallen short of stock so she couldn't prepare several orders. Therefore she has now applied for a loan so that she could complete the orders on time, resulting in more happy customers.

Parveen is thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for providing a platform to make her grow more day by day.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her stitching business.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is a happy man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1981. He lives in a small city with his family. He is married and has two children. 

He is an honest and responsible person. At the age of two his mother died. When he became fourteen years old he started to work. He became a builder. He helped his family with living expenses. 

He has a happy family now. He tries his best to support and feed his family. His children are sick. He needs to treat them at the hospital. He requested a loan from KIVA lenders to pay for medical services at the hospital. He hopes the doctors will heal them and his children will be healthy.

loans.use: to pay for medical services for his children at the hospital.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as diligent. 

Michael operates a metal fabrication business where he makes gutters, water cans, metallic boxes, etc. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy metal sheeting and other materials. He hopes that, in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and other materials.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a mother of two sons and two daughters residing in a small town of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been a ricksaw driver for 10 years. They support their family on his income, but for the last six months his vehicle has constantly been having problems.

Her husband thought that getting it repaired is more important then driving it and decreasing its life. Samina applied for the loan so that their children can sleep with filled stomachs. Samina appreciates the efforts of the KIVA team and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband in repairing his auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Norbert

texts.en:
Norbert is a first-year student at Kepler. Due to his dedication and tremendous academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Norbert chose Kepler because he believes it is the best university program in Rwanda.

Norbert plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a B.A. from an accredited US university. At Kepler, he hopes to build his public speaking skills as well as take on leadership roles in various student-run clubs. 

He isn't quite sure yet what he wants to do after graduating, but as an amateur photographer and artist, Norbert hopes it will involve something at the intersection of business and the visual arts.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Ibudhou Pakhangba Group

texts.en:
Rani is the mother of four children and lives with her husband in Manipur. Their family income is Rs. 8,000 per month and her contribution to it is Rs. 4,500 from her business. She runs a weaving business. She wants to enhance her income by expanding her business. She wants to sell varied items like sarees, towels, bed sheets, etc. 

Rani leads a group of five women. The other four members are also engaged in income-generating activities. In order to expand their respective businesses, they formed a group and decided to apply for a loan. Together, they seek a loan of Rs. 35,000. You loan will help these women secure the future of their families.

loans.use: To expand her weaving business and sell towels, bed sheets, etc..

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 30-year-old married mother of two. She took a job, seven years ago, in a governmental institute with a limited salary to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Rana is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to renovate her house, especially the kitchen, to make it a healthier and better place for her children. She hopes to stay capable of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house, especially the kitchen, to make it a healthier and better place for her children.

loans.name: Olga Rocio

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 45 años de edad que hace unos años enviudo, de manera que toco tomar la responsabilidad de su hogar en el que viven sus dos hijos, tarea que no ha sido fácil pero que ha asumido con gran empeño. Hoy, esta valiente mujer tiene un negocio de venta de comidas.

Para Olga ver crecer su negocio es muy importante, por eso ha decidido invertir en él, hoy pide un préstamo para comprar un horno industrial que necesita para poder aumentar la producción y así obtener más ganancias. 

Olga sueña con algún día tener la posibilidad de comprar una casa para brindarles a sus hijos un hogar apropiado para que vivan protegidos. Puedes ayudar a Olga a cumplir este sueño y a mejorar su negocio con tan solo un préstamo.
texts.en:
Olga is a 45 year old woman who was widowed years ago, so that she had to take responsibility for the home where her two children live. Her work has not been easy but she took charge with great success. Today this brave woman has a business selling prepared meals.

For Olga, to see her business grow is important. For this reason she has decided to invest in the business. Now she is asking for a loan to buy an industrial oven needed to increase production and thus earn more.

Olga dreams of some day being able to buy a house so as to offer her children a proper home where they can live well-protected. You can help Olga fulfill this dream and better her business with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy a industrial oven

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a single woman. She has two children and describes herself to be honest and faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, toilet paper, washing soap, match boxes and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rain which affects business. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of soap, rice, washing soap and other items. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a good business, create employment and make good profits. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more soap, rice, washing soap and other items.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 53 years old. She is widowed and lives in Akhmeta district with her son and pensioner mother-in-law. 

Nino has a cow which she milks every day and produces dairy products to sell locally. 

Nino wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of GEL 550. With the credit she will purchase clothes to resell. Nino is very hardworking woman and will do her best to generate income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a clothing business.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is a first-year student at Kepler. Though Rwandan, he grew up with his family in Tanzania, where they work as missionaries. Due to his impressive academic record and high test scores, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Jean Pierre chose to attend Kepler because he believes it offers the highest quality of education you can get in Rwanda, and he wanted to contribute to his country’s growth from his homeland. He plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. 

After graduating, Jean Pierre hopes to start his career at an international consulting firm.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: By His Grace Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a member of the group called "By His Grace", which is located in Chorkor in the greater Accra region. She continues to manage a grocery store. Beatrice has been in business for quite some time and is doing well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. She continues to sell groceries such as rice, Milo, sugar, sardines, noodles, and other specialties that her customers request each day. Beatrice wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her repayments according to the established terms. Beatrice is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, Milo, sugar, sardines, and noodles to sell to customers.

The other members are engaged in businesses such as managing a soft drinks business, children's wear, and jewelry. They all promise to repay without troubles.

loans.use: to buy rice, Milo, sugar, sardines, and noodles to sell to customers.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and gain more profits.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem has successfully established her business of embroidery with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with beads, sequins and glittering material.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with beads, sequins and glittering material.

loans.name: Landry

texts.en:
Landry is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of his impressive academic record and strength of character, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Landry chose Kepler because it offered a skills-based curriculum to start his career in business and technology.

Landry plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He hopes that after graduating, he will have the skills and preparation to start his own business.

While at Kepler, Landry would like to focus on developing his public speaking skills and growing as a creative, critical thinker.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation.

She will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Chaokhatminnaba Group

texts.en:
The women in Bishnupur district of Manipur work hard to sustain their families. One such woman is Noni. She runs a petty shop business of her own. She caters to the demand in her village, but she sees a scope for expansion.

She believes if she expands her business to sell rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, etc., she will earn more than the INR 3,600 she earns every month at present. She lives with her husband and three children. She wants to earn more, since after meeting all expenses, she is barely able to save anything.

Prema, Indu, Ithobi, Ibemhal, Leimahal, and Meipakpi also run their respective businesses like Noni. As the prices of commodities are going up, they feel that their current income would not be able to sustain their families. Hence, they want to expand their businesses and increase their income. For this, they have come together to form a group led by Noni to apply for a loan.

Your loan would help these families keep up with the rising prices and lead a contented life.

loans.use: to fund the expansion of her petty shop business.

loans.name: Barsha Group 1

texts.en:
Swapna, the group leader, runs a tea hotel in her premises. She is 36 years old and a mother of one child. She wants to expand her tea stall by adding some furniture and raw materials.

Currently she earns Rs. 6,000 every month. She believes that post the expansion of her business, she will be able to earn Rs. 7,000 every month.

Similarly, other remaining members who are also engaged in various income generation activities are also facing a shortage of working capital. So, they decided to take a loan of Rs. 90,000 (15,000 per member). From this loan, Swapna (group leader) will be able to purchase raw materials like oil, atta (flour), onions, potatoes etc. and a table and chairs for her hotel. Alpana would be able to upgrade the stock of her pan shop. Jayanti would be able to expand her battery shop. Ratna would be able to invest in her cloth business. Chitra will be able to upgrade the stock of her vehicle spare part shop and Junu will be able to invest in procuring raw materials for her tailoring business. Your loan would help these women realise their entrepreneurial dreams.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and furniture for the expansion of her tea hotel business

loans.name: Yasmid Elena

texts.es:
Yasmid tiene 41 años y vive en Santa Rosa de Osos con su hijo de 12 años. Esta mujer posee un negocio de confección de ropa desde hace 15 años, labor que le ha permitido salir adelante y apoyar a su familia. Esta labor la aprendió gracias a un amigo cercano que le enseño como realizarla.

Esta talentosa mujer quiere ver a su empresa ser sostenible en el tiempo y que vaya aumentando sus ganancias progresivamente. Hoy no cuenta con el capital económico para invertir en su negocio de la manera que le gustaría, por eso necesita un préstamo que le permita comprar una máquina plana que le ayude a mejorar la producción.

El gran sueño de Yasmid siempre ha sido el de comprar una casa ya que no posee una, donde le permita a su familia vivir tranquila y segura. Ayuda con un préstamo a Yasmid para que esté más cerca de hacer sus sueños realidad.
texts.en:
Yasmid is 41 years old and lives in Santa Rosa de Osos with her 12 year old son. Yasmin has owned a business making clothing for more than 15 years, work which has allowed her to get ahead and support her family. She learned how to do this work thanks to a good friend who taught her.

This talented woman wants to see her enterprise continue to be profitable over time and keep increasing its earnings gradually. Today she lacks the financial capital to invest in her business in the way she would like to. That is why Yasmid is asking for a loan with which she can buy a double needle sewing machine to improve her productivity.

Sincer she doesn't own a house, Yasmid's big dream has always been to buy one where her family can live happy and secure. Help Yasmid with a loan so that she will be closer to making her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy a double needle sewing machine.

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Linda is a 38-year-old married woman. Her business is the sale of jewelry and watches. She is a good wife, entrepreneurial, patient, optimistic, friendly, responsible and hardworking. Her business is located at the market where there are public and private companies such as restaurants, shopping malls, movie theaters, ice cream shops, apartment complexes and all kinds of trades.

Linda has a fair complexion, brown eyes, black shaping hair, wears a long multicolored top and is short, standing in front from the left. Her first language is Twi, which is spoken at home. She lives with her husband who works as a driver. Her need to excel led her to join this group of people to borrow funds and improve their businesses. Members of the group have businesses such as: baking bread, plantain chips, cosmetics, sewing accessories and paints.

Linda's business is selling jewelry, watches and necklaces at the market where a lot of customers come to buy. She works all days. The advantage of her business is that she can care for her family as she works. The challenge is the lack of capital to supply the business with jewelry, watches and necklaces. Her dream is to open a neighborhood store too so that she can operate that one also. She wants to make the purchase of jewelry, watches and necklaces to continue selling to her customers all year. This is the fourth sequence of loans in three years to support this activity.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry, watches and necklaces to continue selling to her customers all year.

loans.name: Las Soñadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS SOÑADORAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de pan y empanadas, venta de banderas, venta de cosméticos, venta de refrescos y salteñas, venta de accesorios, venta de material de plásticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria Elena es integrante, ella indica que son cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
En la foto solo aparecen siete integrantes ya que la señora Nora, después del desembolso, se fue a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Sonadoras" will begin its fifth cycle with "Pro Mujer", as part of its regional office "Panamericana." It is made up of eight members and it is led by a Board of Directors where Senora Maria Elena is the President. The businesses that the members of the communal association engage in are varied. Among them are: food sales, bread and pastry sales, flag and banner sales, cosmetic sales, sale of soft drinks and meat pies, sale of accessories and sale of plastic materials.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Maria Elena. She indicates that for five cycles she has been part of Pro Mujer. She became a member by the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She learned this business from her sister.

The loan that she will now take out is to add to her capital (the purchase of rice wholesale) that she will acquire from the vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then prepare and sell it in her place of business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to economically support her family since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

There are only seven members in the photo since Senora Nora, after the payment, went to her place of business.

loans.use: to buy rice wholesale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She is 45, divorced with a grown son. Tatyana sells women's clothing at a local marketplace, as well as other small markets in neighboring villages. Tatyana has been working in this sphere of trade for 15 years. 

Tatyana needs 20 000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted men's clothing from a wholesaler. She is planning to expand her business adding men's outfits and clothing inventory to her stock.

loans.use: to purchase assorted men's clothing from a wholesaler.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be prayerful. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area with a good flow of customers and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for use in her salon. Her business goal is to open a beauty school within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for use in her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk sales and to apply farm yard manure to improve productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Carolyne's business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items. 

Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will own many shops. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is married and has three children. He describes himself as outgoing. He operates a farm, where he grows rice. His business is located in a fertile area, and his primary customers are locals. Charles will use this loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy farm inputs. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Christinah

texts.en: Christinah is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. Her business goal is to be the best business lady within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Miriam Amparo

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 51 años y vive en el municipio de Valdivia. Tiene 6 hijos a los cual quiere mucho y por quienes siempre ha trabajado arduamente. Esta mujer es comprometida y responsable, y tiene sus propia tienda desde hace 7 años, la cual le ha servido de sustento para toda su familia. 

Ella desea invertir en su negocio porque quiere que sea sostenible en el tiempo y le permita seguir apoyando a su familia. También desea mejorar la utilidad del negocio, por esto requiere un préstamo que le permita comprar 1 enfriador e invertir en mercancía y víveres. 

Miriam sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su casa que no se encuentran en la mejor situación, además que no da abasto para la cantidad de gente que allí vive. Ella sabe que un préstamo podría cambiar su vida, por eso puedes hacer parte de estos sueños, presta ahora y ayuda a Miriam.
texts.en:
Miriam is 51 years old and lives in the township of Valdivia. She has six children whom she loves very much and for whom she has always worked hard. This woman is committed and responsible, and she has had her own store for seven years, which has served her to sustain her whole family.

She wants to invest in her business because she wants it to be sustainable in time and allow her to continue supporting her family. She also wants to improve the profitability of the business. For this, she needs a loan that will allow her to buy a cooler and to invest in merchandise and supplies.

Miriam dreams of improving the condition of her house, which is not in the best situation, in addition to not being adequate for the number of people who live there. She knows that a loan will be able to change her life. 

For this, you can be part of these dreams. Lend now and help Miriam.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, merchandise, and supplies

loans.name: Ghulam  Jannat

texts.en: Ghulam Jannat has successfully built her business of selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. At this point, she has built up a good number of customers and she makes a good income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase more animals to increase her sales and gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales and gain more profit.

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en: Shafqat has successfully built her business selling animals with the support of the Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more animals to inflate her sales and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales and gain more profits

loans.name: Barsha Group

texts.en:
44-year-old Suchitra runs a tailoring shop in the Kamrup district of Assam. She currently earns Rs. 4,500 from her business. She wants to take a loan to expand her business. With the loan, she wants to buy raw materials so she can increase her income. She expects to earn an extra Rs. 1,500 every month. She wants to expand her tailoring services to include tailoring services for blouses, sarees, pants, skirts, etc.

Suchitra leads a group of six women. These women need a loan of Rs. 90,000 (15,000 per person) to expand their businesses. They are falling short of working capital to expand their respective businesses. Your loan would help this group of women expand their respective businesses and help them contribute more to their family income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Annick La Reine

texts.en:
Annick is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive academic record and strong character, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because it because of its reputation for helping its students find job opportunities and build networking skills.
 
Annick plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At Kepler, Annick hopes to further develop her writing abilities. She loves to express herself through language and hopes to have a career in the arts after graduating. She will be the first member of her family to attend college.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a market entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She is 46 and divorced. Valentins has two children: a 24-year-old son and a 12-year-old daughter. 

Valentina sells women's knitted clothing items at a local market in her home town. Valentina rents property from the market administration. She owns three vending spots that are all located next to one another. Valentina has been working in this sphere of trade for 20 years. 

Valentina is seeking 31,000 Grivnyas to purchase sweaters, jerseys, skirts and skirt suits for sale in the fall and winter. Valentina is focused on consistent growth of her venture which is why she is willing to work hard and invest her efforts and time in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, jerseys, skirts and skirt suits for sale in fall and winter.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is a farmer from Gladkovka. He is 38, and married with small children. He has been running his greenhouse business for the past 12 years. Oleg owns a piece of land where he has his greenhouses. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, Chinese cabbage and radishes. 

Oleg needs another 80,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, wood and plastic film for next season in the greenhouses. He is planning to re-invest the profit in the growth of his business, as well as to meet some family needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, wood and plastic film for next season of work in greenhouses.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She runs a small clothing and shoes sales business. Tamara rents a vending facility at a local marketplace, plus she sells her merchandise in other small towns as she travels around on a weekly basis. She has been in this trade for eight years. 

Tamara is seeking 40,000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal clothing and footwear for fall. Significant work experience, a loyal clientele, in-demand items and affordable prices are the factors that will help Tamara continue to grow her business, expanding it even further.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing and footwear for fall.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a single woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells airtime, spices, polythene bags, cosmetics and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. 

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more cosmetics, spices, bags and other items. 

She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business and employ more workers. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, spices, bags and other items.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a single woman. She describes herself to be friendly. 

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Awurade Beye Group

texts.en:
The Awurade Beye group (God will provide) is in its fifteenth loan cycle. The group formed in the city of Accra-chorkor and is made up of six members who all have their own occupations. They are into car tires, grocery, lubricants, materials and local dishes.

Amos works from the market where he has a very well-stocked car tire shop. He has a large clientele due to his excellent service. He launched the business after joining the Awurade Beye group. He says that he is doing very well and is very happy to belong to ID-Ghana, Chorkor branch.

Amos is married with children who are living together in a rented apartment. He is asking for this loan to be able to buy more car tires from the wholesalers and resell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more car tires for resale.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: With the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva, Shabana has successfully established her business of selling cloth. At this point, she has built up a good number of customers and makes a good income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase bundles of cloth in different colours to increase her sales and resulting profits.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colours to increase her sales and resulting profits.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia  has successfully built her business of selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. At this point, she has built up a good number of customers and makes a good income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 50,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase another cow to increase her sales in more cities and gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales in more cities and gain more profits.

loans.name: Jazmin Adriana

texts.es:
Jazmin tiene 29 años y vive en el municipio de Valdivia, Antioquia. Es una mujer soltera con muchos sueños y ganas de salir adelante, siempre ha querido tener su propio negocio porque le gusta ser independiente, por esta razón, desde el año pasado comenzó a transportar gente en moto taxi, transporte muy popular en los pueblos de Colombia.

Esta emprendedora espera sobretodo la posibilidad de que su negocio sea sostenible en el tiempo para que permita ayudarla a sobrevivir. Hoy acude por un préstamo ya que desea comprar una moto para prestar su servicio de moto taxi, esto la haría más independiente y mejoraría sus ganancias. 

Jazmin sueña con la posibilidad de mejorar las condicionas de la casa donde vive con su familia, pues necesita de algunas reparaciones. Puedes ayudar a esta mujer a salir adelante con un préstamo y así estará más cerca de cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jazmin is 29 years old and lives in the township of Valdivia, Antioquia. She is a single woman with great dreams and the will to advance. She has always wanted to have her own business, because she likes to be independent. For this reason, in the past year she began to transport people by motorcycle taxi, a very popular form of transportation in the towns of Colombia.

This entrepreneur hopes above all that it will be possible for her business to be sustainable in time so that it will allow her to make ends meet. Now she is turning to a loan, since she wants to buy a motorcycle in order to provide her motorcycle taxi service. This will make her more independent and improve her earnings.

Jazmin dreams of the possibility of improving the conditions of the house where she lives with her family, since it needs some repairs. 

You can help this woman get ahead with a loan, and thus she will be closer to achieving her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Netaji Group 01

texts.en:
Pampi lives with her family of five in the Kamrup district of Assam. She is a mother of two teenaged children. She realizes the need to increase her savings to secure her children’s future. She runs a clothing shop in the village and currently earns Rs. 6000 every month. Her existing income is not enough to manage the household expenses. Thus, she wants to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

Pampi is joined by four other women who also want to expand their respective businesses but lack the funds to do so. Together they need a loan of Rs. 100,000 (20,000 per member). Pampa will use the loan to purchase raw materials to expand her business so she can sell baby clothes, blouses, salwars, etc. Similarly, the other members will use the loan to buy more stock and raw materials to expand their respective businesses. Your loan will help them contribute more to the household income. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand her clothing shop.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is married and has three children. He describes himself as outgoing. He operates a farm, where he grows rice. His business is located in a fertile area, and his primary customers are local.  Paul's biggest business challenge is price change. He will use this loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay for labour. These investments will enable him to increase his rice production. He hopes, in the future, that he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay for labour.

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silveria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pasancalla, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, venta de ropa para niños, venta de ropa para bebé.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silveria es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez  que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pasancalla (pipocas de maíz); da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad económica por la que atravesaba, lo aprendió de una amiga hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pasancalla por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Perú-Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializara en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The group Vicuñitas will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana (Focal Point of Pan-America). It consists of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Mrs. Silveria is president. The businesses that the members of the community association have vary. Among them are businesses for selling pasancalla (sweetened white popcorn), vegetables, clothing, children’s clothing, and baby’s clothing.

The loan will benefit the small microenterprises of which Mrs. Silveria is a member. She points out that it’s the first time working with Pro Mujer. She’s working with it at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a pasancalla (popcorn) selling business. She says she started it out of the economic necessity she faced; she learned it from a friend several years ago.

The loan that she’s taking now is for increasing capital (buying pasancalla wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers on the Peru-Bolivia border. Later, she will market it in the trade fairs in the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she’s in a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health services and training the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale pasancalla (sweetened white popcorn)

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a food stall where she cooks fried potatoes and other snacks. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more potatoes and other food ingredients. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and other food ingredients.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar and her family live in Verishen village: Gohar's husband, her little daughter and retired mother-in-law. 

Gohar and her husband take care of their family farm, located near their house. Most people in this region are involved in livestock breeding and dairy production, because of the severe climate. 

Gohar also keeps animals and produces different dairy products. Their livestock currently includes 10 calves, two pigs, 11 piglets, 30 hens and four colonies of bees. 

Besides helping her on the farm, Gohar's husband also drives a taxi in the evening to support his family.

Gohar asks for this loan to purchase two cows and four piglets for her farm. This is Gohar's first loan and it has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 600 borrowers like Gohar will get a chance to have their first loan and develop their business.

loans.use: to buy two cows and four piglets.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna, her husband and mother-in-law live in Angeghakot village in the Syunik region. They have been engaged in agribusiness for 20 years. Susanna, an accountant by profession, works also in one of the local companies. Her time after work is fully devoted to the farm and together with her husband, Susanna works really hard to sustain their living.

She has now applied for this loan to make some improvements to the farm and develop it for the coming harvesting season. Susanna plans to pay for renovation of the tractor, fertilizer, and forage for feeding animals.

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Susanna was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

Susanna and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the tractor, fertilizer, and forage for feeding animals.

loans.name: Faithfulness Group

texts.en:
The group members belong to the Faithfulness group, which is located in Chorkor-Accra. Their business are in cosmetics, underwear, second-hand clothing and bakery.

The group member is Joyce who is married, is 43 years old and has one dependent child. Joyce sells second-hand clothing. She is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes that because of her business her child will be able to finish her studies.

She works from 8:00 AM until 4:00 PM. She has more than eight years of experience in the business, and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her business. She is asking for a loan in order to buy ladies' tops and kidswear for resale. This photo is taken after their meeting.

loans.use: To buy ladies' tops and kidswear for resale.

loans.name: Punima Lup Group

texts.en:
Bindiya runs a small shop in the Thoubal district of Manipur. She is married and a mother of two children. She is finding it hard to make ends meet with her current income of Rs. 3,000. Hence, she has applied for a loan to expand her business to sell detergent powder, soaps, chips, etc. She expects her income to double. The increased earnings will help her provide for her family and secure her children’s future. 

Bindiya is the leader of a group of five women who need funds to expand their respective businesses. They seek a loan of Rs. 60,000 in total. They all want to expand their businesses to increase their income. Your loan will help these women secure the lives of their families.

loans.use: To expand her small shop to sell more items.

loans.name: Marie Bertrande

texts.en:
Marie Bertrande is a first-year student at Kepler. The first of her family to attend university, she was selected from over 6,000 applicants this year. Marie chose Kepler because it offered a strong business curriculum and she believes it will help her develop into a skilled, confident leader.

Marie plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. A natural collaborator, Marie hopes to take on various leadership roles at the university. Her greatest hope is to be successful enough to provide her sister with the financial support to attend medical school.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Alain Honoré

texts.en:
Alain is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up alongside his two siblings and mother, who is a primary school teacher. Because of Alain’s impressive academic performance, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Alain plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. He chose Kepler because he wanted the opportunity to develop his professional and networking skills as an intern during his education. After graduating Alain hopes to help manage a company and eventually to start his own motivational speaking practice someday.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college dgree

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Egide is a first year student at Kepler. He grew up on a farm in a rural area of western Rwanda. Because of his impressive academic credentials, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Egide chose to attend Kepler because of its focus on providing job-ready skills to its students.

Egide plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. A hard worker, he hopes to develop his technology skills to a point where he can manage a business after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college dgree.

loans.name: Sristi 01 Group

texts.en:
Leena runs a tailoring shop in Assam. She makes Rs. 6,000 from her business. She is the mother of an infant. In addition to doing the household chores and taking care of her baby, she spends time in her tailoring shop to cater to the demands in her village. 

Her current income is not enough for her to make ends meet. Hence she decided to expand her business to bring in more income. To upgrade her tailoring business, she needed an extra sewing machine. But, due to lack of working capital, she could not afford one. Therefore she has applied for a loan with the group of six women that she leads. 

Mira, Purnima, Mousumi, Tanushree, Minu and Leena need a loan of Rs. 90,000. Mira and Leena want to purchase a sewing machine; Purnima and Mousumi want purchase cosmetics for their respective beauty parlours; Tanushree wants to start her clothing business and Minu wants to buy stock for her clothing business. Your loan will help these women meet their respective requirements. They thank their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Malach

texts.en:
Malach 29 years old, is married and supports two children. He is a tea farmer earning KES 18,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES. 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops to increase production. 

He plans to use the profits to repay his loan and educate his children. He hopes to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops to increase production.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane and her husband live in Shaghat village, Syuniq region. Their house is located on the bank of the river, and Gayane and her husband also have a fishery. In the backyard of their house is their family farm. It includes the livestock (cows, calves, pigs, piglets, hens and bees) and also wheat, emmer wheat and potatoes. 

Gayane's children are married and live separately, so Gayane's and her husband's only occupation is farming. 

To be able to improve the farm, Gayane has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase feed for the livestock, fuel and wheat seeds for land cultivation. 
As this is Gayane's  first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 600 borrowers like Gayane will get a chance to have their first loan and develop their business.

loans.use: to pay for livestock feed, fuel and wheat seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Las De Zona Kiswawa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DE ZONA KISWAWA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Josefa es la Presidenta. Los principales negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son: venta de ganado, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Josefa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su comunidad. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, ya que desde pequeña ayudaba a su mamá.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de ganado vacuno, que adquirirá de las vendedoras de Batallas, esta adquisición le ayudará a aumentar su capital porque podrá vender más queso para luego comercializarlo en la ciudad de La Paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Las de Zona Kiswawa" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Josefa is the president. The principal businesses of the members of the communal association are selling cattle and selling cheese.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, of whom Señora Josefa is one. She indicates that this is the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, having entered because of the invitation of a mass promotion from the institution that was made in her community. She now has a business of selling cheese. She lets it be known that she learned this business a number of years ago, since she helped her mother ever since she was little.

The loan that she will take out now will be for the purchase of cattle, which she will acquire from the sellers in Batallas. This acquisition will help her to increase her capital because she will be able to make more cheese to later sell it in the city of La Paz. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives in free union and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase modern banana suckers so as to produce quality bananas and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more carpentry materials.

loans.name: Gladis Aydde

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer casada de 37 años de edad que vive en Guarne, Antioquia. Con su esposo tiene dos hijos de 12 y 7 años, por los cuales trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Esta madre tiene una sala de belleza hace 8 años, y es bastante reconocida en su sector por el buen trabajo que realiza.

Esta mujer trabaja arduamente para lograr hacer crecer su negocio, porque quiere que se vaya posicionando y le deje mayores ganancias, que le permitan mejorar la situación de su familia. Ella quiere invertir en su negocio, por eso pide un préstamo para comprar shampoos, cepillos y tintes de cabello, materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo.

Gladis sueña con poder comprar algún día su propia casa, pues es lo que ha querido desde que estaba muy pequeña, para que pueda brindar a su familia un buen lugar donde vivir. Puedes ayudar a esta mujer con un préstamo para apoyarla en su sueños.
texts.en:
Gladis is a 37 year old woman who lives in Guarne, Antioquia. With her husband, she has two children, aged 12 and 7. She works very hard for them to offer them a good quality of life. This mother has had a beauty salon for 8 years. It is very well known in the area because of the good work she does.

This woman works hard to be able to grow her business, because she wants it to gain a position in the market and bring in more profits, which will allow her to improve her family's situation. She wants to invest in her business. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy shampoos, brushes, and hair dyes. These are materials necessary to do her job.

Gladis dream of being able to buy her own house someday. That is what she has wanted since she she as very little, so she can offer her family a good place to live. You can help this woman with a loan to support her and her dreams.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, brushes and hair dyes.

loans.name: Julianas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JULIANA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de papa, tienda de barrio, taller de carpintería, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nora es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió por iniciativa propia y con los pocos ahorros con el que contaba, decidió emprender este negocio hace varios meses.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializara en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “JULIANA” credit group will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Collpani Center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Nora is the president. The businesses that the members of the credit group run are varied. Among them are selling food, selling clothes, selling potatoes, a neighborhood store, a carpenter shop, and selling blankets.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Nora. She remarks that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a massive promotion of the institution undertaken in her area. Right now, she has a business selling food. She says that she learned this business on her own initiative and with the little savings she had, she decided to open this business a few months ago.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying rice wholesale. She will acquire it from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and after making the food she will sell it in her sales stall. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, because she is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy rice wholesale.

loans.name: Claudina

texts.es: La señora Claudina vive en el área rural con su pareja, en calidad de concubinos, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda  es rustica de adobe con techo de teja española, que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su conyugue para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura,  en esta actividad lleva 20 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa sus producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, cebada, avena y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Claudina se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la compra de semilla de papa, de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudina lives in a rural area with her partner. She was able to study at the primary level. Her rustic adobe house with a Spanish tile roof lacks some basic services. 

She is a hard-working, very optimistic person. She works every day with her partner to earn income to support themselves. She primarily works in agriculture. For about 20 years, she has been producing and selling her product. They take what they raise and sell it in regional markets and nearby towns. The main products she plants are larger amounts of potato, barley, oats, and other crops in smaller quantities for her own use.

Claudina needs to apply for a loan to buy potato seed, so that she can increase production, continue selling, and gain income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seed, so that she can increase production and improve her sales and gain income to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline 29 years, is married and supports three children.She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES.8,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan from Vision fund Kenya of KES.25,000 to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray to improve productivity.

She plans to use the gained profits to expand her farming activity and educate her children. She hopes to be a stable kale supplier in her region.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray to improve produictivity.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 2 children age 10 and 15 years old. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 53 years old. She lives in Sagarejo district with her three children. Tamar is unemployed and the family lives in poverty, thus they get monthly social assistance from the government institutions.

Tamar decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of GEL 4,500 to start a trading business. With the received credit she will purchase stock of clothes and will resell them at a higher price. Tamar is very motivated to work hard and to generate income in order to improve the living conditions of her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes.

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en:
Ernestine is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her five siblings on a farm in a rural Rwanda. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because it offered her the ability to develop her critical thinking skills. 

Ernestine plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to either work in business or become a journalist. A naturally hard worker, she wants to succeed enough in her career to support her siblings’ university educations.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college dgree

loans.name: Hingminnashi Eikhoi Punna Group

texts.en:
Anita runs a popular pickle making business in Manipur. The pickles she makes are high on demand. But she is finding it hard to meet the demand because of the shortage of raw materials. She needs to invest more in her pickle making business so she can meet the demand for a variety of pickles – mango pickle, amla pickle, lime pickle, mixed vegetable pickle, etc. A shortage of funds is the only thing that is holding her back. Hence, she formed a group with 4 other women who also want to expand their businesses but are not able to because of lack of capital. 

Mirabai, Mema, Maipakpi and Madhubala also run their own businesses in Manipur. They face a shortage of capital to invest in their businesses and hence are seeking a loan of Rs. 100,000. Your loan will help these women increase their income earning capacities and secure the future of their families. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her pickle making business

loans.name: Warmin Amtawipa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WARMIN AMTAWIPA” iniciará el  sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de pantalones, venta de salchipapas, venta de juguetes, venta de enaguas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de pantalones; da a conocer que este negocio lo hace quince años, da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al trabajar en una fábrica de costura y con los pocos ahorros se animó a abrir su taller de costura.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Warmin Amtawipa" will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Colipani regional center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Julia is the president. The businesses that the members of the association run are varied. Among them are: selling blankets, neighborhood store, selling perfumes, selling pants, selling salchipapas [a traditional street food containing beef and potatoes], selling toys, and selling underskirts.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrpreneurs, of whom Señora Julia is one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer six years ago, entering because of the invitation of a friend who was a client of the institution. She now has a  business of making and selling pants. She lets it be known that she has had this business for 15 years, and that she learned this business from working in a sewing factory. With her little savings, she was inspired to open her sewing workshop.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy fabric wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz, and after making the pants she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically, since she is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a widowed woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. Gladys operates a retail shop where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of goods.

Gladys will use this KES 52,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She repaid her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming activity by applying farmyard manure in order to improve productivity.

loans.name: Gadison

texts.en: Gadison is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more phone accessories. His business goal is to have a big spare parts shop within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more spare parts and phone accessories.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up with 5 siblings in a remote village in Rwanda and was only able to attend school with financial support. But, because of his dedication and impressive academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Emmanuel chose Kepler because it offers a strong business curriculum and ability to place students in prestigious internships. He plans to major in Communications with a concentration in Business, and he will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university.

After graduating, Emmanuel wants to either start his own business or work at a startup. Either way, his goal in life is to be successful enough to give back to his family and community.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more woods to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as honest. James operates a retail shop where he sells phone accessories, bags, sunglasses, and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds.
