James will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories and bags. He hopes that in the future he will open an M-pesa shop. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories, sunglasses, and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cassava, bananas, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Moise

texts.en:
Moise is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up in a family of three brothers and two sisters. Because of his impressive academic credentials, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Moise chose to attend Kepler because it provides competitive skills for students.

Moise plans to major in Communications with a concentration in Business and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. A hard worker, he hopes to develop his technology skills to a point where he can manage a business after graduating.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Maria Melba

texts.es:
María tiene 56 años y vive en la ciudad de Montería, en la costa atlántica colombiana. Vive con su pareja y sus 5 hijos, 4 mujeres y 1 hombre, quienes han sido el motor que motiva a esta madre a levantarse a diario para trabajar para brindarles lo mejor. Esta mujer tiene un negocio de confección de ropa para empresas, labor que desempeña con gran talento.

María quiere invertir en su negocio esperando que sus ventas puedan mejorar, y con estas, las ganancias que le deja su labor, por esto hoy pide un préstamo que le permita adquirir telas, hilos, materia prima y una máquina de coser que necesita. 

María tiene algunos problemas en la casa en la que actualmente vive con su familia, por eso sueña con poder realizarle las reparaciones que necesita para que su familia viva cómoda y segura. Puedes ayudarle a María a cumplir sus sueños y mejores sus negocios con un préstamo.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old and lives in the city of Montería on the Atlantic Colombian coast. She lives with her husband and their five children, four young women and one man, who have been the driving force that motivates her to get up every day to work to provide them with the best. She has a clothing making business, work that she carries out with great talent.  

María wants to invest in her business, hoping that her sales will improve and with that – the profits she makes. For this reason, today she is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase fabric, thread, raw materials and a sewing machine. 

María has a few problems with the house where she currently lives with her family, and because of that she dreams of being able to perform much needed repairs so that her family lives comfortably and safely. You can help María fulfill her dreams and improve her business with a loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, raw materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Fatou Makhane's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 31 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 30 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même village qui s'activent dans le commerce et l'embouche. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations.
FATOU debout à droite de la photo et levant la main  est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 4 garçons et 4 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle envisage de faire de l'embouche. Elle compte acheter 3 moutons à raison de 50 000 FCFA l'un. Elle achète aussi de l'aliment de bétail et du tourteau pour une valeur de 25 000 FCFA. Après élevage elle revend le mouton à 70 000 voire 75 000 FCFA. Avec le reste du prêt elle mène d'autres activités parallèles.
Avec les bénéfices elle va prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants car ils sont jeunes.
texts.en:
This group of 31 members is part of the 'banc villageois' which was created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of women from the same village who are active in commerce and in livestock farming. The women maintain good relationships with one another.

FATOU, standing at the right in the photo with hand raised, is 60 years old. She is a married mother of four boys and four girls.

With this loan in hand, she envisions fattening livestock. She intends to purchase 3 sheep at 50,000 francs CFA each. She is also purchasing some feed and some meal worth 25,000 francs. After raising them, she sells each sheep for 70,00 francs, or even 75,000 francs. With the rest of the loan, she has other work in parallel to do. The profits will be used to meet the children’s needs, since they are young.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Las Kantutitas De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS KANTUTAS DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de ganado de res, venta de hierbas medicinales.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que son cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus tías que son clientas de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de hierbas medicinales; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su prima.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hierbas y cremas medicinales por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Perú Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS KANTUTAS DE LOS ANDES (Kantutas of the Andes)" is on its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Pan America. It consists of eight members and is led by a board where Miriam is the President. Businesses that members engage include neighborhood store, food sales, cattle sales, and medicinal herbs sales.

Loan will benefit small business owners like Miriam. She is in her fourth cycle in Pro Mujer. She joined by the invitation of her aunts who are also clients of the institution. Today she has a business selling herbal medicine . She learned the trade from her cousin.

Current loan will increase the capital to buy wholesale herbs and medicinal creams from the vendors at Bolivia-Peru border. She will sell them at the fairs in the city of El Alto. This business allows her to generate financial resources to support her family. She is married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and healthcare that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale herbs and medicinal creams.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr: Lydia est une femme mariée de 33 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Mère de trois enfants, Lydia est une commerçante de pagnes qu’elle achète au marché deux fois par mois et le revend dans sa propre boutique dans le quartier. Pour commander des pagnes de haute qualité, Lydia demande ce prêt afin d’avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Lydia is a married woman, 33 years old, living in Adidogomé. The mother of three, she is merchant of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), which she buys at the market twice a month. She resells them in her own shop in the neighborhood. To put in an order for high-quality ‘pagne’ cloth, Lydia is asking for this loan in order to have a good profit margin and to support her husband in covering family expenses, as well as to allow her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 17 pairs of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Fatimata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois And défar guinaw rail a été crée le 05 Novembre 2013. Le groupe est  composé de  54 membres qui entretiennent de bonnes relations.
L’emprunteuse  en vedette OuryMoussa est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 1 fille. Elle a comme activité l’embouche ovine. Elle compte avec son prêt de 50000F acheter 02 moutons à  20000f  l’un qu’elle va élever. Elle a 5 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et écoule ses produits au niveau du marché central de la ville où la concurrence est tés visible dans ce secteur.
Avec ses bénéfices réalisées, elle compte acheter des marchandises à savoir les épices, savons, lait, biscuits etc.qu’elle va vendre dans le quartier et  compte épargner dans le BV afin de payer son prêt à la fin du cycle.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' named “And défar guinaw rail” was created on November 5, 2013. The group is composed of 54 members who maintain good relationships among themselves.

The featured borrower, Oury Moussa, is a married mother of five children, including a girl. The borrower’s business involves the fattening of sheep. With this loan of 50,000 francs, she intends to purchase 2 sheep at 20,000 francs each, which she will raise. She has five years of experience in this domain and sells her products at the town’s central market, where competition is very apparent in this sector.

With the profits earned, she plans on buying some merchandise, namely spices, soaps, milk, cookies, etc., that she will sell in the neighborhood. She plans on saving her money at the 'banc villageois' and to pay back her loan at the end of the cycle.

loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Las Puntuales De Seke Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PUNTUALES DE SEKE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Secretaria Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de coca, venta de juguetes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia ya que con los pocos ahorros decidió emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de galletas, dulces y gaseosas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que vive en unión libre.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association Las Puntuales de Seke [The Points of Seke] will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer [Pro Women] as part of the Focal Center of Collpani. It includes eight members and is governed by a board of directors where Marcela serves as the secretary. The businesses of the community association members, which help them get ahead, are varied: blanket sales, a neighborhood store, perfume sales, sportswear sales, coca leaf sales and toy sales. 

The loan will benefit small business owners including group member Marcela. She indicated that this is the first time that she has involved Pro Mujer, joining as a result of an invitation from the institution’s massive promotion in the area. Currently, she has a neighborhood store business. She learned this business several years ago on her own as she had little savings and decided to start this business. 

The loan that she would take out is for raising capital through the purchase of wholesale cookies, sweets and drinks, which she would acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and would later sell in her shop. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is in a common-law marriage. 

When asked why she likes Pro Mujer, Marcela replied that she likes the training and the life insurance the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cookies, sweets and drinks.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Akossiwa vit à Tokoin et vend du haricot préparé par elle-même afin de réaliser un revenu grâce à cette activité. Akossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander du haricot, Akossiwa demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir bien prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akossiwa, aged 30, is a married woman and the mother of four. She lives in Tokoin and sells cooked beans by herself to make a profit through this business. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. To put in an order for some beans, Akossiwa is asking for this loan to achieve her goals and to earn a good profit margin, so as to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 25 tubs of beans

loans.name: Banguka I Group

texts.fr:
Virginie  fait partie du groupe  Banguka et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 49 ans et est mariée à Berchmans ,un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 7 à 26 ans, dont  tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants amis de ses enfants qui étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est son neuvième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  avoir voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Virginie is part of the group Banguka and lives in Gitega. She is 49 years old and married to Berchmans, a farmer. Together they have six children, from 7 to 26 years old, all students. She supports two children, friends of her children, who are in school.

Virginie has been doing commerce in bananas for ten years.

She is on her 9th loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Sagamba Group

texts.fr:
Faustine  fait partie du groupe  Sagamba et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Aloys, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 9 ans, dont  3 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de  riz, de sel, … dans sa boutique  depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son septième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et de sel  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter un véhicule, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Faustine is part of the group Sagamba and lives in Gitega. She is 32 years old and married to Aloys, a merchant. Together they have four children, from 1 to 9 years old, of whom three are students.

Faustine has been doing commerce in rice, salt, … in her shop for six years.

She is on her 7th loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of rice and salt to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a vehicle and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice and salt to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Akouavi Nenamenawo

texts.fr: Akouavi  est une mère de deux enfants et âgée de 44 ans. Mariée, Akouavi est une femme qui habite à Tokoin et vend des gâteaux qu’elle même  cuit à base de la farine de blé dans le quartier. Akouavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché en vue d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants. Pour commander des  sacs de farines de blé et de l’huile, Akouavi demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et augmenter son taux de rentabilité afin de permettre à ses enfants un bon épanouissement.
texts.en: Akouavi is 44 years old and the mother of two children. A married woman, she lives in Tokoin and sells cakes she makes herself in her neighborhood. The cakes are made of wheat flour. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market with the aim of making the profit necessary for helping out her husband in meeting the needs of the children. To order sacks of wheat flour and some oil, Akouavi is asking for this loan to realize her purchase and to increase her profit margins, so as to allow her children to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of wheat flour and a container of oil

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more clothes to resell. This will enable her to increase sale hence more profits.She hopes that in the future she will open a boutique. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells milk and eggs. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more milk to resell. She hopes that in the future she will expand business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more milk to resell

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more clothes to resell. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business and open a boutique.

loans.use: buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Luwang Lup Group

texts.en:
33-year-old Indrani, the group leader, is a weaver by profession. She earns INR 3000 per month from her business. This income is not enough for her to raise 2 growing children. She wants her children to have access to educational opportunities and lead a healthy life. This is why she has decided to take a loan to expand her business.

Similarly, all the other members of the group, Ibemcha, Sumila, Debala and Bije, also need a loan to expand their respective businesses. So they decided to form a group and apply for a loan of INR 40,000. They will use the loan to increase their earning capacity by expanding their respective businesses.

loans.use: to expand her weaving business and sell chadars (head coverings) towels, etc.

loans.name: Akossiwa Akpedze

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Akossiwa est une jeune femme âgée de 24 ans. Exerçant son activité de revendeuse de pagnes et de mèches, Akossiwa habite à Tokoin. Akossiwa s’approvisionne au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Akossiwa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter  des pagnes et de mèches  en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité et pouvoir faire face aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: A married mother of two, Akossiwa is a young woman, 24 years old, living in Tokoin. She has a retail business selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and hair extensions. She gets her supplies at the market and resells the merchandise in nearby districts. Akossiwa needs this loan to purchase some ‘pagne’ cloth and hair extensions with the aim of making a good profit and meeting the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 3 lengths of 'pagne' cloth and 4 units of hair extensions

loans.name: Keres

texts.ru: Керес, 51 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Керес среднее образование, на протяжении 18 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть корова, 10 овец и лошадь. Разведение и перепродажа племенного скота приносит Керес хорошую ежемесячную прибыль. Также на 3,0 Га арендованной и 3,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает пшеницу, картофель и фасоль. Дополнительно работает реализатором в магазине. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Керес обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Keres is 51, married, and raising three children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past 18 years.  She has one cow, ten sheep and one horse on her farm.  Breeding and selling livestock brings her a good monthly income. She also grows wheat, potatoes and beans on three hectares of leased land and three hectares of her own land.  In addition to her farming activity, Keres also works as a vendor in a shop.

Eager to further develop her business, Keres has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some fertilizers for land cultivation and also to increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to invest the earnings from her loan to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to work her land and grow organic produce, and to buy livestock in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Amen

texts.fr: Amen est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans résidant à Baguida. Avec quatre enfants à charge, Amen est une revendeuse d’ignames frit et de pates dentifrices qu’elle achète au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Amen sollicite ce prêt pour commander des ignames, huile et tomates fraiches. Amen désire gagner  plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées dans son foyer.
texts.en: Amen is a married woman, 28 years old, living in Baguida. With four children to support, Amen is a retailer of fried yams and toothpastes, which she buys at the market and resells in nearby districts. Amen is requesting this loan to order some yams, oil, and fresh tomatoes. Her wish is to earn more profit to help cover the diverse day-to-day expenses she has at home.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bowls of yams, a container of oil, and a unit of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Sairagul

texts.ru: Сайрагул, 37 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сайрагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 20 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Сайрагул - около 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец для разведения. Доходы от кредита Сайрагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Saraigul is 37 years old, married and  the mother o f four. She has a college degree. As a source of income for her family, she raises livestock. Thanks to Saraigul's hard work, at present she has four cows and 20 sheep on her farm. Sairagul's monthly revenue is about 21,000 soms (KGS). 

In order to develop her farm further, she has applied to Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 150,000 KGS to buy calves and sheep for raising. Saraigul plans to use the resulting revenue for an additional increase of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional calves and lambs to increase her livestock.

loans.name: Noviembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres alegres, de la ciudad de Kamla, que se localiza a 20 kilómetros del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de granos básicos, accesorios para damas y artesanía; se organizaron hace 4 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

ANDREA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una señora amable de 45 años de edad, casadas. Su esposo es Maderero. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, vende  chiverías, fritos, queque de yuca, quequisque y pan de coco en una de las universidades del municipio. Esta solicitando financiamiento para diversificar su negocio y comprar en Managua prendas de acero y oro laminado: Cadenas, anillos, pulseras, aretes, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con establecer su propia pulpería.
texts.en:
This supportive group comprises three cheerful women in the city of Kamla, located 20 kilometers from the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are entrepreneurial women who fight day after day to grow their small businesses. They sell basic grains, women's accessories, and artisan work. The group formed 4 months ago in order to access loans with guaranteed support from Pana Pana.

Andrea is the coordinator of the group. She is a kind, 45-year-old woman. She is married, and her husband is Maderero. In order to have her own source of income and contribute to household expenses, she sells snacks, fried food, cassava cake, quequisque (yam-like vegetable), and coconut bread in one of the local universities.

She is requesting a loan to diversify her business and buy metal and gold-coated jewelry in Managua: chains, rings, bracelets, earrings, and other products. She dreams of opening her own general store.

loans.use: buy metal and gold-coated jewelry in Managua: chains, rings, bracelets, earrings, and other products.

loans.name: Zhumabubu

texts.ru: Жумабубу, 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад. Также занимается рукоделием. Благодаря упорному труду, Жумабубу на сегодняшний имеет хорошую прибыль от бизнеса - 17,000 сом в месяц (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумабубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zhumabubu is 50, married, and the mother of three children. She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which brings an income for her family and which she started 25 years ago. She is also involved in handicrafts.

Thanks to her very hard work, Zhumabubu currently makes a good income from her business - 17,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for breeding. She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her activity and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep and increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Tsimbatara Group

texts.fr:
Fidès  fait partie du groupe  Tsimbatara et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à Bosco ,un motard. Ensemble ils ont 2enfants âgés de 2 à 3 ans . 

Elle fait le commerce des bières de banane et industrielle  depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à son septième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de  bière à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire une belle maison ,et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Fidès  is a member of the Tsimbarata group and lives in Gitega. She is 29 years old and married to  Bosco, a motorbike taxi driver. They have two children, two and three years of age. Fidès  has been selling banana beer and commercially produced beer for six years. She is on her seventh loan with Turame. 

Thanks to the Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and stock up on cases on beer to resell in order to increase her earnings. In the years to come,  Fidès  would like to build a nice house and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to stock up on cases of beer for resale.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Agustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, servicio de construcción, venta de salchipapas, venta de frutas, tienda de barrio. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Agustina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de un asesor de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace varios años da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad económica por la que atravesaba. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces, galletas, gaseosas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la localidad de Patacamaya y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la confraternización con las integrantes de su Asociación Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Amigas por siempre" [Friends Forever] is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the organization's center in Senkata. It is made up of 9 members and is run by a board of directors, of which Agustina is the president.

The members of the communal bank make their living in various businesses, including sales of traditional blankets, food sales, construction services, kebab sales, fruit sales, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small micro-businesses, such as Agustina's. She says it's the first time that she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining because of the invitation in a promotion by one of the institution's advisers.

Currently, her business is a neighborhood store. She says that she learned the business from her parents many years ago, and she started it because of the economic necessity in which she found herself.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase the capital (to buy sweets, cookies, and soda wholesale) that she will acquire from the saleswomen of Patacamaya and later sell at her location. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family economically. She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes socializing with the members of her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sweets, cookies, and soda

loans.name: Alirio De Jesus

texts.es:
Alirio tiene 51 años y vive en el municipio de Itaguí, al norte de Medellín. Allí tiene un puesto de ventas donde ofrece distintos artículos como maletas, ropa, correas y otros elementos de uso doméstico. Su labor es ardua ya que es en las calles bajo el calor y la lluvia, pero siempre motivado en realizarlo para salir adelante.

Este hombre sabe lo dura que es la economía con los trabajadores independientes, que no pueden descuidar en ningún momento su negocio, por esto el busca sostenibilidad para que pueda estar más tranquilo en el futuro. Pide un préstamo que le permita comprar más mercancía (maletas, correas y ropa) y algunas herramientas de trabajo. 

Alirio tiene grandes sueños, entre ellos el de algún día tener su casa propia, para que allí pueda brindar seguridad a su familia. También espera tener la posibilidad de ofrecer empleo a más personas en un futuro. Ayuda a este hombre a alcanzar sus sueños con solo un préstamo.
texts.en:
Alirio is 51 years old and lives in the Itaguí municipality, in the north of Medellín. He has a street stand where he sells various items such as suitcases, clothing, belts, and other household products.

His work is arduous, as it is in the streets under the heat and rain, but he is always motivated to carry it out and move forward. This man knows how hard the economy is for independent workers, that they can not become careless with their businesses at any moment. He looks for stability so that he may be more relaxed in the future.

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise (suitcases, belts, clothing) and some work tools. Alirio has big dreams, including one day having his own house so he may provide security to his family. He also hopes to have the opportunity to offer employment to more people in the future. Help this man achieve his dreams with just one loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (suitcases, belts, clothing) and work tools.

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIOS CON NOSOTROS” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de fresco, venta de perfumes, venta de medias, venta de frutas. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Dios Con Nosotros" (God with us) communal bank will begin its ninth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Regional Center. The group is composed of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Justina is the president.

The businesses run by the communal bank's members are varied, including blanket sales, beverage sales, perfume sales, stocking sales, and fruit sales.

The loan that they take will benefit small business owners. Justina, a member of the group, mentions that they joined Pro Mujer five years ago after receiving an invitation from a consultant who is a part of the institution. Currently she has a business selling blankets. This business began several years ago through her own initiative.

This current loan is to increase capital (wholesale wool), which she will buy from vendors in the city of El Alto and then sell in her store. This work will allow her to generate resources to economically support her family, as she is married with three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health care offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Binolata Group

texts.en:
Ibempishak, the group leader of Binolata Group runs a business making baked goods like biscuits, bread and various snacks. This enterprising 48-year-old woman from Imphal, in the eastern part of India, is seeking a loan to expand her business by purchasing more raw materials and looking to increase her production.

The other members of the group are also engaged in various income generation activities like selling dry fish and embroidery. As the prices of raw materials have risen dramatically, it is becoming difficult to expand their businesses. Hence they decided to form a group and applied for a loan from YMF, a partner of Milaap. They are well aware of the group rules and agreed to abide by them. They are thankful to the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her bakery which sells bread, biscuits and assorted snacks.

loans.name: Samir Moises

texts.es:
Samir tiene 44 años y vive en el municipio de Momil en la costa atlántica colombiana, allí está con su pareja y sus 6 hijos, los cuales son su principal motivación. Este hombre tiene un negocio de cría de ganado, labor que lleva haciendo por muchos años.

El desea que su negocio sea sostenible para poder seguir brindando soporte a toda su familia. Hoy pide un préstamo con el fin de invertir en su negocio, planea comprar cerdos, alimento, leche y vacunas, todo con el fin de mejorar su inventario.

Samir encuentra su casa en malas condiciones, por esto, uno de sus sueños es poder reparar los daños que tiene para que su familia tenga mejor calidad de vida. Puedes ayudar a Samir a cumplir sus sueños con solo un préstamo que le brinde lo que necesita.
texts.en:
Samir is 44 years old and lives in the town of Momil, on the Atlantic Coast of Colombia. He lives there with his spouse and 6 children, who are his biggest motivation. He has a business raising cattle, something he has been doing for many years.

He would like for his business to be sustainable to continue to be able to support his whole family. Today, he is asking for a loan to invest in his business. He plans to purchase pigs, fodder, milk and vaccines, all in order to improve his inventory

Samir's house is in bad condition, which is why one of his dreams is to be able to repair it, so that his family has a better quality of life. You can help Samir fulfill his dreams with a loan that will give him what he needs.

loans.use: purchase pigs, fodder, milk and vaccines

loans.name: Lila Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres alegres (Georgina, Beatriz y Laurenda), pertenecen a la etnia miskita de la comunidad de Lamalaya, en miskito significa agua mansa, que se localiza a 10 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos; se organizaron hace 2 años para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario Lila porque les gusta el color, es bonito, alegre.

Georgina: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, con cualidades de líder, es casada, tiene 32 años, con 2 hijos: El mayor de 10 años cursa su cuarto grado de primaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como taxista. Desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para poder comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una tienda donde venda ropa, especialmente ropa usada que es lo que más demanda la población actualmente
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three cheerful women (Georgina, Beatriz y Laurenda). They belong to the Miskito ethnic community of Lamalaya. Miskito means calm water. They are located 10 kilometers from Bilwi city, in Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are entrepreneurial women that fight each day to grow their small business selling seafood. They organized two years ago in order to access joint liability loans in Pana Pana. They decided to name the solidarity group Lila [‘Lilac’] because they like the color, which is beautiful and cheerful.

Georgina is the coordinator of the solidarity group, is a kind woman, with leadership qualities, is married, 32 years old, and has two children: The eldest is 10 years old and studies in her fourth grade at elementary school and the youngest is 4 year old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. For seven years she has been selling fish and seafood, in this way generating her own income and contributing to the household expenses and to the studies of her son. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase more fish and seafood products to sell, to increase her income and to serve more people who demand these products which make up one of the basic foodstuffs in Bilwi. She dreams of obtaining sufficient capital to establish a shop where she sells clothes, especially used clothes that is what most people now demand.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and seafood products.

loans.name: Sindy Sadith

texts.es:
Sindy tiene tan solo 18 años y vive en el municipio de Momil en la costa atlántica colombiana. Este mismo año, esta joven decidió comenzar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía, pensando en salir adelante y ser más independiente, ahora es una emprendedora que lucha por lo que quiere. 

Como no lleva mucho con su negocio ha sido difícil encontrar el capital económico para impulsar su negocio, razón por la cual pide un préstamo que le permita comprar vitrinas y mercancía como ollas y ropa de catálogo. Esta segura que con esta ayuda podrá hacer crecer su negocio y volverlo sostenible.

Sindy sueña con poder arreglar su casa ya que no está en buenas condiciones, porque con esto su familia y ella podrán vivir más tranquilos y seguros. Puedes ayudar a Sindy a lograr todos sus sueños con solo un préstamo.
texts.en:
Sindy is only 18 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil on the Atlantic coast of Colombia. This year, this young woman decided to start her own business selling merchandise, thinking about moving forward and being more independent. Now she is an entrepreneur who works hard for what she wants.

Because she has not had this business for very long, it has been difficult to find the economic capital to move her business forward. This is why she is asking for a loan which will allow her to buy display cases and merchandise like pots and pans and clothing from catalogs. She is sure that she will be able to grow her business and make it sustainable with this help.

Sindy dreams of being able to repair her home since it is not in good condition. With this, she and her family could live peacefully and safely. You can help Sindy make her dreams come true with just one loan.

loans.use: to buy a display case and merchandise like pots and pans and products from a catalog.

loans.name: Jean Eric

texts.en:
Jean Eric is a first year student at Kepler. He grew up in eastern Rwanda, and has five siblings who are currently in secondary school. Due to his strong academic record, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because it provides the technology training and business communication skills necessary for his career.

Jean Eric plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to work in the private sector, while also working on his own side projects that utilize his entrepreneurial spirit. His goal is to be in a position to support his family, his community, and his country.

A hard worker, he has taken on leadership roles at every level of his education.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is a first year student at Kepler in Rwanda. His mother is a cook at a hotel in Kigali, and his siblings are both currently in school. He was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because it offers exposure to international courses and a rigorous academic curriculum.

An outstanding student, Ezra plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, he hopes to become a software developer, and is using his time at Kepler to develop those technical skills.

In his free time, Ezra likes to play soccer, paint, and draw.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Mildred Cecilia

texts.es:
Mildred tiene 31 años y vive en el municipio de Momil, Córdoba, con sus 2 hermosas hijos de tan solo 8 y 5 años, quienes son la principal motivación de esta madre para salir adelante, para trabajar arduamente y brindarles lo mejor. Ella tiene un negocio de cría de ganado el cual comenzó gracias a su madre quien le enseñó todo lo que debía saber.

Mildred quiere hacer de su negocio algo sostenible para así tener una seguridad económica para su familia, por eso hoy quiere invertir en su negocio y pide un préstamo que le permita comprar cerdos, alimentos, vacunas y vitaminas para así impulsar su negocio.

Esta madre responsable sueña con algún día poder dejar un negocio exitoso a sus hijos, por eso trabaja tanto. Puedes ayudar a Mildrer a cumplir sus sueños y mejorar su negocio con solo un préstamo que podría cambiar su vida.
texts.en:
Mildred is 31 years old and lives in the town of Momil, Cordoba, with her two beautiful children, of 8 and 5 years of age. They are the main motivation for this mother to get ahead, work hard and give them the best. She has a business raising livestock, which she begun thanks to her mother, who taught her everything she needed to know.

Mildred would like to make her business sustainable in order to have financial stability for her family. This is the reason she wants to invest in her business and is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase pigs, fodder, vaccines and vitamins to help her boost her business.

This responsible mother dreams of being able to pass on a successful business to her children, which is why she works so hard. You can help Mildred fulfill her dream and improve her business with a loan that could change her life.

loans.use: purchase pigs, fodder, vitamins and vaccines

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie is a first year student at Kepler. She grew up with her mother and three brothers on a farm in a rural area of eastern Rwanda. Because of Marie’s impressive academic credentials, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Marie plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to work in health care in order to give back to her family and her country.

The thing she wants most from her education is to become fluent in the use of technology. And beyond that, to acquire the writing and critical thinking skills to meet her goals.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta is a first year student at Kepler. She grew up with her two younger sisters in the countryside of western Rwanda. Due to her tremendous academic potential, Redempta was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

She plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, Redempta hopes to be able to support herself and her family with a great career in the private sector.

She loves reading and playing the piano.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
After Lea went through her divorce she moved with her four children to a new city and ‎re-established her cosmetics business. Lea provides beauty treatments and trainings for other women in cosmetics. Lea has succeeded in establishing and ‎developing her business and now wants to strengthen it with expansion.‎

She needed this loan to pay for training and materials for a new skin treatment as well as for ‎cosmetics and supplies.‎

Lea wants to see her business grow while she continues to develop the training programs and ‎courses she is giving.‎

loans.use: to pay for training and materials for a new skin treatment as well as for cosmetics and supplies.‎

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a first year student at Kepler. He is 19 years old and grew up on a small farm in eastern Rwanda with his father and two brothers. Because of his incredible academic performance in secondary school, Joseph was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

He plans to study Business Information Technology, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, Joseph hopes to found a technology business and use the profits from that to support and educate orphaned youth.

He enjoys playing soccer and is very, very good at juggling.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a 54-year-old man, who is single, and has no children. He lives in his mother's house. He has been dedicating his life to taking care of her.

He makes a living by driving a truck around the country transporting stationery merchandise for a bank and he would like to take a 10,000 MXN (ten thousand pesos) loan to buy merchandise and sell it during his trips over the country in order to make an extra income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in framed batik art. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wooden frames, chip board, and calico.

Emmanuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:
Emmanuel honed his artistic skills in Nigeria. "I worked with a company that exported African arts and crafts. We toured the whole of Nigeria buying goods. It was on one of these tours that I came across this type of artwork and fell in love with it. I modified it and in the process created something new and unique. I decided to come back home to continue with this new-found talent. I derive my motifs from social, cultural and historic events."

"I am very grateful to you all for helping me to further improve on my business through this micro-credit."

Use the link below to view Emmanuel's framed batik art on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/649

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Imtiyaz

texts.en:
Imtiyaz is a weaver from India who specializes in silk and wool shawls. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials and bring on additional weavers at his workshop.

Imtiyaz has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:
"My grandmother used to weave shawls and then sell them. Since we were a large family, I remember spending most of my time with my grandmother. She loved me so much. My father weaves shawls, and my uncle weaves carpets, so I know quite a bit about the art of weaving. However, I've been more fascinated with the beauty and elegance of Kashmiri shawls."

"I am thankful to you for helping me out. I dream of making and sending my crafts to every part of the world, but without enough capital I can never realize my dream."

Use the link below to view Imtiyaz's silk and wool shawls on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/5764

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials and bring on additional weavers at his workshop

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Julius. He is married and has three children aged 6, 4, and 1 year. In 2011 Julius established his bar and restaurant business. He began his business because he wants to provide a livelihood for his family. Working 6 days a week, 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Julius requires a loan in order to buy 15 crates of soft drinks, 10 crates of star bear, 5 Heineken, and 3 cartons of Cody’s for resale in his restaurant.

The weather disrupts the running of bars which affected him in that he could not meet all his plans. In the future Julius still plans to become an international businessman, educate his children to university level, and build his own house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and food for resale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 31-year-old woman who is happily married and has no children. She makes a living by selling cloths and cosmetics on a street market. She is asking for a MXN 10,000.00 (ten thousand pesos) loan to buy merchandise and make an extra benefit from the season.

She has had previous loans and she repaid on time and without problems for them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Ramata. She is married and has four children aged 22, 17, 9 and 7 years. In 2007, Ramata established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to help in the smooth running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are men and women. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,700,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ramata requires a loan in order to buy more bamako materials, Senegal suits, wax cotton, and cosmetics materials for resale.

In the future Ramata still plans to become an international businesswoman, and give a quality education to her children up to university level. She thanks Kiva for their support which has really improved the livelihood of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more clothing materials.

loans.name: Moses Bai

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Moses Bai. He is single and has one child, aged 8. In 2009, Moses Bai established his pharmacy business. He began his business as a way of becoming self-employed and to develop himself. His business is located in the outskirts of the city.

Moses has just completed repayment on his second loan and now requires a third loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Moses Bai intends to use this loan to buy more medicines for his business. He hopes that this loan will help him attract more customers and enable him to stock his pharmacy with quality medicines.

Moses used the proceeds from his last loan to support his child’s education, extend his pharmacy and improve on the livelihood of his family.

Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, Moses Bai earns about SLL 1,600,000 every month from this business. In the future, he plans to further improve his business to become a renowned medical practitioner and provide a good education for the only child he has for now.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Dagoberto Raul

texts.es:
Dagoberto tiene tan solo 21 años y vive Cerete, en la costa colombiana; allí tiene un negocio de cría de ganado desde el año pasado, que heredó de su familia y que decidió continuar con el deseo de mantener la tradición además de tener mayor independencia pues siempre está pensando en salir adelante.

Para este joven el negocio que maneja es altamente competitivo en el sector en el que se encuentra, por eso el desea mejorar sus niveles de producción de manera que se posicione en el mercado. El pide un préstamo con el fin de comprar más cerdos y realizar unas adecuaciones locativas al lugar donde se encuentran los animales.

Para Dagoberto su familia es de suma importancia, sin contar lo agradecido que está por el negocio que recibió, por esto su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive con su familia. Ayuda a este joven emprendedor a lograr todo lo que quiere con un préstamo.
texts.en:
Dagoberto is 21 years old and lives in Cerete, on the Colombian coast. There he has had a livestock breeding business since last year, which he inherited from his family and that he decided to continue with due to his desire to keep traditions as well as having greater independence. He is always thinking about getting ahead.

For this youth, the business he manages is in a highly competitive industry. As such he desires to improve his production levels so that it is well positioned in the market. He requests a loan in order to purchase more pigs and make adjustments to where the animals are located.

Beyond how grateful he is for the business that he inherited, for Dagoberto family is important. Because of this, his dream is to improve the conditions of his home, where he lives with his family. Help this young entrepreneur to achieve all that he wants with a loan.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and change location

loans.name: Coke Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Hassanatu is a member of Coke Solidarity Group (see group picture, Hassanatu stands in the middle). She sells foofoo (a dough-like food often made from cassava and served with soup).

Hassanatu has been selling foofoo for the past four years. She uses the proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family. She has been able to buy a piece of land from savings she made from her business.

Hassanatu and the other members of Coke Solidarity Group are requesting their first loan. Hassanatu and her group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Hassanatu will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to purchase bags of raw foofoo for her business.

Hassanatu is thirty-two years old, married and has three children; twins aged sixteen years and a four-year-old. Hassanatu hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate her children well.

Hassanatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase bags of raw foofoo for her business

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.en:
Carlos is a 29-year-old man who lives with his girlfriend. They both have a young son who is their economic dependent. They live with more family.

Carlos makes a living by working on a taco stand which he owns. It is a street stand located on the outside of a hospital.

He is asking for a 7,000 MXN (seven thousand pesos) loan to buy fixed assets for his business, like tables and chairs. With those he may increase his income and improve his stand.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets such as chairs and tables.

loans.name: Agim

texts.en:
Agim is 39 years old and the father of two children. He lives in the southern part of Kosovo with his family. Although he is employed with the Army, the salary is very low and not enough to meet all of the family expenses. Because of their lack of money, he and his wife have started their own business from home working as a tailor and seamstress. His wife was able to take a course to learn the trade and now they have been able to begin to add additional income to their budget.

Agim is requesting a loan in order to purchase material for making different clothing for both men and women. With the new material they purchase they will be able to offer more variety and better quality products to their customers. His goal is to expand their business and open a shop. They are very grateful for this opportunity to improve their family's life.

loans.use: to purchase material for making different clothing for both men and women.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a businesswoman in Mukuru Kayaba. She owns twenty-three rental units in the area that have been in existence since 1997.

Currently, she is in the process of revamping these units and one of her goals is to ensure improved toilet facilities for her tenants. In the past, her tenants used makeshift options that are not only unsanitary but also unsafe, particularly in the night due to insecurity at Kayaba.

By joining the Fresh Life Toilets venture, she anticipates that there will be reduced rates of tenant turn over owing to poor toilet facilities and ultimately there will be improved sanitation at her plot area.

She is seeking to acquire one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Canasta De Flores Group

texts.en:
Santa Cruz del Quiché is a large town in the highlands of Guatemala and serves as the capital of the Department of Quiche, one of the most populous departments in the country. The population is predominantly of Mayan descent.

“Canasta de Flores” or “Flower Basket” is the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank formed by eleven women who are about to begin their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. The ladies are lively and enthusiastic and highly motivated to strengthen and expand their small businesses. Some of these businesses include animal husbandry (chickens, pigs, goats, and cattle), farming (onions, corn and tomatoes), sale of their farm produce, a tortilla shop and a convenience store. The ladies have between four and seven children. They share common dreams of educating their children, seeing them prosper and contribute to society, and succeeding in their lives. The ladies are requesting a loan from KIVA investors.

Vicenta is the 50 year old President of the Trust Bank who has seven children. She invested her first loan in her convenience store. With her profits, Vicenta was able to buy chickens and goats to realize additional income. She is requesting a new loan to buy more inventory for her store including beans, rice, noodles, oil, eggs and soft drinks. Vicenta and the ladies in the Trust Bank appreciate the monthly educational trainings given by a Friendship Bridge Facilitator in their own language. The Facilitator uses games, drawings and role playing to involve the women in the lessons. Topics can include the use of medicinal plants, hygiene and health, empowerment and self-esteem as well as setting goals and realizing dreams.

All of the women express their gratitude to KIVA investors for funding their much-needed loans. They are looking forward to a brighter and more prosperous future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her store including beans, rice, noodles, oil, eggs and soft drinks

loans.name: Bayanzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayanzul is 45 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She teaches at kindergarten and her husband provides taxi services to local people. Their son works in Korea on labor contracts. 

Using her previous loan, she has renovated her house and now they live in a comfortable and warm place. Due to rising prices of food, she and her husband decided to grow vegetables within a green house on their land. So, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to pay workers who will build the green house. The green house will be used for a very long time, and she and her husband will grow vegetables even during winter in the next decade.

loans.use: to pay builders for building a green house.

loans.name: Fema

texts.en:
Fema is only 29 years old, and is a college graduate who happened to find a hard time looking for a stable job. For that reason, while waiting for an opportunity for work, she runs a sari-sari store business which she started three years ago at Sta. Barbara, Iloilo.

Here, she sells different products and grocery items which are fit to satisfy the demand. With this trade, she earns a living, basically an average of PHP 3,000 per month which is quite enough to support the daily needs of her family. 

However, she doesn’t want to settle in this kind of life they have right now. She has a dream of being successful someday. That is why, with all possible means she is working hard to reach for her aspirations. 

As of now, she comes to you for a cause. She wants to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store. Assuring you that she will improve her business with this loan, she is truly hoping that you can help her start a brighter future for her and of her family. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ngek's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Battambang province, Ngek is a 57-year-old mother of three children. Her job is a teacher, which it is the main source of family’s income. She sometimes works for others for a fee and raises chickens for sale to supplement her income. She has been involved in her teaching job for years and it earns her about 35,000 KHR per day. 

Ngek has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles already. This past loan was fully repaid and it enabled her to provide sufficient food for her family. In this group of four members, Ngek is a leader and she will use her entire loan to buy chickens, food for nourishing and to build chicken cages to support her chicken raising business. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to achieve her dreams of renovating the house and providing family members with ample protein foods.

loans.use: to buy chickens, food for nourishing and to build chicken cages to support her chicken raising business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, micro-finance institutions (M.F.Is) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers.

Meet James, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest husband. He hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. He loves and treasures his family and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. James earns income through selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures he has been able to earn a decent income.

He is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for the past two years, and throughout, he has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble husband has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". He faces financial challenges, and because the Nkubu area has proven a ready market for cereals, he is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve his income.

James upbringing was challenging, and he has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling dad has been making great improvements in life, and he believes that through your loan he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, James has received training and he has proven to be honest and disciplined with his finances. He intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from his business.

James is a visionary and - with his accumulated profits - hopes he will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost his income and turn his life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale.

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita is 37 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anacorita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Anacorita has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent, Conchita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling feeds in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.  Conchita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to  buy additional sacks of feeds to sell for her business.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to re-sell.

loans.name: Yonas

texts.en:
Yonas came to the United States from Ethiopia in 1998. He worked in food service in his country, so when he arrived in the U.S., he got a job at McDonald’s. From there he worked with the military and various other organizations to provide physical labor. 

In 2006, he found the taxi business to be a good job through a friend’s recommendations, so he decided to become a driver. He has been driving a taxi in San Diego for the past nine years, mainly transporting customers to and from the airport.

Because of new laws in San Diego County, taxi drivers are now able to purchase their own medallions and therefore own their own taxi businesses. When Yonus heard about the releasing of the medallions, he decided to establish his own sole proprietorship in March 2015. With the release of the medallion, the business will shift as Yonas will own the vehicle he drives and therefore not be responsible for weekly lease payments. He will remain a driver for the same cab company and retain his customers, however, he will avoid high lease payments.

Yonas will use this Kiva loan to purchase the taxi medallion as well as equip his vehicle with a meter and camera.

Yonas currently lives in an apartment with his wife and two children. He is excited about this opportunity to provide for his family by becoming a business owner.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi medallion and equip his vehicle with a meter and camera.

loans.name: Gilconida

texts.en:
Gilconida is 42 years old and has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Gilconida is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Jovita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Judita

texts.en:
Judita is 60 years old and married. She has six children.

Judita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from food vending.

Judita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Judita has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan.

Judita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Iryna

texts.en:
A motorcycle enthusiast, Iryna established her business, I & J Motorcycles, in January 2014, but officially opened in June 2015.

Iryna worked at her previous employer, a motorcycle transport company, for three years. During her time with the company, her passion for motorcycles led her to eventually take charge of the entire operation.

After that business was closed, Iryna decided to follow her dreams and start her own business. She kept getting calls and emails from former customers, so she knew there was a need in the market that she could fill with her knack for customer service.

I & J Motorcycles will focus on acting as a licensed export packer and warehouse of motorcycles. The main part of the business services provided is shipping containers with power sport vehicles/parts overseas.

Iryna will use her Kiva loan to purchase a work truck and trailer, so she can transport products.

loans.use: to purchase a work truck and trailer.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
This is Shiela, 45 years old, from the far province of Sta. Barbara, Iloilo. She is a mother of two children and married to Roy.

Today, she is working for a direct selling business where she distributes personal products from Avon (a popular direct-selling brand in the Philippines) to customers in different areas in their hometown.

Shiela has been doing this for many years and she has been so hard-working and passionate in her industry. Her business commonly offers items like perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, shirts, bags, shoes, etc.

She wants to further improve her trade, but sometimes financial constraints slow her down in doing this. Therefore, she comes to Kiva to address this issue.

She wants humbly to borrow a loan worth PHP 15,000 that she will use in buying more merchandise to offer to her customers. This will become a great opportunity for her to build her business and earn enough to save for her family's future security.

She truly hopes for your sympathy.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Lydia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elvie

texts.en:
Ma. Elvie is 40 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Elvie has been in this business for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Ma. Elvie is borrowing 5,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
“I want to expand my business because I want my children to finish their studies someday. There is nothing more that I can give to them but the quality education, which will lead them to better lives and careers,” said Henry, 42, from Sta. Barbara, Iloilo.

For three years now, Henry has been operating a food vending business in an elementary school canteen in Sta. Barbara. This is a good source of income for him since his common patrons are students, faculty and staff. With his various food products and dishes, he is able to earn at least PHP 15,000 a month, which serves as remedy for their family’s diverse expenses and needs.

He is married to Belleza, and together, they are dreaming to upgrade their socio-economic status. Starting to work for their aspiration, he wants to develop his inventory by asking a loan that he will use to purchase more ingredients and food products for sale. PHP 40,000 pesos will be enough to realize this.

With hope and trust, he believes that you will help him grasp a better future ahead.

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the religion he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and food products for sale.

loans.name: Odomxay Group

texts.en:
Peuang’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Peuang and her group are excited that water filters were available on a payment plan that makes them much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Peuang and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their familys' budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Peuang’s family, will identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maria Esi

texts.en:
Maria Esi is 37 years old and married. She has five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Esi has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Maria Esi is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 57 years old and has two children.

Pacita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Pacita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Pacita has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan.

Pacita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: El Obraje Group

texts.es:
Las comunidades del Estado de México son conocidas por conservar sus tradiciones y festividades.
