El 7 de diciembre una localidad festeja a la virgen de la Concepción donde no puede faltar el espectáculo de luces que ofrecen los fuegos artificiales; los habitantes, al ser muy amigables, se reúnen para compartir alimentos y recorrer las calles con la imagen religiosa. Por otro lado, los demás días del año se dedican a la cría de animales o bien al cultivo de maíz.
   Ma. Braulia representa los valores tradicionales de su comunidad, es decir, es trabajadora, responsable y dedicada a su familia. Tiene ocho hijos de los cuales sólo dos dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo José, uno de sus hijos estudia una carrera universitaria motivo que llena de orgullo a la familia. 
  Doña Mary, como le dicen de cariño, decidió que para aportar a los ingresos en su matrimonio y la educación de sus hijos debería esforzarse al máximo. "Aunque no contaba con ayuda para cuidar a mis hijos, decidí iniciar con la cría de animales como pollos, borregos y cerdos para tener mis ganancias" comentó. Actualmente adquiere los animales en su municipio y una vez crecidos los vende con sus vecinos o incluso llegan a comprar de otras comunidades. La clave para que su actividad prospere es que en realidad ama lo que hace y trata con amabilidad a sus clientes. Hasta ahora su negocio ha dado los resultados esperados, sobre todo con la venta de pollos y ovejas. El préstamo que solicita le ayudará a comprar más pollos y alimento pues su única meta es aumentar su producción para así continuar apoyando a su hijo estudiante. 
 Los integrantes del grupo son Monica, Ma del Carmen, Hugo y Faustino quienes invertiran en cerdos, Laura y Angel en borregos, Gustavo en becerros, Marco Antonio y Gabriela en pollos.
* La fotografía fue tomada junto a los pollos, Doña Mary es quien viste el suéter color negro y la blusa color blanca*
texts.en:
The communities in the state of Mexico are known for keeping their traditions and festivals. On December 7, a community celebrates la Virgen de la Concepción where one can't miss the spectacle of lights that is made by the fireworks. The inhabitants, being very friendly, get together to share food and go around the streets with the religious image. On the other hand, the rest of the year they work raising animals or growing corn.

Ma Braulia represents the traditional values of her community, which is to say she is hard-working, responsible, and dedicated to her family. She has eight children of whom only two depend economically on her and her husband, José. One of her children is studying for a university degree, which fills the family with pride.

Doña Mary, as she is called with love, decided that to contribute to her husband's income and the education of her children, she should work as hard as possible. "Although I didn't have help caring for my children, I decided to begin raising animals such as chickens, lambs, and pigs to have my earnings," she said. Currently, she gets the animals in her municipality and once they are grown, she sells them to her neighbors or people even come to buy them from other communities. The key for this activity to prosper is that in reality she loves what she does and treats her customers warmly. Up to now, her business has given the expected results, especially with the sale of chickens and sheep. The loan that she is requesting will help her purchase more chickens and feed since her only goal is to expand her production so to continue supporting her son who is a student.

The members of the group are Monica, Ma del Carmen, Hugo and Faustino who will invest in pigs, Laura and Angel in lambs, Gustavo in calves, Marco Antonio and Gabriela in chickens.

*The photo was taken with the chickens. Doña Mary is the one in the black sweater and white blouse.*

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed.

location.town: El Obraje, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools, furniture and supplies to make pastries so to generate better living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
The benches, tables, and cabinets we usually see inside our homes come from the creative and skillful hands of furniture makers like Pedro, a 32-year-old father from Sta. Barbara, Iloilo. He is married to Janice and hand-in-hand they manage their furniture shop situated at San Sebastian, a place near their residence.

Two years ago, they started this business until it gradually developed. Now, they have five employees with them helping to maintain their inventory. This is a milestone for them, since this business supports their family by providing for their daily living expenses.

Today, Pedro wants to further enhance this business through a loan from Kiva worth PHP 15,000. He will utilize this to buy additional equipment to make furniture and to purchase other materials needed. This will surely help Pedro to be more efficient.

Dedicated to success, Pedro assures you that he will view your help as a blessing and will work even harder to faithfully repay your goodness and generosity.

He meets weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to buy additional equipment and other materials to make furniture

loans.name: Sirena Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por 3 mujeres muy emprendedoras, que se organizaron hace 4 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

ALICE JULE: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer jovial, con cualidades de líder, es casada, tiene 33 años, con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Pertenece a la etnia miskita, de la comunidad de Lamlaya, en miskito significa agua Mansa y se localiza a 10 kilómetros de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y de los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para poder comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una tienda donde venda ropa, especialmente ropa usada que es lo que más demanda la población actualmente.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 3 very enterprising women who organized themselves 4 years ago with the goal of accessing financing to improve their living conditions, to be able to cover the basic needs of their households, assure their children's education and expand their businesses.

Alice Jule is the coordinator of this solidarity group. She is a jovial woman, with leadership qualities. She is married, is 33 years old, with 3 teenage children who are in primary and secondary school. She is of the Miskita ethnicity, from the community of Lamlaya, which in Miskito means calm water, and is located 10 kilometers from the city of Bilwi. For the past seven years she has worked selling fish and shellfish, in this way she generates her own income and contributes to the household expenses and to her child's education.

She is asking for the loan to be able to purchase more shellfish and fish products to sell and increase her income and serve more people who want this product which constitutes one of the basic foods in Bilwi. She dreams of managing to have enough capital to establish a store where she sells clothing, especially used clothing which is what people currently want the most.

loans.use: to be able to purchase shellfish and fish products.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 24 años y vive en el municipio de Momil, Córdoba, donde tiene un negocio de cría de ganado desde el año pasado, ya que decidió volverse un emprendedor y ser independiente. Es un hombre responsable que asume su trabajo con mucho compromiso, siempre pensando en salir adelante.

El sabe que lo importante de un negocio es ser sostenible en el tiempo para que pueda ser funcional, de manera que quiere invertir en el para poder impulsarlo. Hoy llega a pedir un préstamo que le permita comprar cerdos, lechones, alimento, vitaminas y vacunas.

Francisco sueña con tener una muy buena calidad de vida y poderle brindar lo mismo a su familia, por eso siempre se levanta lleno de motivación para cumplir sus sueños. Usted puede ser parte de este y muchos logros más de este hombre, un préstamo lo ayudará mucho.
texts.en:
Francisco is 24 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil, Córdoba, where he has had a business raising livestock for the past year, since he decided to become an entrepreneur and be independent. He is a responsible man who takes on his work with a lot of commitment, always thinking of getting ahead.

He knows that the important part of a business is to be sustainable over time so that it can be functional, so that he wants to invest in it to be able to give it a boost. Now he asks for a loan that will allow him to purchase pigs, piglets, feed, vitamins and vaccines.

Francisco dreams of having a very good quality of life and to be able to offer the same to his family, so he always gets up full of motivation to realize his dreams. You can be part of this and many other achievements of this man, a loan will help him a lot.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, piglets, feed, vitamins and vaccines.

loans.name: Luz De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LOS ANDES” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces y nueces, venta de queso, venta de condimentos, venta de chompas, venta de frutas, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces y nueces; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por la necesidad económica por la que atravesaba ya que este negocio lo emprendió de manera independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces y nueces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la frontera Perú Bolivia y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LUZ DE LOS ANDES” communal bank group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana. It is made up of eight members and is directed by officers, of whom Amalia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank group carry out are varied and among them are sweets and nut sales, cheese sales, seasoning sales, sweater sales, fruit sales, and cheese sales.

The loan that they will get out will benefit the small business owners of whom Amalia is one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling sweets and nuts. She explains that she learned this business some years ago due to economic necessity that she was experiencing, and that she learned this business independently.

The loan that she will now get is to increase her capital (purchase sweets and nuts in bulk) which she will get from the wholesalers at the border of Peru and Bolivia and later will sell them at the fairs in the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate resources to help her family economically since she is married and has three children.

Asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health center and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy supplies such as rice, oil, beef, vegetables, and fruit.

loans.name: Maryuris Esther

texts.es: Mayuris de 48 años, es una microempresaria que decidió utilizar sus ahorros en su proyecto de negocio; ella identificó que el municipio de Galapa donde reside una de sus principales actividades es la ganadería y cerca de su vivienda existe un desolladero de ganado, el cual ofrece los diferentes cortes de carnes de excelente calidad a buenos precios,  así que no dudó ni un instante en comprar carne y ofrecer a sus conocidos, amigos y referidos. Con la finalidad de incrementar sus ventas al concebir que la demanda es bastante significativa para su escasa capacidad de compra, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en distintos cortes de carnes; lomo, espaldilla, paleta, panza, y demás variedad.  Su meta a futuro es tener un local comercial y realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mayuris is 48 years old, and she is a micro-entrepreneur that decided to use her savings in a business project. She lives in the city of Galapa where one of the main industries is ranching, and there is a slaughterhouse close to her home which sells different cuts of meat of excellent quality at good prices. She didn't hesitate for one moment to buy the meat and offer it to her acquaintances, friends, and other referred people.

With the goal of increasing her sales at realizing that the demand is too significant for her limited purchasing ability, she is applying for her first credikiva by way of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With her loan, she will buy different cuts of beef: loin, shoulder clod, shoulder, belly, and others. Her future goal is to have a commercial location, and to do renovations to her home.

loans.use: to buy different cuts of beef: loin, shoulder clod, shoulder, belly, and others.

loans.name: Lidys Del Carmen

texts.es: Lidys de 28 años es una microempresaria que en compañía de su cónyuge, inició su proyecto de negocio; al contar con el conocimiento de su cónyuge, quien había realizado estudios de panadería y repostería, no dudo ni un instante que sería todo un éxito aperturar una Panadería en su población.  Hoy en día, cuentan con cinco años de ofrecer a los residentes del municipio de Galapa, productos elaborados con calidad, higiene y frescura, manteniendo una gran variedad a buenos precios.  Todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. ya está listo el pan, los deditos horneados, pasteles de queso con bocadillo, jugos naturales, avenas, y demás bebidas que exhibe desde su mostrador, para que sus clientes realicen sus compras oportunamente.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en harina, huevos, esencias y surtido de bebidas.  Su meta a futuro es proveer a tiendas del sector y realizarle mejoras locativas a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lidys, age 28, is a micro-entrepreneur who, alongside her husband, started her own business.  Counting on the skills of her partner, who has studied baking and pastry-making, she didn’t doubt for an instant that opening a bakery in her town would be a success.  

These days they have been selling high-quality, fresh, clean products to the residents of Galapa for five years.  They offer a wide variety of products at great prices.  Every day, starting at 7 a.m., the bread, deditos horneados [a traditional Colombian bread], cheesecake, fresh juices, oatmeal drinks, and other drinks are ready and shown off in the display case so that customers can make their purchases conveniently.  

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will invest it in flour, eggs, flavorings, and her drink inventory.  Her goal in the future is to stock stores in the area and complete some on-site repairs to her home.

loans.use: to invest in flour, eggs, flavorings, and drinks

loans.name: Xavier Enrique

texts.es: Xavier es un joven emprendedor de 22 años, que encontró la oportunidad de tener un ingreso adicional al generado en su empleo actual por medio de la comercialización de pescado y carne de cerdo.  Con el apoyo de su madre quien tiene experiencia en esta labor, pudo hacer contacto con proveedores en una población cuya principal actividad es la pesca y la porcicultura,  y ofrecen excelentes productos a buenos precios. Xavier cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en esta actividad y sus principales clientes son sus compañeros de oficina, amigos y vecinos, quienes realizan sus pedidos y cancelan de contado o crédito.  En la actualidad su capital es insuficiente para cumplir oportunamente a sus clientes y para mitigar esta situación está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará carne de cerdo, pescados e introducirá  suero y criará cerdos desde su vivienda.  Con esta inversión continuará ofreciendo bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida a su cónyuge e hija.  Su meta a futuro es acondicionar un local comercial.
texts.en:
Xavier, 22, is a young entrepreneur who found the opportunity to earn a side income, while keeping his current job, by commercializing fish and pork meat. With the support of his mother, who is experienced in this work, he was able to establish contact with suppliers in a village. Their main activity is fishing and pig farming, and they offer excellent products at good prices.

Xavier has now five years of experience doing this work. His main customers are his office colleagues, friends, and neighbors, who place orders and pay by cash or credit.

At the present time, Xavier does not have the capital to adequately fill his customers' orders, and this is why he is applying for a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy pork meat and fish, he will also get whey and start raising pigs at home.

With this investment, he will continue to offer well-being to his partner and daughter, and a better quality of life. His goal for the future is to set up a commercial space for his business.

loans.use: to buy pork meat and fish, and he will get whey and start raising pigs at home.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso es un tendero reconocido en su localidad por su agradable servicio y carisma, su negocio fue aperturado hace 13 años al utilizar sus ahorros, fruto de su anterior empleo en una tienda de víveres en la que laboró por muchos años como ayudante, experiencia que le permitió conocer todo el manejo del negocio y así tener las bases suficientes para iniciar el suyo.  El reside en el municipio de Soledad en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos y gracias a su tienda de víveres ha logrado sostener a su familia, en la que diariamente atiende a partir de las 6.30 a.m. y ofrece todos víveres que hacen parte de la canasta familiar como arroz, aceite, legumbres, carnes, leche, huevos y demás. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en víveres al por mayor y tener mayor rentabilidad en su negocio.  Su meta a futuro es tener otra tienda en la que pueda emplear a un familiar, así mismo desea tener salud para continuar trabajando y brindando bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a well-known grocer in his area because of his pleasant service and charisma. He opened his business 13 years ago by using his savings from a previous job in a grocery store where he worked for many years as a helper. That experience taught him all about the management of the business, and gave him a sufficient foundation to start his own business.

Alfonso lives in the city of Soledad with his wife and children, and thanks to his grocery store, he has managed to support his family. Every day, he opens his store for business at 6:30 a.m., and he offers all of the food supplies that a family would usually use such as rice, oil, legumes, meat, milk, eggs, and more.

Currently, he is applying for his first credikiva by way of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy supplies at wholesale and be more profitable in his business. His future goal is to have another store in which he can employ a relative, as well as be healthy in order to continue working for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies at wholesale and be more profitable in his business.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
There is nothing more that an entrepreneur would wish than to expand his business.

For almost 15 years in her sari-sari (variety) store business, Marietta, 56 years old, has been pursuing a better life. She has long aspired for a better life for her family. Usually, she earns approximately PHP 8,000 a month, which she uses for their family expenses and needs. Basically, this amount is not enough for an entire household. Her husband Florentino, a 46-year-old man, also perseveres in supporting the family.

Marietta became a member of CCT in July 2010. With the guide of this group of ministries, she learned a lot about running her business. There is a popular saying: "Never settle for mediocrity." This is how she runs her business, trying to further enhance what she has.

Enlightened and inspired, Marietta humbly asks for a loan that she will use to buy additional grocery items and other merchandise products. She knows that Kiva will help her with this. Therefore, she wants you to know that she is borrowing PHP 30,000 for this purpose.

She is excited to improve and develop her trade. This is a start of her journey to success, and she is indeed thankful that she was given an opportunity like this.

She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items and other merchandise products.

loans.name: Ulises Manuel

texts.es: Ulises en su carpintería realiza diseños innovadores y a la vanguardia de consolas y comedores, esta actividad fue heredada de su familia quien por tradición llevan años dedicada a este arte.  Cuenta con una experiencia de treinta años, sin embargo se independizó hace seis años y lleva 37 años de haber llegado al municipio de Barranquilla proveniente de Ciénaga de Oro.  En su taller labora de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. de lunes a sábado y distribuye sus productos a almacenes del centro y la calle Murillo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar madera y pinturas, esta inversión le permitirá tener más surtido y despachará ágilmente a sus clientes.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su base de clientes.  Ulises es padre de dos hijos y su meta familiar es costearle sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ulises is a carpenter who makes innovative designs and is at the forefront of designing consoles and dining room sets. He inherited this occupation from his family who by tradition has been dedicated to this art for years. He has 30 years of experience, however he became independent 6 years ago. He arrived at the city of Barranquilla 37 years ago, coming from Ciénaga de Oro.

In his shop, he works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. on Monday thru Saturday. He distributes his products to stores in the center of town and on Murillo street.

Currently, Ulises is applying for his first credikiva by way of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy wood and paint. This investment will enable him to have a larger assortment of products and ship more quickly to his customers. His future goal is to expand his customer base. Ulises has two children and his desire is to pay for their studies.

loans.use: to buy wood and paint, and enable him to have a larger assortment of products and ship quickly to his customers.

loans.name: Dairo Luis

texts.es: Dairo de 41 años, es un fabricante de magos en madera para herramientas de construcción como palas, picos, martillos y barretón, que  desde joven aprendió esta actividad en el negocio de su padre de forma artesanal, hoy en día, él cuenta con su propio taller en el que su producción es mucho más tecnificada que como en sus inicios, utiliza motores y prensadoras, para darle un buen acabado y sobre todo seguridad a estos implementos de trabajo. Dairo cuenta con veinte años de experiencia y un año en su propio negocio, él comercializa sus productos a ferreterías de la ciudad semanalmente a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en una maquina Bolilladora, esta inversión permitirá acortar los tiempos en la producción y responder más ágilmente a los pedidos de los clientes.  Su meta a futuro es seguir creciendo y adquirir un medio de transporte para la entrega de sus productos.  En lo personal Dairo desea nuevamente constituir un hogar puesto que se separó de su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Dairo is 41 years old. He makes handles for construction tools such as shovels, pickaxes, hammers, and hoes. He learned this occupation when he was young in his father's artisan business. Today, he has his own shop in which he produces much more technical pieces than he did when be began. He uses motors and pressing machines to give them a good finish and, most importantly, to make these work tools safe to use. Dairo has 20 years of experience and 1 year with his own business. He sells his products weekly to hardware stores in the city from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m.

Currently, he is applying for his first credikiva by way of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy a round rod milling machine. This investment will enable him to cut production time and respond more quickly to the requests of his customers. His future goal is to continue growing and get a mode of transportation to deliver his products. Personally, Dairo would like to form a household again, since he separated from his wife.

loans.use: to buy a round rod milling machine.

loans.name: Familia Marifer Group

texts.es:
“Familia Marifer” es un grupo compuesto por personas muy unida, siempre dispuestas a ayudarse. El grupo habita en una comunidad muy pequeña, cerca de la cabecera municipal y caracterizada por la tranquilidad del lugar y la calidez de las personas.

Verónica es una mujer muy trabajadora y amable, tiene  47 años de edad y está casada con el señor Gregorio. Ellos son padreas de tres hijos de los cuales ya sólo uno depende de ellos y se encuentra estudiando la preparatoria.

Vero, como le dicen de cariño, siempre se ha interesado por el bienestar de su familia y para ello se ha esforzado desempeñando su actividad. Hace 12 años comenzó a trabajar para una señora que vendía productos de belleza, aprendió lo necesario y tiempo después decidió emprender su propio negocio. A 10 años de haberse independizado, Vero también diversificó sus productos, ahora vende ropa y artículos para el hogar que compra en la capital del país todos los viernes en un gran mercado donde encuentra los mejores precios. 

Al recordar los primeros días de su negocio, Vero tiene en mente que el inicio de su actividad también fue posible gracias a VFMéxico. Con aquél primer préstamo, ella logró comprar perfumes y cosméticos; poco a poco las ganancias fueron suficientes para invertir en la ropa que ahora también vende de casa en casa. “Me gusta mucho tener el contacto con las personas y se me facilita de esta manera” comentó Vero al hablar del modo en que lleva a cabo su actividad. 

La meta de Vero es hacer crecer su negocio para obtener mas ganancias y seguir apoyando a su hijo que está estudiando, sin embargo los tres integrantes del grupo comparten el mismo sueño de lograr construir una casa propia para dejar de rentar. Vero invertirá su préstamo en cosméticos y ropa, mientras que José Eduardo lo hará en su hojalatería y Mariana en ropa.

*La fotografía fue tomada en los arcos del municipio, Vero es quien tiene el cabello corto y el saco gris*
texts.en:
“Familia Marifer” is a group composed of people who are very united and always ready to help one another. The group lives in a small community that is characterized by its tranquility and the warmth of its people.

Verónica, age 47, is a very hard-working and kind woman. She is married to Gegorio. They have three children. Only one is still dependent upon them, and he goes to high school. Vero, as she is affectionately called, has always been concerned with her family’s well-being. That is why she has put so much effort into her business activity.

Twelve years ago she started to work for a woman who sold beauty products. She learned what was need, and she later decided to undertake her own business. After having been independent for ten years. Vero diversified her products. She now sells clothes and household items that she buys in the capital of the country every Friday. She buys at a big market where she finds the best prices.

Upon remembering the first days in her business, Vero keeps in mind that the start of her business was also possible thanks to VFMéxico. With that first loan she managed to buy perfumes and cosmetics. Little by little, she got enough earnings to invest in clothes, which she now also sells door to door. “I really like having contact with people, and this way makes it easier for me,” Vero says when talking about the way she carries out her business activity.

Vero’s goal is to make her business grow in order to get more earnings and to continue supporting her son who is going to school. The three members of the group share the same dream of managing to build their own houses in order to no longer rent.

Vero will invest her loan in cosmetics and clothes, José Eduardo in tin ware, and Mariana in clothes.

*The photo was taken at the arches in the municipality. Vero is the one with short hair and a gray jacket.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing.

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es:
La señora Constantina,  tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 3  hijos que viven junto a ella y su esposo. En la gestión anterior, Constantina compro un lote de terreno y construyo su vivienda en la zona, ya que en el lugar donde Vivian (zona rural) no había escuela para que sus hijos puedan estudiar. Actualmente sus hijos tienen la oportunidad de acceder a la educación primaria.
Por la razón mencionada, la señora Constantina gasto todos sus recursos en la adquisición de la vivienda, la señora Constantina se dedica a la agricultura, necesita un préstamo para la compra de semilla de papa y otros insumos agrícolas. Los productos que cultiva en mayor cantidad son la papa y cereales como el trigo y el maíz.
Constantina es una persona muy responsable según referencias de vecinos es muy querida en su familia y en el lugar donde trabaja, la comunidad donde trabaja es de clima frígido- templado y con sus cosechas aporta  significativamente a que en la región  sea abastecida de alimentos y está comprometida a seguir fortaleciendo la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Constantina is 48 years old. She has 3 children who live with her and her husband. Previously, Constantina bought a plot of land and built her home, since in the area where they lived before (a rural area) there was no school for her children. Right now, her children have the opportunity to access primary education.

Due to this, Constantina spent all of her resources in acquiring a home. Constantina works in agriculture and she needs a loan to buy potato seeds and other agricultural materials. The products she grows are mostly potatoes and grains such as wheat and corn.

Constantina is a very responsible person who according to neighbors is very beloved by her family and in the place she works. The community where she lives has a cold-template climate and with its harvests it contributes significantly to supplying the region, and it is committed to fortifying its agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds to expand production and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Eucebia

texts.es:
La señora Eucebia,  tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 3  hijos que viven junto a ella y su esposo. La señora Eucebia trabaja en la agricultura en la zona donde vive y produce cebolla, anís, apio, papa entre otras verduras. Desde su niñez aprendió las labores agrícolas y lleva acabo esta actividad con empeño por salir adelante y ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro prodigioso.
En esta ocasión la señora Eucebia necesita un préstamo para la compra de anillas para mejorar la construcción de su pozo de riego y de esta manera mejorar la infraestructura de riego. Esta mejora aportara a la producción de sus verduras significativamente ya que por la falta de esta infraestructura sufre algunos derrumbes a su pozo en temporadas de lluvias.
Eucebia es una persona muy responsable según referencias de vecinos es muy querida en su familia y en el lugar donde trabaja. Por el lugar donde se encuentra con sus cosechas aporta  significativamente a que en la región  sea abastecida de alimentos y está comprometida a seguir fortaleciendo la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Eucebia is 45 years old. She has 3 children who live with her and her husband. Eucebia works in agriculture in the area where she lives and she produces onions, anise, celery, potatoes and more vegetables. She learned agricultural work in her childhood and has done this activity with hard work to get ahead and offer her children a prodigious future.

At this time, Eucebia needs a loan to buy rings to improve the construction of her irrigation well and in this way, improve the irrigation infrastructure. This improvement will contribute to the yield of her vegetables significantly because due to a lack of this infrastructure,she has suffered some cave ins in her well in the rainy season.

Eucebia is a very responsible person, who according to her neighbors is much beloved by her family and in the place where she works. The place where she lives contributes significantly to supplying the region and it is committed to continue fortifying agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy rings to improve construction on her irrigation well and to improve her yield and generate better income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in buying sheeting, a door, cement, gravel, sand and other materials to put in a cement floor and repair the roof on her home.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, who is a villager in Battambang province, is 41 years old. She is married and has two children, one of whom relies on her and is still in school.

To make a living, Mao and her husband are selling fruit as their main source of income and they have been involved in it for years. Lacking the working capital to buy fruit is the challenge to her selling business. Thus, she formed a group consisting of two members to apply for a new loan.

Mao is a third-cycle borrower from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully paid back the past loan, which has enabled her to provide family members with sufficient food.

Mao, as the group leader, will use her loan to buy more kinds of fruit to resell to attract more customers and increase the number of sales. She hopes she can earn more income so as to fulfill her dream to upgrade the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of fruit to resell to attract more customers and increase the number of sales.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
A sari-sari store is one of the most common businesses to acquire in the Philippines, but you cannot expect constant success here. Well, it’s a reality in every business with which Maria Lorena would most probably agree.

For several years she has been in the industry, and she has faced difficulties mostly because of insufficient capital. But Maria Lorena did not lose heart or hope because she knew that God would always be willing to provide and meet the needs of her family. Instead, she saw herself wanting to improve her business yet the problem was how.

Then, this question eventually led Maria Lorena to CCT group ministries where she drew strength and motivation to indeed make her life better by developing strategic ways and discipline for her business. And just recently, she was introduced to Kiva.

Inspired by “loans that change lives”, Maria Lorena was motivated to take a loan worth PHP 10,000 in order to start improving her variety store. With this, she can already increase her merchandise products and for sure, people nearby her place will be glad to be her customers because of the many options among her products.

By now, she’s glad that her children are willing to help her to handle the business even early in the morning or late at night. She’s dedicated to do this because she really wants to help her husband in satisfying the family needs.

loans.use: to increase merchandise products in her variety store

loans.name: Javier Francisco

texts.es: Javier encontró su oportunidad de negocio, cuando un amigo le propuso venderle la infraestructura de su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas a cómodas cuotas; aunque con escaso capital, pero con una excelente sazón empezó a producir y  vender, papas rellenas, patacones rellenos, carnes asadas, salchipapas y demás delicias.   Día tras día, dedica once horas a su negocio, actividad que inició hace un año y de la cual ha obtenido excelentes resultados, sin embargo el desea continuar creciendo en su negocio y para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  que invertirá en carnes y pollo.  Con esta inversión podrá producir mucho más a un menor costo.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir un local, puesto que trabaja desde sus casa, así mismo desea conformar una familia.
texts.en: Javier found his business opportunity when a friend proposed selling him the business infrastructure to sell fast food at comfortable prices. Although he has little capital, he is a great cook and he started to prepare and sell stuffed potatoes, stuffed patacones, grilled meats, salchipapas and other delicious things. Day after day, he spends eleven hours a day at his business, and activity that he started a year ago and with which he has obtained excellent results .  Nonetheless, he wants to continue growing his business and for that he is applying for  his first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in meats and chicken. With this investment, he will be able to produce a lot more at a lower cost. His goal for the future is to acquire a locale, since he works from home. He also wants to start a family.

loans.use: to invest in meat and in chicken.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.ru: Эльнура, 40 лет, замужем. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Эльнуры, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 4 коровы, 30 овец и 3 лошади, также выращивает кукурузу. Также делает переплет и подшив документов на заказ. Ежемесячный доход Эльнуры составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для закупки телят. Эльнура намерена и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота и развивать ее бизнес, чтобы накопить средства на покупку квартиры в городе.
texts.en:
Elnura is 40 and married. She has a specialist high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as a source of income for her family. Thanks to her effort, purposefulness and hard work, she currently has four cows, 30 sheep and three horses, and also grows corn. In addition, she binds and files documents by commission. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS.

Elnura has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase calves. She intends to further increase her head count of livestock and to develop her business so she can save toward purchasing an apartment in the city.

loans.use: to buy additional calves to increase her herd

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
“It is good to have a source of income and more fun when you enjoy what you do.” This is how Zenaida, 44, encourages herself and also the other people around her.

Zenaida sells frozen products and at the same time items like soaps and detergents in their area at Pasay City. She has been running this business for over six years and she knows that this can still expand or grow if she only has enough business capital. With the fact that her items are highly in demand right now, since one can cook instantly, there is a great possibility that Zenaida can widen her trade.

Now, Zenaida wants to acquire a loan from Kiva to buy more merchandise such as frozen products and other items to sell. It is because she usually runs out of stock due to financial issues. In order to continually satisfy the demand of her “suki”s or regular customers, she comes to Kiva through CCT, a group of ministries in the Philippines, for a PHP 15,000 loan. She views this opportunity as a start of a greater milestone ahead of her.

She is hoping that one day she will become an inspiration to the other entrepreneurs who will enter this kind of business.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to buy more merchandise products

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Aged 26, Mom is a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school; the other is under school age. She lives in Battambang province, where she has been growing cassava as the main source of income for more than five years. Besides this, she has been working for others for a fee for supplemental income. The main challenge she faces is the lack of working capital to enhance her farming business.

She is now forming a group, which consists of two members, to request a new loan. This is the third time for her with VisionFund (a Kiva partner), from which she fully paid back the past loan. Based on the past loan, she has used it to renovate her house.

As the group leader, Mom will use her loan to pay for the plowing fee and purchase cassava seeds to plant. She hopes she can earn more income so as to buy organic fertilizer to enhance the farmland.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and purchase cassava seeds to enhance the farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, re-bar, sand, gravel and cement to construct a wall at his house.

loans.name: Oui Group

texts.fr:
Mr TEEG-WENDE PHILMONT est responsable du groupe OUI. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06 ans et le moins âgé a 06 mois . 0 enfant va à l’école et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l'élevage  depuis 07 ans et pratique l'agriculture depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 03 sacs d’engrais , 01 boîte d’oignons et 01 mouton.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour payer des animaux et renforcer son élevage. Il ambitionne acheter une concession.
texts.en:
Teeg-Wende Philmont is Oui Group's leader. He is married and has three children. The oldest is six years old and the youngest is six months old. None of the children go to school, and he supports four people.

He has been raising livestock for the last 7 years and farming for 15. He gets his supplies in local markets.

With the money received from the loan, he intends to buy three bags of fertilizer, one box of onions, and one sheep. He wants to use the profits from the loan to buy livestock and expand his farm. His goal is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of fertilizer, 1 box of onions, and 1 sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: soups, eggs, basic grains, sweets, drinks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Kouanchan Group

texts.en:
Xiengsai understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Xiengsai knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Xiengsai purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Xiengsai is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Sanoonkang Group

texts.en: Khamphanh’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Khamphanh and his group are excited that the filter would be available on a payment plan that makes it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which he can now shift to other pursuits. Khamphanh and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within these 2 years, filter users, like Khamphanh’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her food supply for the preparation of her meals, including: rice, oil, vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Nowadays, looking for a job is just like entering a thread into a needle. It’s difficult, especially when you did not attend a higher level of education, and worse if you are not able to go to school at all. In general, for this reason, many people try to look for other ways of generating income apart from employment.

Norma was one of these kinds of people. In order to face this challenging world, she found a house-rental business to address her problem. She offers her apartments for lodging to families and individuals in exchange for a monthly charge, basically depending on how large the room is. Basically her earnings from this inventory go as support for her nephew's and niece’s educational needs.

If you’d allow, she wants to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 that she will use to renovate and beautify her apartments. This will help her attract more lodgers when realized. Excess money will be utilized for her business’ maintenance, and the rest she plans to save.

She is dreaming to someday buy a tricycle unit to have an additional source of income. She is thankful for your generosity and hopes that you trust in her again this time around.

loans.use: to pay for renovation and beautification of her room rentals.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela vive en una comunidad muy tranquila de herencia mazahua donde la mayoría de las personas se dedica a la cría de animales y al cultivo de maíz. Los habitantes aún conservan sus tradiciones, entre ellas las celebraciones, la vestimenta y su lengua materna. 

 Marcela tiene 42 años de edad y está casada con el señor Rafael, juntos han formado una familia con tres niños que actualmente se encuentran estudiando. Doña Marce, como le dicen de cariño, es una mujer muy trabajadora que desempeña tres actividades distintas: una cocina económica, la venta de abarrotes y la venta de ropa. Esta última fue la actividad con la que se inició en el mundo del comercio y lo hizo gracias a su madre quien le regaló un poco de ropa para que comenzara a tener sus propios ingresos; de esto hace ya 15 años. “Quise iniciar otra actividad para aumentar mis ganancias un poco y así ayudar con los gastos del hogar”. Fue así que comenzó a vender abarrotes instalando un pequeño puesto en algunos mercados cerca de su comunidad. Después, también incorporó la venta de tortas, tacos y pambazos "...pero a los clientes les gusto el sazón y me motivaron a abrir una cocina económica".

Todos los días doña Marce abre la cocina económica que atienden sus empleadas mientras ella dedica su tiempo a los otros negocios que se estabilizan cada vez más, aunque también enfrenta la competencia de la cocina económica. “Creo que la mía es diferente a las demás por el buen sazón y por el agua de frutas que tengo siempre" comenta Marce convencida. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en el pequeño puesto de abarrotes y comprará semillas secas, cereales y aceites. 

Su gran sueño seguir progresando con sus negocios y abrir otra cocina económica. De acuerdo con sus planes, dejaría las otras actividades para dedicarse de lleno a la comida que es lo que más le gusta. En cuanto a su familia comenta "me gustaría ver a mis hijos realizados profesionalmente, para nada me gustaría que se dedicaran al comercio porque es un trabajo muy duro".

*La fotografía fue tomada en el puesto de abarrotes que Marce instala todos los lunes en un mercado".
texts.en:
Marcela lives in a very tranquil community with indigenous Mazahua roots where the majority of people raise farm animals and cultivate corn. The inhabitants still conserve their traditions, among these their celebrations, clothing, and mother tongue.

Marcela is 42 years old and married to Rafael. Together they have formed a family with three children, all of whom are presently studying. 'Dona Marce', as she is affectionately known, is a very hard-working woman who is involved in three distinct activities: selling economy meals, selling groceries, and selling clothing. The latter was the activity that launched her into the world of commerce. She began this thanks to her mother who, some 15 years ago, gave her some clothing to sell in order to have her own income. “I wanted to initiate another activity to augment my earnings a bit and, thus, to help with household expenses,” Marce says. That's how she got into selling groceries from small stalls in public markets near her community. Later, she also began to sell sandwiches, tacos and buns ... “but my customers like the flavor and that motivated me to open an economy kitchen”. 

Every day Marce opens her economy kitchen, which is tended by her employees, while she spends more and more time at the other businesses she established, while facing competition from other economy kitchens. “I think mine is different from the others because of the good flavor and the fruit drinks I always offer,” comments Marce with conviction. The new loan will be invested in her little grocery stall; she will purchase dry seeds, cereals, and cooking oils.

Marce's grand dream is to continue progressing with her businesses and to open another economy kitchen. According to her plans, she will delegate her other activities in order to dedicate herself full time to producing the meals that she likes best. Concerning her family, she comments: “I would like to see my children prepared professionally; I would not want them to dedicate themselves to commerce because it is very hard work.” 

*The photo was taken at her grocery stand which Marce opens every Monday in a public market.

loans.use: purchase dry seeds, cereals, cooking oils, etc., to sell.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
One line from a Filipino song goes like this, “Walang imposible. Sige lang sige. Abot mo ang mundo.” A great reflection of a Filipino soul willing to go on despite anything, believing that there is nothing impossible for those who really want to reach the world of success. 

Parallel to how Annabel sees her life in the world of entrepreneurship, she knows that there will always be ways for her to develop and expand her repacking business because nothing is impossible. In fact, recently she had a loan with KIVA that helped her buy heaps of food products to repack, like garlic. 

Now, she humbly asks again for a loan worth PHP 20,000 with same purpose. She truly hopes that you will consider it since she has proven that she has been faithful in repaying her previous business. 

For her family, there is nothing that she won’t do. She seeks to have a stable condition of living as well as good health for her family and continuing business expansion. With this, she is planning to save more to assure the better education for her children. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to buy heaps of food products to repack.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
In 13 years of making “basahan”, or rugs, Mary Jean realized that it was never easy, and it takes full effort, patience and perseverance to manage a certain business; yet, what you will earn on the other hand is not as big as what others think. But, however, as it is said, “What you sow is what you reap.” So, Mary Jean continues to press forward.

Her vision is to expand her business in order to have additional workers who will help her in the inventory, and at the same time, to help other people find opportunities to work someday. According to her, if she expands her business, it will not be hard anymore to provide her children with a better education. As of today, she works to reach these goals.

Now, she wants to borrow PHP 12,000 to improve her source of income by purchasing an additional sewing machine and more “retaso”, or used clothes needed for making rugs.

One day, with God’s grace, Mary Jean believes that she will own a house and lot so that they will not rent a house anymore. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine and more “retaso”, or used clothes needed for making rugs.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doña Guadalupe vive en una comunidad muy tranquila, pequeña, pero caracterizado por sus habitantes alegres y trabajadores. La mayoría de ellos son artesanos que se dedican a transformar la plata en piezas únicas que además ayudan a conservar la iconografía mazahua de la zona. 

Lupita, como le dicen de cariño, tiene 43 años de edad y está casada con Juan quien trabaja en la construcción; ellos tienen una familia de dos hijos que ya son independientes. 

Doña Lupita siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora, desde que decidió formar su propia familia también se comprometió a ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, así que decidió vender ropa y pollos. Cada ocho días ella recorría todas las calles de su comunidad para vender la carne de pollo, pero no resultó ser un negocio tan rentable y lo cambió por la venta de jugos, refrescos y dulces que ofrece los fines de semana. Los sábados instala una mesa fuera de la casa de sus suegra y los domingos, cerca de un campo de fútbol para aprovechar la afluencia de las personas. 

La única meta de Doña Lupita es seguir creciendo con su negocio “Dentro de muy poco quiero comenzar a vender sopes, quesadillas, gorditas, entre otras cosas para aumentar mis ganancias” comentó Doña Lupita muy alegre. El préstamo actual le permitirá comprar más jugos, refrescos, botanas y dulces para continuar vendiendo los fines de semana.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de la suegra de Lupita, donde almacena toda su mercancía.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in a very small, quiet community, known for it's happy and hard-working inhabitants. The majority of them are craftsmen who work transforming silver into unique pieces that also help to conserve the Mazahua iconography of the area.

Lupita, as she is called with affection, is 43 years old and married to Juan who works in construction. They have a family of two children who are independent.

Lupita has always been a hard-working woman who since she decided to form her own family also promised to help with the household expenses and education of her children. So she decided to sell clothing and chickens. Every eight days she walked all the streets of her community selling her chicken meat but it didn't turn out to be a very profitable business. So she changed it to selling juice, soft drinks and sweets that she offered on weekends. On Saturday she sets up a table outside her in-laws house and Sunday close to the football stadium to take advantage of the influx of people.

Lupita's only goal is to continue to expand her business. "Soon I want to start selling sopes, quesadillas and gorditas (all common street foods) amongst other things to improve my profits", commented Lupita very happily. This loan will help her buy more juice, soft drinks, snacks and sweets to continue to sell on weekends.

The photograph was taken at her in-laws house where Lupita stores all her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy juice, soft drinks, snacks, candies, etc.

loans.name: Nonxay Group

texts.en:
Phanh understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Phanh knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Phanh purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Phanh is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rivojiddin

texts.ru: Ривочиддин ответственный и серьезный молодой парень. Ему 22 года. Он из района Шахринав. Ривочиддин живет вместе с отцом и матерью. Он единственный сын в семье. Его родители занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Но Ривочиддин не выбрал их деятельность, он решил заниматься таксистом. Ему нравится водить машину и перевозить людей. Ривочиддин уже два года занимается таксистом. Он помогает родителям обеспечить семью. Сейчас Ривочиддину необходимо починить автомашину. Для купли автозапчасти у него не хватает денежных средств, и он решил взять кредит и приобрести автозапчасти.  Поддержите его!
texts.en: Rivojiddin is a responsible and serious young man. He is 22 years old and comes from the Shahrinav district. He lives with his mother and father and is the only son in the family. His parents are farmers, but Rivojiddin chose to be a taxi driver instead. He likes to drive and take on passengers. He has been a taxi driver for two years and helps his parents take care of the family. Now Rivojiddin needs to repair his vehicle, but he does not have enough money to purchase spare parts. He decided to take out a loan to buy the parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase car parts

loans.name: Nakeua Group

texts.en:
Khamsee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Khamsee and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits. Khamsee and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this two years, filter users, like Khamsee’s family, will see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs due to safer water.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Thongviengkham Group

texts.en:
Tar’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Tar and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Tar and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this two years, filter users, like Tar’s family, will see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs due to safer water.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Akouvi est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans. Akouvi vit à Baguida où elle exerce son activité de revendeuse de poissons fumées. Akouvi s’approvisionne au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers les plus proches. Akouvi désire ce crédit pour réaliser son achat de poissons et des condiments afin de gagner une marge bénéficiaire plus élevée en vue de concrétiser son rêve d’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a 43-year-old married mother of five children. She lives in Baguida where she resells smoked fish. Akouvi buys supplies at the market and resells food, circulating in the nearby neighborhoods. 

Akouvi is requesting a loan to purchase fish and condiments so that she can make a larger profit margin in order to achieve her dreams of improving opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of fish, 1 box of macaroni and 1 load of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Aleuy Group

texts.en:
Houang is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Houang and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Houang and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years.

Houang and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. After totaling up the costs, Houang and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will provide for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Wenna

texts.en:
The economy of the nation tends to reach its stability due to the different programs the government has been offering to its citizens to eliminate poverty. Most Filipinos today have engaged themselves not just in employment, but also in micro-businesses.

One of them is Wenna. Realizing her part in the economic growth of her country, she works hard to maintain her direct-selling business. Usually, she sells lotions, powders, perfumes, and other similar products. One day, she is yearning to grow this business and help other people also.

But of course before that, she wants to expand her own business by acquiring additional capital. She will use this to increase the volume of her products to sell that will definitely lead her into having a profit increase.

This will basically be a great help for her since she is now sending her children to school. She wants them to have better education. That’s why she is hopeful that you would grant her the PHP 12,000 loan that she is requesting. This will definitely make her inventory better.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to increase the volume of her products to sell in her direct-selling business

loans.name: Grupo Guineales Salida Santo Tomas Group

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera con un hijo que aún se encuentra bajo su cuidado, ella vive en una comunidad denominada Guineales.
Para Juana (la primera del lado derecho de la foto de blusa color  café) el tener la oportunidad de poder trabajar y brindarle a su familia lo necesario es muy importante, pues ella desde hace cuatro años decidió realizar una actividad que le permitiera obtener mejores ingresos, ella entonces desde ese tiempo se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, le gusta esta actividad porque lo realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar y le permite cuidar de su hijo. Pero Juana desde hace algún tiempo había pensado en mejorar su negocio realizando una inversión que le permitirá comprar más ropa de diferentes colores y estilos para satisfacer  mejor las necesidades de los clientes.

Juana tiene el gran sueño de ver su negocio crecer y contar con un local propio donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Juana is a 24 year old single woman who has one child under her care. She lives in a community called Guineales.

For Juana (the first on the left with a brown blouse) having the opportunity to work and provide her family with what they need is very important. Four years ago she decided to start an activity that allowed her to obtain more income and since then she has worked buying and selling traditional clothing. She likes this work as she can do it from the comfort of her home and it allows her to care for her son. For some time now Juana has been thinking about improving her business making an investment that would allow her to buy more clothing of different styles and colors to better satisfy the needs of her customers.

Juana has a great dream of seeing her business grow and of having her own shop where she can display her products better.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a medical operation and resume working so that she can give her daughter a better day.

loans.name: Myimanaiym

texts.ru: Мыйманайым, 44 года, замужем, есть 7 детей (6 дочерей и сын). У нее - среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Мыйманайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров, 20 овец. Также имеется земельный надел, мерою 1,12 ГА собственной земли, где Мыйманайым выращивает кукурузу и помидоры. Мыйманайым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и перепродажи. Развитие хозяйства позволит увеличить тем самым ее прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Myimanaiym is 44, married, and has seven children (six daughters and a son). She has a high school education and is a farmer, earning supplementary income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has five cows and twenty sheep. She also has 1.12 hectares of her own land, where she grows corn and tomatoes. Myimanaiym applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy cows to fatten and resell. Expanding her farm will allow her to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ramon Alfredo

texts.es: Ramón de 47 años de edad es un hombre que siempre demuestra su deseo de superación, actualmente  habita en vivienda propia con su madre de 96 años de edad y su hijo de 23 años de edad. Ramón desde hace cuatro años presta sus servicios independientes como maestro de obra en el cual se ha sabido ganar la confianza de sus clientes mostrando su honestidad y responsabilidad. El desea cambiar el techo y mejorar las condiciones de una de las habitaciones de la vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, pines, cemento, arena, hierro, etc. para lograr mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ramón, 47 years old, is a man who is always demonstrating his wish for self-improvement. Currently, he lives in his own home with his 96-year-old mother and his 23-year-old son.

For four years, Ramón has lent his independent services as a foreman, in which he has known how to gain the confidence of his customers by showing his honesty and responsibility.

He hopes to change his roof and improve the conditions of one of the homes, and for this he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: sheet metal, pins, cement, sand, iron, etc., to be able to improve the conditions of his home.

loans.use: to invest in: sheet metal, pins, cement, sand, iron, etc., to improve the roof of his home.

loans.name: Naphosomnoo Group

texts.en:
Khamphoon understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Khamphoon knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Khamphoon purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal. It will also decrease the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Khamphoon is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for two years. He and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Vilanculos Província de Inhambane tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, é mãe de3 filhos menores de idade, dos quais 2 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 3 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
Começou trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2013, este é o seu 3º empréstimo com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento e pedra, para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e adquirir bens móveis para sua casa.
texts.en:
Veronica was born in the town of Vilanculos in the province of Inhambane, Mozambique. She is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three small children, two of whom are in school. She also cares for and is financially responsible for three nephews who live with her.

Veronica started working with Hluvuku [Kiva Field Partner] in 2013. This is her 3rd loan, which she will use to buy materials like sand, cement and stone in order to continue with a home construction project. In the future she hopes to finish with this construction project and buy furniture for her new home.

loans.use: buy sand, cement and stone in order to continue with a home construction project.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE TAMBO REAL, la socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de quesos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo quesos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia está contenta con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the communal bank Solidaridad de Tambo Real. She continues to work selling cheese. She does well in her business because of the determination with which she approaches everyday. She continues to sell cheese to her customers who request it.
She wants to continue working in this way to be able to continue supporting her family. 
Lorenza is grateful for the loan that she has been given and promises to make all the necessary payments. She is requesting the loan to buy milk among other things.

loans.use: to buy milk among other things.

loans.name: Nonmyxayta Group

texts.en:
Nom and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

Nom and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Nom and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Nom and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Nom is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis tiene 23 años de edad, vive muy feliz y agradecido en su humilde vivienda familiar que es acogedora en la cual vive con su tío. Luis presta sus servicios como auxiliar de albañilería desde hace varios años y además con su tío tienen instalado en su casa de habitación un taller en el  que se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de estructuras metálica, por lo que gracias a su empeño y laboriosidad logra salir adelante, es reconocido  como un hombre honrado y trabajador en su comunidad. Luis desea comprar materia prima para la elaboración de estructuras metálicas como: puertas balcones, polines, canales para agua, ventanas, escritorios, etc., por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en compra de hierro, láminas, remaches  y otros materiales y herramientas para la elaboración de estructuras metálicas y así poder mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Luis, 23, lives a happy and grateful life in his warm, humble home that he shares with his uncle. Luis has been a builder's assistant for many years, and he and his uncle have built a workshop in their house which they use to build and repair metal framing. Thanks to his diligence and determination, Luis has managed to get ahead and he is recognized in his community as an honest and hard-working man.

Luis wants to buy raw material to build metal framing, such as doors, balconies, beams, gutters, windows, desks, etc. He is asking for a loan through FUSAI to invest in iron, metal sheeting, rivets and other tools and materials to build metal frames and therefore be able to earn a better income.

loans.use: invest in iron, metal sheeting, rivets and other tools and materials for building metal framing.

loans.name: Nongveang Group

texts.en:
Kongsee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. The water from these sources is not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Kongsee and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users like Kongsee’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

Kongsee and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Namnone Group

texts.en: Pe understands that a water filter can make a difference in the lives of her family and her group’s families. Pe knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. The water filter Pe purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and reducing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available. Pe is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule. She is happy that the filter is guaranteed for 2 years so she and her group can continue to receive the benefits of clean water for many months.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Konglor Group

texts.en: Ngouan and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  The costs of charcoal, firewood, and bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  The water filter Ngouan and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Ngouan and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for waterborne disease. After totaling up the costs, Ngouan and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for themselves and their families. Ngouan is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Donnabelle

texts.en: Donnabelle is a single entrepreneur who manages a buy-and-sell business, selling Avon cosmetic products in her local community. She uses her motorcycle to deliver items and collect payments from her customers. She has earned a living through this business for more than a year. Donnabelle joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a loan to cover the cost of motor maintenance, new tires, and repairs. She is determined to double the effort exerted to improve and expand the business for a better future.

loans.use: to buy new tires and repairs for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Sokkin's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Battambang province, Sokkin is 42 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom depend on her and are still in school. To overcome the hardship, she grows cassava as the main source of income. Moreover, to earn additional income, she sells some grocery items in her community.
