Lack of working capital is the major obstacle to her cassava farming business nowadays. She formed a group of three members to request a loan, which will be her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Sokkin, who is the group leader, will use her loan to pay for plowing fees,  workers fees and to buy seeds to grow her crop well. She hopes to earn more income to improve the living condition.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, workers fees and to buy seeds to grow her crop well.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina works hard to support two children. She is married and has a business in the Philippines.

Lina requested a PHP 2,100 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Lina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support eight children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 2100 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Janet is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 10 Group

texts.en:
Nhung is a 36-year-old married mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She lives with her mother-in-law, her husband, and her two children in an old house and works in agricultural production to provide for the family. Nhung is complimented by the neighborhood for her diligence in farming and breeding, including cultivating rice and breeding fish, ducks, cows, and chickens. She has always tried hard to increase production and improve income for her family. This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the ducks she is raising. She hopes that with the guidance of the program's agricultural worker, her investment will go well and she can gradually change her family's living conditions.

Nhung dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the ducks she is raising

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo is a 22-year-old married woman with no children. She has worked in construction since 2013. Her husband is a 19 years old and a construction worker, as well. They live in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Both Keo and her husband can earn approximately $10.50 per day. Keo lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use and is therefore requesting a loan. With the motorcycle, her family will have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expenses. For her future plans, Keo wants to open a small grocery store at her home so she can earn enough money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 58 years old now.

Ma. Nenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Ma. Nenita has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants vivant ensemble à Baguida. Pour soutenir sa famille, Akossiwa vend des poissons fumés et de l’huile  à domicile dans son quartier  en s’approvisionnant au marché. Akossiwa réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, elle désire ce prêt pour commander des paniers de poissons et des bidons d’huile afin de favoriser l’émergence de son commerce et aider son mari à couvrir les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a thirty-nine year-old married woman. She has three children, and lives together with her family in Baguida.

To support her family, Akossiwa sells smoked fish and oil from her house to her neighbors. She procures her supplies from the market. Akossiwa's business is profitable.

To keep her customers well satisfied, she wants this loan to order baskets of fish and containers of oil. This will facilitate her business's growth, and she will help her husband pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy four containers of vegetable oil and eight baskets of fish.

loans.name: Tansablego Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOCTAR est responsable du groupe TANSABLEGO. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 09 mois. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l’agriculture depuis plus de 10 ans. Il pratique aussi l’élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé il compte acheter 05 sacs d’engrais, 01 carton d’insecticide et 02 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour s’occuper de sa famille et agrandir son activité. Il ambitionne prendre soins de sa famille surtout les études de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mr. Moctar is in charge of group Tansablego. He is married and a father of five. The oldest is twelve and the youngest is nine months old. Two of the children go to school. In total, seven people depend on him.

Mr. Moctar has been farming the land for over ten years. He also farms cattle. He procures his supplies from nearby markets.

With the money granted him, he intends to purchase five bags of fertilizer, one box of insecticide, and two sheep.

He wants to use profits made thanks to the loan to take care of his family and grow his business. His ambition is to provide for his family, especially for his children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy five bags of fertilizer, one box of insecticide, and two sheep.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old now.

Maria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Maria has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Dianita

texts.en:
Dianita is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Dianita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish and other supplies to use in her business.

Dianita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 35 years old with six children. With one child in school, Aileen works very hard to provide for them.

Aileen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, personal care products, and other groceries.

Aileen has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is from Malabuyoc, Cebu. She is a 41-year-old woman with eight children. The oldest child is 23 years old while the youngest child is 6 years old. Marilyn weaves plastic which is used in making wallets and bags for export. She has been doing this for 12 years. She is requesting a loan to buy recycled plastic for weaving. In the future, Marilyn dreams of building a concrete house for living comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy recycled plastic for weaving.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Aside from running a sari-sari store and junkshop business, most of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) partners living in Payatas are engaged in buying and selling appliances and other home products. One of them is Lilibeth and she’s very grateful since CCT approved the loan of PHP 41,000 that she applied for last year, an added capital that helped her buy on demand and high quality appliances. This amount made a great impact on the business since it allowed customers to choose a wide range of designs and efficient items. Lilibeth chose this business since being a housewife, she’ll be able to take care of her family and manage the business at the same time, because most of her customers are her neighbors and living in their barangay or village. Sometimes Rufo, Lilibeth’s husband helps with the business every time there’s no work for sink, drain and pump repairs.

Lilibeth aims to expand the business and attract new customers as well not just in their village but also in other locations since this became a way to support her children’s education and daily needs. However, there are challenges that can’t be avoided. Buyers who are not paying for the products on time cause a delay in return of investment. With this, Lilibeth decided to apply for another loan of PHP 50,000 this year as added capital for buy on demand appliances such as: flat screen televisions. electric fans, washing machines, electric stoves, amplifiers, etc. The quality and reliability should be considered as well.

Being a long time member of CCT, Lilibeth has been consistently attending her CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This has made her become strong spiritually and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products like an electric fan, a TV, a rice cooker, an amplifier, DVD players and Tupperware products needed in her business.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Akouvi est une jeune femme de 21 ans qui vit à Baguida. Akouvi se bat par la vente des cures dent pour subvenir à ses besoins. Akouvi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et nécessite ce crédit pour acheter une grande quantité de cures dent qu’elle revendra dans les quartiers environnant en vue de gagner des bénéfices. Avec le résultat, Akouvi prendra pour son épanouissement et celui de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a young married woman with two children; she is twenty-one years old and lives in Baguida.

Akouvi's activity to provide for her needs is retailing toothpicks. Akouvi gets her supplies once a month from the market, and is requesting this loan to purchase a large quantity of toothpicks that she will resell in the surrounding areas.

With the resulting profits, Akouvi will provide for her and her children's well-being.

loans.use: to buy six packs of toothpicks.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora runs an automotive shop. She specializes in certain parts and services such as brakes, mufflers, exhaust systems, and wheel alignment. She is a 33-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is 2. She has been operating the automotive shop for the past six years.

Rhodora is asking for a loan to buy automotive tools and accessories. These items will help Rhodora improve the kind of services she provides which could help boost efficiency. With these tools and accessories, more clients will visit her shop to purchase the services she offers. With additional clients, she will augment her income and be able to pay her loan obligation. She could then continue to provide her family with nutritious diets and be able to finance her children's schooling.

Rhodora would like to improve her business to support the college education of all her children.

loans.use: to buy automotive tools and accessories

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
créé le 24/09/2013, le groupement compte 30 membres principalement des femmes qui sont toutes de la même localité.Elles ont comme principale activité le commerce.

Coumba qui est a droite de la photo debout et levant la main gauche est notre emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et est mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles.

Coumba exerce comme activité le commerce. Elle vend des légumes tel que l'aubergine, l'oignon, la pomme de terre, choux pommé et des tomates.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 100kg d'oignons à 250f le kg, 3 casiers de tomate à 10000f l'unité, 50kg de carotte à 22500f, pomme de terre 17000f, choux 100kg à 15000f, achats divers 40500f, transport 10000f.
texts.en:
Created on September 24, 2013, this group numbers thirty members, most of them women from the same village. Their main activity is retail.

Coumba, who is standing to the right with her left hand raised in the photo, is our featured borrower. She is married and a mother of five, including two daughters.

Coumba's business is retail. She sells vegetables such as eggplants, onions, potatoes, white cabbage, and tomatoes.

With this loan, she plans to purchase 100 kilos of onions at 250 XOF per kilo, 3 boxes of tomatoes costing 10,000 XOF each, 50 kilos of carrots (22,500 XOF), potatoes (17,000 XOF), 100 kilos of cabbage for 15,000 XOF, and various other purchases (40,500 XOF). Transportation will cost 10,000 XOF.

loans.use: buy vegetables: eggplants, onions, carrots, potatoes, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a tire change, filters, shock absorbers, oil, etc. to maintain his work vehicle

loans.name: Ma. Niña

texts.en: Ma. Niña is a woman with multiple businesses from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages two, eight, and fourteen. Ma. Niña sells cooked dishes and snacks in a school canteen. She also farms rice for a living. In addition, she helps with their buy-and-sell business selling Wintide safety devices for liquified petroleum gas tanks. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, flour, yeast and more safety devices to increase her sales and income. Her profits will go towards the education of her children. In the future, she dreams of seeing her children become educated and successful in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, flour, yeast, and more safety devices.

loans.name: Garciano

texts.en: Garciano is 47 years old and married with five children. He lives in Dalingap, Clarin. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been with his business for over 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He has been with GDMPC since 2013 and is now requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to repair and purchase spare parts. He dreams of helping his children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, wood, cement, sand and labor to improve part of the roof of her home.

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
Meralyn is 28 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Meralyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Meralyn has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Meralyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 23 years old now.

Maricel has a buy-and-sell gravel business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gravel to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gravel to sell

loans.name: Saroeurng's Group

texts.en:
Saroeurng is a resident of Banteay Meanchey province and she is a 39-year-old mother of a dependent child who is under the age for school. Raising pigs has been the main business for her for 19 years. In addition, she sometimes works as a paid worker for supplemental income. These two businesses earn her about 30,900 KHR per day to sustain the family’s living. The challenge to her pig-raising business is her pigs got ill and grew slowly.

This is the second time for Saroeurng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and the past loan was paid back completely. With the past loan, she has wisely managed to upgrade her standard of living and provide enough healthy food. As the leader of a group which comprises three members, she will use some of her loan portion to buy more piglets and pig feed to nourish them and use the rest of the money to buy food for her family. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed to nourish them and use the rest of the money to buy food for her family.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a 46-year-old woman from Cebu, Philippines. She is married and has four children. Her husband raises animals to sell while she has run a sari-sari (general) store for the past 20 years. Gemma wants to increase their livelihood. She is requesting a loan to buy assorted stock such as soft drinks, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, noodles, eggs, spices, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and powdered chocolate drink. In the future, she wants to expand her business to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, noodles, eggs, spices, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, and powdered chocolate drink to sell.

loans.name: Maria Rebecca

texts.en: Maria Rebecca and her husband work in the poultry business. She is a 48-year-old married woman from Cebu, Philippines and she has two children, ages 18 and 13. Maria Rebecca has been in the poultry business for 10 years. Aside from this, she also raises pigs and her husband works in farming. They work hard to provide for the needs of their family. Maria Rebecca is requesting a loan to buy feed for her chickens and pigs and fertilizer for their crops. In the future, she wants to increase their income, which she plans to use to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer

loans.name: La Nueva Mesa Group

texts.es:
"La Nueva Mesa" es un pequeño grupo que se encuentra en una comunidad mazahua llena de gente trabajadora, amable y humilde. En este lugar se celebran fiestas patronales con duración de hasta tres días durante los cuales las personas conviven, comparten alimentos y danzan. Por lo regular, también queman fuegos artificiales como el típico torito y el castillo que no pueden faltar en estas celebraciones.

 El grupo lo conforman con cuatro hombres que se conocen desde hace tiempo, su amistad los animó a iniciar un proyecto juntos, es decir, solicitar un préstamo a VFMéxico para impulsar sus actividades económicas. José Ángel, uno de los miembros, tiene 55 años y está casado con la señora Gloria quien es ama de casa, juntos han formado una familia con seis hijos, todos ellos se encuentran estudiando.

  Desde hace 10 años, don Ángel se ha dedicado a manejar un taxi, actividad que combina con el trabajo en campo. Después de adquirir su vehículo, comenzó a gestionar los permisos necesarios para ofrecer el servicio en el municipio y estar en regla ante las autoridades. Ahora, don Ángel día a día se esfuerza por tratar bien a sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio para que las personas soliciten cada vez más viajes especiales que dejan las mejores ganancias. Con el nuevo préstamo comprará suspensiones y llantas para mantener la unidad en excelentes condiciones. A pesar de que Ángel enfrenta una gran competencia, afortunadamente su amabilidad lo distingue y hasta ahora obtiene los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia. 

Su meta es dar continuidad al negocio, tener otro taxi y dar empleo a otra persona así como seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que logren terminar una carrera profesional.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Rodolfo quien invertirá su préstamo en madera; Andrés, en cerdos e Israel, en borregos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en una plaza del municipio, junto al taxi de Ángel quien viste camisa blanca.*
texts.en:
"La Nueva Mesa" is a small group that is located in a Mazahua indigenous community, full of hard-working, kind, and humble people. Here, people celebrate festivals that last up to three days, during which people interact, share food, and dance. Usually, they also light typical traditional fireworks shaped like a bull and a castle, which are a must these celebrations.

The group consists of four men who have known each other for some time. Their friendship inspired them to do a project together, which is to ask for a loan from VFMéxico to boost their economic activities.

José Ángel, one of the members, is 55 years old and is married to Gloria, who is a housewife. Together, they have formed a family with six children, all of whom are in school. For the past 10 years, Ángel has been driving a taxi, an activity that he combines with his work in the field.

After acquiring his vehicle, he began to maintain all of the necessary permits to offer his taxi service in the town, and be in good standing with the authorities. Now, Ángel strives every day to treat his customers well and provide a good service, so that people will ask for more special trips, which provide better earnings.

With the new loan, he will buy suspension and tires to maintain his unit in excellent condition. Although Ángel has a lot of competition, his kindness fortunately distinguishes him, and up until now he earns enough revenue to cover his family's expenses.

His goal is to give continuity to his business, have another taxi and provide employment for someone else, as well continue supporting his children so that they can achieve professional careers.

The other members of the group are Rodolfo, who will invest his loan in lumber; Andrés, in swine; and Israel, in sheep.

• The photograph was taken in the town square, next to Ángel's taxi. Angel is wearing a white shirt. *

loans.use: to buy suspension and tires.

location.town: La Mesa, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province, Sokhom is 47 years old and the mother of one kid who is in school. Rice farming is their main source of income, and she grows vegetables to make additional income to support the family. She has been involved in her job for 29 years. The crops have not grown well because of drought.

This is Sokhom's second loan cycle with VisionFund. She repaid her past loan completely. It helped her to have enough production to support her family. As the leader of a group of four members, she will take out a new loan in order to buy rice seed and fertilizer to produce good yields. She hopes to make more income so that she will be able to buy a decent motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer to produce good yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Mouangneua Group

texts.en:
Borliboun understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Borliboun knows that water from local sources requires boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Borliboun purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Borliboun is excited that she was able to purchase the filter on an affordable payment schedule and that the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Genita

texts.en:
Genita, 32 years old, is happily married to Ramsey, a driver, and is blessed with two children. Her husband's salary as a driver is not enough to cover their living expenses. Genita thought of putting up a small stand by their house to augment their income.

Genita has been into the snacks business for two years already. She buys biscuits, cookies, chips and candies from wholesalers and sells them at retail price. This time she needs to fill her small stand with various kinds of cookies, chips and biscuits to better serve her community especially now that school has started in the Philippines.

To help expand her business, she is humbly asking your help for a Php 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy large quantities of biscuits, candies, cookies, and chips. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. Her earnings will be a big help in covering their daily needs and the schooling of her children.

Genita dreams of growing her snack stand so she can give her children a college education to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for biscuits, cookies, chips, and candies to sell at her small stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and stock (pants, shirts, slippers and shoes) and pay school fees.

loans.name: Koup Group

texts.en:
Douang and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

Douang and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Douang and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

The water filter Douang and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Douang is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Nakham Group

texts.en:
Ly’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. The water from these sources is not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Ly and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families' budgets. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users like Ly’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

Ly and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter in order to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a 29-year-old married woman who started, a year ago, preparing and pasting paper bags to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses. She is an ambitious lady and hard worker who learned this job from special training sessions.

Due to Batoul and her husband's limited income, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her necessary medical treatments expenses. She hopes to get well soon and stay capable of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her necessary medical treatment expenses.

loans.name: Las Lobitas Group

texts.es:
Las Lobitas" es el nombre de un grupo conformado en un lugar lleno de vegetación. En esta temporada, los campos están vestidos de maíz, uno de los principales productos de autoconsumo de la región. Los habitantes se muestran contentos ya que próximamente probarán los primeros elotes del año. 

Angélica es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene 30 años de edad y vive en unión libre con Carlos con quien dio vida a dos niñas, sólo una de ellas se encuentra estudiando. 

Hace cinco años Angélica comenzó a críar borregos con el objetivo de incrementar el ingreso familiar “Yo ya tenía la idea de comenzar desde hace mucho sin embargo nunca habíamos tenido dinero para invertir; con nuestros ahorros  compramos nuestros primeros borreguitos”. Con el préstamo, aprovechará para incrementar el número de animales al comprar cinco corderos más así como alimento para los mismos. 

A pesar de que la actividad aún es pequeña, los vecinos de la comunidad ya conocen a Angélica y llegan hasta su casa a comprar los borregos. La dificultad que enfrenta es que a veces tiene que venderlos a un precio más bajo de lo previsto ya sea por el tamaño de los animales o por la competencia que tiene en los alrededores. 

El gran sueño de Angélica es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional y puedan mejorar su calidad de vida. 

 Las demás integrantes del grupo son Alejandra quien invertirá en cerdos y María Elena, en borregos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosco en el centro del municipio. Angélica es quien viste el suéter cafe*
texts.en:
“Las Lobitas” is the name of the group formed in an area full of vegetation. In this season, the fields are dressed in corn, one of the main products for personal consumption in the region. The residents are happy now that soon they will be able to try the first corn of the year.

Angelica is one of the members of this group. She is 30 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with Carlos. Together with Carlos she gave life to two daughters, only one of whom is presently in school.

Five years ago, Angelica began to raise sheep with the goal of increasing the family income. “I already had the idea to start for some time however, we never had the money to invest; with our savings we purchased our first sheep.” She will make use of the loan to increase the number of animals by buying five more sheep as well as feed for them.

Despite the fact that her business is small, the neighbors in the community already know Angelica and go to her house to buy the sheep. The difficulty she faces is that sometimes she has to sell them at a lower price than planned due to the size of the animals or because of the competition that she has in the surrounding area.

Angelica’s big dream is to continue supporting her children so that they can have the opportunity to study a professional career and improve their quality of life.

The other members of the group are Alejandra, who will invest in pigs, and Maria Elena, who will invest in sheep.

*This picture was taken on the steps of the kiosk in the municipal center. Angelica is the woman wearing a brown sweater.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and feed.

location.town: Los Lobos, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia vive y trabaja en Colomi, de estado civil concubina, tiene 2 hijos dependientes que aún no estudian. Se dedica a la actividad de agricultura conjuntamente con la familia, produciendo papa como el principal producto agrícola de mayor demanda en el mercado y en el lugar. Para esta actividad, a veces contrata personal eventual para la siembra, labores culturales en las épocas de cosecha. Los ingresos económicos obtiene a través de la producción y venta de papa que es también parte del sustento para su alimentación (autoconsumo). La señora Delia requiere el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) 1.5 camiones, semilla de papa (10 cargas). 
Por último, la señora Delia se sintió contenta al tener la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo que se adecúa a sus necesidades; porque con la compra de insumos agrícolas, mejorará e incrementará la producción de papa y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorará su nivel de vida y su situación social en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Delia lives and works in Colomi, in a common-law marriage. She has 2 dependent children who are not yet in school. She works in agriculture along with her family, producing potatoes as their primary product in large demand in her area's market. For this activity, she sometimes hires temporary help for planting and for cultivation in the harvest season.

Her income is obtained through the production and sale of potatoes, which are also used for her nutritional needs (own consumption).

Delia needs a loan to purchase 1.5 truckloads of organic manure (chicken droppings) and 10 loads of potato seeds.

Lastly, Delia was glad that she had the opportunity to start a loan that fit her needs; because with the purchase of agricultural supplies, she will improve and grow her potato production, and will have better sales. This will improve her standard of living and social situation, to the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure (chicken droppings), which will improve her potato production so she will have better sales which will improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang, 59, lives in a community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two dependent children. To support the family, she works very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. The net profit that she can generate is USD 5.00 a day, on average. As a supplementary income, she came up with a new business idea.  She wants to raise ducks for sale. However, her insufficient capital doesn’t allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy ducks. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her living standard. She is thankful for all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy ducks.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, 46, is a farmer living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of six children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school.

Growing cassava is the main source of her family’s income, while rice growing is an additional source of income for her. She has been involved in these businesses for 24 years. Unfortunately, the cassava price dropped, which resulted in decreasing the family’s income.

Seng has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five loans already. The past loan enabled her to generate more income to update her family's standard of living, and it was fully paid back.

For this new loan, Seng will spend her entire loan portion on purchasing organic fertilizer, organic pesticide, and seeds to increase productivity of her crop yield. She hopes to expand this business so as to continue sending her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer, organic pesticide, and seeds to increase the productivity of her crop yield.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is a hard working mother who always assures that she has enough income for the future of her family. She and her husband are engaged in a farming business. They grow corn on their farm. With her desire to have an additional source of income, Adoracion also has a retail business. She sells various grocery items in their village.

Adoracion wanted to expand the products she is selling, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do that. She is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy drinks, biscuits, powdered milk, condiments, and many more items. Adoracion hopes to earn a larger income that she will use to invest in their farming business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, biscuits, powdered milk, condiments, and many more items.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María de 48 años de edad es una madre soltera y trabajadora que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus cuatro hijos de 20, 14, 12 y 7 años de edad. María es una mujer que siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su trabajo en el cual se dedica a la venta de pan dulce como marquesote, salpores, cachitos, quesadillas, etc. desde hace veinticinco años, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con esa fuente de ingresos. María desea encementar el piso de la vivienda así como hacer un afinado a las paredes y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y la mano de obra y de esta manera mejorar su vivienda. Ella desea contar con este apoyo para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and is a hardworking, single mother. She lives in her own home together with her four children who are 20, 14, 12, and 7 years old. Maria is a woman who always pushes herself to carry her family forward which she does through her job.

She works selling sweet breads such as marquesote, salpores, cachitos, quesadillas, etc. She has been doing this for 25 years and is happy to be able to count on this source of income. Maria hopes to lay a cement floor in her home as well as refine the walls. For this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel and labor in order to improve her home. She hopes to rely on this support in order to be able to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and labor to build a cement floor and to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 57 years old, married and supports 6 children. He has been a small scale farmer for the last 6 years earning an income of KES 18,000 per month.

Nicholas has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and a wheelbarrow. He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a cow for milk production to sell to clients and for his family's use. He hopes to eradicate poverty and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Agustina, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajadora y responsable; se dedica al comercio de frutas tropicales: naranja, mandarina, plátano, palta; como los principales productos agrícolas de mayor demanda en el mercado. Comercializa estos productos en el sector del hospital de Colomi, no tiene un puesto fijo para vender, solamente lo hace en los lugares donde hay espacio vacío. Esta actividad es continua durante todo el año, con alguna rotación de mercadería según la temporada de cosecha de las frutas. La señora Agustina requiere el préstamo para el comercio de frutas.
Por último, la señora Agustina se sintió contenta al tener la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo que se adecúa a sus necesidades, porque garantizará la estabilidad de su actividad económica y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorará su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Agustina lives and works in Colomi. She is economically independent, hard-working, and responsible. She sells tropical fruits: oranges, mandarins, bananas, and avocados are the principal agricultural products in greatest demand in the market. She sells these products in the hospital sector of Colomi. She doesn't have a regular sales stand; she only sells in places where there is an empty space. This business continues during the entire year, with some rotation of merchandise according to the harvest season of the fruits. Señora Agustina needs the loan for her fruit business

Finally, Señora Agustina feels happy to have the opportunity to access a loan that is tailored to her needs, because it will guarantee the stability of her business, and she will have greater sales, which will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her production of citrus fruits and products to sell, and to improve the income for her family.

loans.name: Odessa

texts.en:
Odessa is glad to have her business. She is happy managing it and serving her costumers.

Odessa sells a variety of clothes in the market. She also offers catering services for all occasions. To make additional income, Odessa is also creating invitations, and offers gowns for rent.

Odessa humbly asks for additional capital for her business. She needs additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy clothes to sell in her stall. She will also use the loan to buy materials for creating invitations.

Odessa hopes to earn bigger income for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and materials to create invitations to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 42, lives in Kampong Thom Province of Cambodia. She is a mother of five children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business. She grows cassava and sells the crop to local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for almost twenty years. She is able to make an income of USD 4.00 per day, on average.

To assist her farming process, she would like to have a cart to carry many heavy farming materials from her house to the rice field but she can’t afford it. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a cart to use in her farming process. This loan will help to make her farming operations less difficult. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in PVC pipes, water faucets, fees and labor for the installation of potable water in her home.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza" es un grupo integrado por cuatro mujeres unidas por el lazo de amistad. Entre ellas existe una gran confianza que les ha permitido sacar adelante el grupo de préstamo. El lugar donde crecieron, se caracteriza por contar con todos los servicios básicos a diferencia de otras comunidades aledañas.

 Eugenia es una mujer muy alegre y amable, ella tiene 37 años de edad y está casada con José; juntos formaron una familia con tres niños, dos de ellos estudian la primaria y la más pequeña está a punto de entrar al preescolar. 

 Kena, como le dicen de cariño, inició su pequeño taller de costura hace seis años. Todo comenzó ya que trabajó en una fábrica textil durante tres años, donde adquirió la experiencia suficiente para sentirse segura y decidir emprender su propia actividad. El taller está ubicado en su casa donde realiza composturas o confecciona prendas especiales que le solicitan sus clientes. Kena recuerda que compró su primera máquina de coser con sus propios ahorros, con paso del tiempo logró comprar otra máquina gracias al apoyo de VFMéxico que durante cuatro años ha sido su fuente de financiamiento. Con el nuevo préstamo comprará materia prima para continuar su actividad como tela, agujas, hilos, cierres, listones, resortes, entre otros. Kena siempre hace lo posible por aprovechar su crédito al máximo haciendo una buena inversión ya que busca los mejores precios.

 Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en su educación "Me gustaría que pudieran terminar una carrera profesional para tener una mejor calidad de vida" comentó Kena.

 Las demás integrantes del grupo son Sara quien invertirá en borregos; Verónica, en conejos y María de los Ángeles, en pollos y tortillas.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el taller de Kena, ella es quien porta lentes.
texts.en:
"La Esperanza" (The Hope) is a group formed by four women united by the bonds of friendship. Among them there exists a great confidence that has allowed them to advance their loan group. The place where they grew up is characterized by having all the basic services, in contrast to other nearby communities.

Eugenia is a very happy and friendly woman. She is 37 years old and is married to José. Together they have formed a family with three children; two of them are in primary school and the youngest is about to enter preschool.

Kena, as she [Eugenia] is known to her friends, began her little sewing workshop six years ago. Everything began because she worked in a textile factory for three years, where she acquired sufficient experience to feel confident and decide to set up her own business. The workshop is located in her house, where she does alterations or makes special items of clothing that her customers request. Kena remembers that she bought her first sewing machine with her own savings. With the passing of time, she managed to buy another machine thanks to the support of VFMexico, which for four years has been her source of financing. With the new loan, she will buy basic supplies to continue her work, such as fabric, needles, thread, closures, and elastic, among other items. Kena always does whatever is possible to take maximum advantage of her loan, making a good investment, since she seeks the best prices.

Her dream is to make her business grow in order to continue supporting her children in their education. "I would like them to be able to complete professional courses of study in order to have a better quality of life," comments Kena.

The other members of the group are Sara, who will invest in sheep; Veronica, [who will invest] in rabbits; and Maria de los Angeles,  [who will invest] in chickens and tortillas.

The photograph was taken in Kena's workshop. She is the one wearing glasses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, thread, closures, ribbons, and elastic, among other items.

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen, 46 years old, is married and supports five school children. She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to supplement her farming activity by using farmyard manure to improve productivity.

Callen plans to use the increased profits to expand her farming activity and educate her children. She hopes to improve her family living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supplement her farming activity by using farmyard manure to improve productivity.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 57 years old. He lives in Ozurgeti district with his wife and son.

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow fruits and vegetables to sell seasonally.

Tengiz wants to start a trading business, and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of GEL 5,000 to begin trading in nuts. With the credit received, he will purchase a stock of nuts and will resell it at a higher price to increase family income.

Tengiz hopes that the business will be profitable, and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in nuts.

loans.name: Khokima

texts.ru: 42 летняя дехканка из района Шахринав, Хокима. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Муж тоже занимается растениеводством. Хокима имеет земельный участок для растениеводством. Больше времени она проводить на земле, потому что доход от растениеводство обеспечить ее семью. В течение 10 лет Хокима освоила все навыки сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она каждый год сажает помидоры. После посадки она всегда отрабатывает землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить вовремя и качественный урожай. Сейчас она нуждается в кредит, чтобы приобрести минеральные удобрения и продвигать растениеводство.  Ваша поддержка очень нужно Хокиме.
texts.en: Khokima is a 42-year-old farmer from the Shahrinav district. She is married and has two children. Her husband also plants crops. Khokima has a plot of land for her crops. She spends a lot of her time farming because this is how she supports her family. Khokima has mastered agricultural skills over the past ten years and she grows tomatoes every year. After planting she always treats the land with fertilizer to yield a plentiful harvest. She currently needs a loan to purchase fertilizer and boost her crops. Khokima needs your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Wenie

texts.en:
Wenie lives in the town of Mayorga, Leyte. She is thirty years old and married with two young dependents ages 5 and 6 years old. She sells fresh fish to the locals in the community.

Her husband is a fisherman. She has been engaged in fishing for almost nine years now. Wenie is standing in front of the motorboat engine that is waiting for repair.

She is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of her fishing boat engine. With these repairs, her husband's catch will improve, which will enable more fish to be sold. She will be able to purchase nutritious meals and continue to finance the schooling of her children. She will also be better able to settle her obligations and handle her finances.

Wenie would like to expand her livelihood to support the needs of her growing children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her fishing boat engine.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es: La señora Anacleta, vive y trabaja en Colomi, económicamente es independiente, trabajadora y responsable. Es divorciada, su esposo la abandonó hace tiempo dejándola sola junto a sus hijos, ella mantiene sola con los gastos familiares en su casa. Se dedica al comercio de papa como el principal producto agrícola de mayor demanda en el mercado. Comercializa este producto en la ciudad de Cochabamba, en el sector del triángulo, no tiene un puesto fijo para vender, solamente lo hace en los lugares donde hay espacio vacío. Esta actividad es continua durante todo el año, con alguna rotación de mercadería según la temporada de cosecha de las frutas. La señora Anacleta requiere el préstamo para comercio de papa. Por ese motivo, vino a solicitar un préstamo, el cual le será de mucha ayuda.                                                                                                                                                                  Por último, la señora Anacleta se sintió contenta al tener la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo que se adecúa a sus necesidades, porque su capital operativo garantizará la estabilidad de su actividad económica y tendrá mayores ventas que mejorará su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Anacleta lives and works in Colomi. She is a responsible, hard worker and is economically independent. She is divorced as her husband abandoned her some time ago, leaving her alone with her children. Alone she supports her family's household expenses. She works in the potato trade, which is the principal agricultural product in greatest demand in the market.

She sells her products in the city of Cochabamba, in the triangle sector. She does not have a permanent place to sell, she only does it in places where there is an open space. This business is one that continues year round with some rotation of merchandise depending on the harvest season of the fruits.

Anacleta requests the loan for the potato business. For this reason she is asking for a loan, which will be very helpful for her. Finally, Anacleta feels happy to have the opportunity to access a loan which will adapt to her needs because her operating capital will guarantee the stability of her business and she will have greater sales, which will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her potato production and improve her sales in order to generate greater income for her family.

loans.name: Ghaleb

texts.en:
Ghaleb is a 57-year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee. Three years ago, he opened a grocery shop to increase his income and cover the needs and expenses of his beloved children.

Ghaleb is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is well known in his region. He is trying desperately to develop his business. Thus today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with new items and products to satisfy his customers' requests.

Ghaleb hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with new items and products

loans.name: Liliam Marlem

texts.es:
La señora Liliam es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio propio el cual es la venta de baleadas, platos de comida y golosinas esto lo realiza hace más de dos años, este negocio lo atiende desde su casa de habitación, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes los cuales son: vendedores ambulantes dueños de locales cercanos y personas que transitan a diario. 
Doña Liliam está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de productos como ser: frijoles, harina, café, huevos, aguacate, refrescos, mantequilla, queso etc. Para la elaboración de su producto. Ya que esto mejorara sus ventas y a su vez su fuente de ingreso.
Doña Liliam uno de sus sueños es mejorar su casa y que su negocio siga creciendo.


Danli, Honduras  - Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Liliam is a very hard-working woman. She devotes herself to her own business, which is selling 'baleadas' [flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat], plates of food, and sweets. She has been doing this for over two years. She tends to this business from her house. She gets up very early in order to tend to her customers who are itinerant sellers, owners of nearby places, and people who travel by daily.

Liliam is requesting the loan to buy products like beans, rice, flour, coffee, eggs, avocados, soft drinks, shortening, and cheese, etc. in order to make her products. This will improve her sales and her source of income at the same time. One of Liliam's dreams is to improve her house and for her business to continue growing.

Danli, Honduras - July, 2015

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, coffee, eggs, avocados, soft drinks, shortening, and cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Erlis

texts.es:
La señora Erlis es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio,  su fuente principal de ingresos provienen de su negocio que es la venta de combustibles, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y tiene  9 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Doña Erlis se levanta muy temprano para poder atender a sus clientes y su negocio  es el único en la zona, sus principales clientes son vecinos de su comunidad y alrededores, esta solicita el préstamo para la compra de combustibles porque se acerca la temporada de siembra de sandia y la demanda de los combustibles es mayor.
Doña Erlis sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en una pequeña gasolinera y así poder mejorar su fuente de ingresos y calidad de vida.


Danli, Honduras - Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Erlis is an entrepreneurial woman and is dedicated to her business. Her primary source of income comes from her business which is the sale of fuel. She runs her business out of her home and has been doing this work for nine years.

Erlis wakes up very early in order to serve her clients. Her business is the only one in the area and her main clients are neighbors from her community and surrounding communities. She is asking for a loan to buy fuel because the watermelon harvest season is approaching and the demand for fuel is greater.

Erlis dreams of being able to expand her business and convert it into a small gas station in order to improve her source of income and quality of life.

Danli, Honduras - July 2015.

loans.use: to buy fuel for her business.

loans.name: Sach's Group

texts.en:
Aged 63, Sach, is a farmer from Kampong Cham Province. She is a widowed mother and takes care of a dependent child who is in school.

Sach has been growing rice and cassava as the main source of income for 45 years. Moreover, she grows cashews for supplemental income to complement her family’s needs. These businesses earn her about 48,500 KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

Her rice crops grew unhealthily and produced low outputs. In this group of two members, she, the group leader, will use her loan to purchase organic pesticides and organic fertilizer to grow her crop fruitfully. This will be Sach’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).

She hopes to earn more income so as to provide family members with good healthcare services and to continue sending her child to school until graduation.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticides and organic fertilizer to grow her crop fruitfully

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is glad that she she can spend the day at her business. She cares for her three children and operates a grocery store in her village. She wants to provide her children with an education. Marife’s dream is for her children to finish their studies and become professionals. She wants them to have decent jobs and earn enough income to be self sufficient.

Marife will use the loan to extend her business and increase her profit by buying noodles, powdered milk, coffee, sugar, and other items. Marife believes that the loan will have a big role in helping her to attain her dreams.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as noodles, powdered milk, coffee, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 35 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 28 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même quartier qui ont de bonnes relations qui s'activent dans le commerce et la tannerie. 
ADAMA  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main  est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants dont 3 garçons et 2 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter du savon, de l'omo et du sucre chez les grossistes car elle dispose d'une boutique au niveau de sa localité. Elle achète 3 caisses de savon l’unité à 7500 FCFA et la revend à 8100 FCFA. Elle achète aussi 1 sac d'omo à 8000 FCFA et le cède à 9500 FCFA. Elle achète enfin 1 sac de sucre de 50 kilo à 25 000 FCFA et le revend à 28 000 FCFA. Elle fait un apport personnel de 5500 FCFA. 
Les bénéfices serviront à rembourser son prêt et satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
This group of 35 members is part of the 'banc villageois' which was created on December 28, 2009. It is composed of women from the same district who all get along well with one another and who are active in commerce and in tannery.

ADAMA, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 54 years old and a married mother of five children (3 boys and 2 girls).

With this loan in hand, she is going to purchase some soap, Omo [brand of detergent], and some sugar from wholesalers, since she has a shop in town. She buys 3 cases of soap at 7,500 each and resells each unit for 8,100 francs CFA. She also buys a bag of Omo at 8,000 francs and sells it for 9,500 francs. Finally she buys a 50-kg sack of sugar at 25,000 francs and resells it for 28,000 francs. Her personal contribution is 5,500 francs.

The profits will be used to pay back the loan and to support herself.

loans.use: to purchases soap, Omo, and some sugar

loans.name: Nabih

texts.en:
Nabih is a 60-year-old married man with two children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he started to sell coffee a year ago to cover his family's needs and expenses.

Nabih is a hard worker who is now well-known in his region. He requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which will support his business. He hopes to expand his business, increase his income, and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Doricah

texts.en:
Doricah, who is 25 years old, is married and supports two children. She is a small-scale farmer earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Doricah has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 25,000 to buy a dairy cow as a supplement to her farming activity and to improve productivity.

Doricah plans to use the gained profits to expand her farming activity and educate her children. She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supplement her farming activity and to improve productivity.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San, who is a local farmer in the Bakan district of Pursat province, is 19 years old and a married mother of a small child.

Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income. Moreover, San sells firewood and works for others for a fee to earn additional income. She has been involved in her job for one year. Because of drought, her crops did not grow well, causing her to earn less income.

Due to a lack of capital for supporting business, San and her group member decide to apply for a Kiva loan of 1,400,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first time for them.

As the leader, San will use her loan portion to buy a three-wheeled vehicle to transport her firewood to sell in her village. She hopes to earn more income so that she can improve her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy a three-wheeled vehicle to drive her firewood to sell in her village.

loans.name: Soklen's Group

texts.en:
Soklen is a 39-year-old married woman with six dependent children, two attend school. She is a local farmer living in Kampong Cham province who raises pigs and sells grocery items. She earned less income this past year due to the poor health of her pigs.

This is the first time for Soklen with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the 4-member group's leader and will use her loan to buy pig feed and vaccines to protect the pigs from disease.

She hopes to earn more income,improve the living standard, and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vaccinations.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dave

texts.en: Dave wants a loan to buy second-hand clothes to resell. She sells her products in the free market stall shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to resell.

loans.name: Sdoeurng

texts.en:
Sdoeurng, 29, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has two children who attend school. She has managed and operated a small rice farmland located near her house for ten years and earns $5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house. She requests a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: La Quinta Estación Group

texts.es:
El grupo la quinta estación, por 4ta vez esta solicitando crédito, para impulsar sus pequeños negocios y asi obtener ganancias para el mejoramiento económico. 
Coordinado por  Alejandro, de 61 años, junto a con la ayuda de su compañera de vida y su nuera, mantiene el negocio de destace de cerdos y elaboración de nacatamales para poder obtener ganancias. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años con el dinero que recogió de su trabajo anterior. El Crédito  que obtendrá comprara cerdos pequeños. Con el crédito anterior logro comprar una vaquilla y 6 hojas de zinc para mejorar su casa.
Las demás integrantes son Erminia de 51 años, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, hielo y pan en su hogar. Y Maria quien a sus 21 años comercializa ropa, vende recarga telefónicas y productos cosméticos de la AVON. Generándoles ganancias
texts.en:
The group "La Quinta Estacion" is seeking a loan for the fourth time, to propel their small businesses and obtain profits for their economic improvement.

The group is coordinated by Alejandro who is 61 years old. Together with the help of his life partner and daughter-in-law, he sustains his business of butchering pigs and the production of nacatamales in order to obtain profits. He has had this business for four years which he started with money that he earned in his previous job. With the loan he is asking for, he will buy small pigs. With the previous loan, he was able to buy a heifer and six zinc sheets to improve his home.

The other members are Erminia, who is 51 years old and who works selling soda, ice and bread in her home, and Maria, who is 21 years old and works selling clothing, telephone credit, and Avon cosmetic products. These businesses generate their profits.

loans.use: to buy small pigs.

loans.name: Géminis Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy pequeña se conformó un grupo con el nombre de Géminis las integrantes se muestran orgullosas de pertenecer a una comunidad con raíces indígenas que además se ubica muy cerca de la cabecera municipal, lo que les facilita hacer cualquier trámite en el gobierno o que sus hijos asistan a las mejores escuelas de la región.

 Doña María del Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con sus obligaciones. Ella tiene 49 años, es viuda y no tiene ningún dependiente económico. Desde hace 10  años se dedica la venta de antojitos mexicanos actividad que inició por su gran gusto culinario. "Me encanta cocinar comida de todo tipo, española, mexicana y china, aquí se venden mucho mejor los antojitos mexicanos". 

La dificultad más grande de Carmen, como es mejor conocida, fue al principio cuando no tenía un lugar estable dónde vender la comida. "Ya tengo un lugar frente al palacio de gobierno donde pongo mi puestito ambulante". Carmen tiene un horario de tres de la tarde hasta la media noche para aprovechar el tiempo al máximo. Carmen expresa que las desveladas son un poco complicadas pero le gusta mucho el contacto con sus clientes. 

Su meta es continuar con el negocio que la hace sentir orgullosa además de que le ayuda a sentirse independiente. Con su préstamo comprará mas insumos como gas, verdura, carne, jugos, refrescos, etc.  

Todos los integrantes están muy agradecidos ya que la nueva inversión será de gran ayuda; don José invertirá en blancos (sábanas, colchas y toallas); Saturnina, en artículos para el hogar; Lidia, en cerdos; María Felisa; en becerros; Erika, en ropa y Ofelia y Jessica, en borregos.

 *La fotografía fue tomada en el lugar donde se reúne el grupo, doña Carmen es quien viste el mandil blanco*
texts.en:
The group named Géminis was formed in a very small community. The members are proud to belong to a community with indigenous roots, which is also located very close to the head of the municipality. This makes it easier to deal with any government paperwork or for their children to go to the best schools in the area.

María del Carmen is a very hard-working woman who is responsible about her obligations. She is a 49 year old widow, and she has no financial dependents. She has been selling Mexican dishes for ten years. She started this business activity out of her great culinary enjoyment. "I love to cook all types of food; Spanish, Mexican, and Chinese. Here the Mexican dishes sell much better."

The biggest difficulty that Carmen, as she is best known, had was that in the beginning she had no stable place to sell the food. "Now I have a place in front of the government palace where I put my small mobile stand."

Carmen's schedule is from three in the afternoon until midnight in order to take maximum advantage of the time. Carmen says that staying up late is a little hard, but she really likes the contact with her customers.

Her goal is to continue with her business, which makes her feel proud and also helps her feel independent.

She will use the loan to buy more supplies like gas, vegetables, meat, juices, and soft drinks, etc.

All of the members are very grateful for the new investment, which will be a big help. José will buy linens (sheets, quilts, and towels); Saturina household items; Lidia pigs, María Felisa calves; Erika clothes; Ofelia and Jessica sheep.

*The photo was taken at the place where the group meets. Carmen is the one wearing a white apron.

loans.use: to buy gas, vegetables, meat, juices, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Taysa Katherina

texts.es: Taysa tiene 30 años de edad. Ella eligió la carrera de psicología por que desea ayudar a los demás. Ella se dedica a sus estudios 8 horas. Al culminar sus estudios ella quiere trabajar en el área organizacional. El crédito lo invertirá en la matricula de sus estudios. Ella se siente muy satisfecha ya que a pesar de ser madre puede seguir con sus estudios con el apoyo de su madre. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Taysa is 30 years old. She chose to study psychology because she wants to help others. She dedicates 8 hours to her studies. When she finishes her studies, she wants to work in the field of organizational psychology.

She is asking for a loan to invest in her tuition. She feels very satisfied that despite being a mother, she can continue with her studies with the support of her mother. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 14 Décembre 2010, lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son dixième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Aminata (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 garçons et 03 filles. Elle s’active dans la boulangerie traditionnelle.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter chaque jour 01 sac de farine à 20000f et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer la dépense quotidienne et les soins médicaux au sein de sa famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created on December 14, 2010. This group just started its 6th cycle and is composed of women all living in the same village. They enjoy getting along well with one another and have good team spirit.

Ms. Aminata (standing at the far right with a hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is a married mother of five children (two boys and three girls). She is active in traditional bread-making.

With this loan, she intends each day to purchase a sack of flour at 20,000 francs and other condiments to resell retail.

Her profits will enable her to ensure her day-to-day expenses are covered, as well as the family’s medical care.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of flou and other condiments each day to sell retail

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 17 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 28 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même quartier qui ont de bonnes relations qui s'activent dans le commerce.
NOGOYE  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main  est âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 2 enfants dont 1 garçon et 1 fille.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des denrées alimentaires car elle dispose d'une alimentation générale au niveau de sa maison. Elle achète deux sacs de vermicelle le sac à 12 000 FCFA et le revend à 16 000 FCFA. Elle achète 1 sac de riz à 12 000 FCFA et le revend à 14 000 FCFA. Elle achète enfin un sac de sucre à 25 000 FCFA et le cède à 30 000 FCFAb en raison de 600 FCFA le kilo.
Une partie des  bénéfices générés  servira à rembourser son crédit et épargner et l'autre à investir dans son commerce pour assurer son développement.
texts.en: This 17-member group is part of the banc villageois that was created on December 28, 2009. It groups together women from the same neighborhood who get along well who sell things. NOGOYE, standing to the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 26. She is a married mother of two, a girl and a boy. With this loan, she is going to buy food products, which she uses as general food from her home. She buys two sacks of vermicelli for 12,000 FCFA each and resells them for 16,000 FCFA. She buys one sack of rice for 12,000 FCFA and resells it for 14,000 FCFA. She also buys one bag of sugar for 25,000 FCFA and resells it for 30,000 FCFA at 600 FCFA per kilo. A part of her profits will go towards repaying her loan and for savings, and the other will be reinvested in her business to ensure its development.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
O senhor Alexandre de 50 anos de idade, casado, trabalha como seguranca, pai de 5 filhos, dos quais 2 são maiores de idade e independentes,1 frequenta o ensino primário, e 2 frequenta o ensino secundario e tem 3 netos na sua responsabilidade, vive em casa própria.
Tem um negócio de venda de produtos  diversos em sua casa com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar velas, bolachas, mentas, biscoitos, fosforo, pipocas, dragao,  para reforçar o seu negócio
Tem como sonho ampliar o seu negócio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, melhorar as condições da sua casa e comprar uma viatura para lhe facilitar a compra de mercadoria.
Os principais desafios são financeiros mas tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Alexandre is 50 years old. He works as a security guard, he is married with 5 children, 2 of them are of age and independent, 1 of them is in grade school and 2 of them are in high school. He is also responsible for 3 of his grandchildren and he lives in a house that he owns.
He runs a general store out of his home and with this loan he wants to buy candles, crackers, mints, biscuits, matches, popcorn, lighters to compliment his business.
His dream is to expand his business to cover his customers' needs, improve his home conditions and buy a vehicle to make it easier for him to buy and trasport products.
His main challenges are financial, but he is determined to work and request for more loans to overcome some difficulties and reach his dreams.

loans.use: to buy candles, crackers, mints, biscuits, matches, popcorn, lighters to compliment his business.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 14 Décembre 2010, lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata   (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de miel.

Avec ce nouveau crédit elle compte acheter 05 bouteilles de 20 litres de miel à 1000f le litre pour le revendre en détails et payer un transport de 15000f.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte participer à la dépense quotidienne de sa  famille.
texts.en: This banc villageois was created on December 14, 2010. This group just started its ninth loan cycle and consists of women who all live in the same village. They enjoy a good relationship and group spirit. They are in small businesses. Mrs. Fatoumata (standing to the far right with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is a married mother of one girl. She sells honey. With this new loan, she plans to buy five 20-liter bottles of honey for 1,000 FCFA per liter to resell at retail and to pay 15,000 FCFA for the transport. With the profits, she plans to contribute to the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy five 20-liter bottles of honey for 1,000 FCFA per liter to resell at retail and to pay 15,000 FCFA for its transport.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.pt:
O senhor Lazaro de 59 anos de idade, casado, trabalhador como técnico agrónomo, pai de 8 filhos, dos quais 6 são maiores de idade e independentes, 1 no ensino primário e outro não estuda, vive na casa própria.
Tem um negócio de criação e venda de frangos, com o valor do empréstimo comprar pintos, ração, vacinas, vitaminas, antibióticos, bebedores, para reforçar o seu negócio
Tem como sonho ampliar o seu negócio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, melhorar as condições da sua casa, conseguir um espaço para a criação de suínos, bovinos, e aves para revender.
Os principais desafios são financeiros e doença do filho e pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para suprir as suas dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Lazaro is 59 years old. He works as a soil technician, he is married with 8 children, 6 of them of age and independent, 1 of them in grade school and 1 of them is not attending school. He lives in a house that he owns.
He owns a business selling chicken and with this loan he would like to buy chicks, feed, vaccines, vitamines, antibiotics, troths to expand his business.
His dream is to expand this business to cover his customers' needs, improve his home conditions, and acquire land to raise pigs, cows and birds to resell.
His main challenges are financial, and he also has a son who is ill. He wants to ask for more loans to cover his needs and reach his dreams.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed, vaccines, vitamines, antibiotics, troths to expand his business

loans.name: Sophara

texts.en:
Sophara is a 29-year-old married homemaker with three children and she lives in a village in the province of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Her husband is a 33-year-old construction worker. Two of her three children attend school. Her husband can make approximately $7 each day.

She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy more buffaloes to fatten and breed for calves to sell. With the loan she will be able to improve the family’s finances. For her future plans, Sophara wants to save money to run a small business, build a new proper house and help her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy more buffaloes to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Echarati Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal INMACULADA CONCEPCION DE ECHARATI,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate,provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Silvia tiene 34 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The member, Silvia, belongs to the communal bank Inmaculada Concepción de Echarati. The bank is in the district of Echarati, in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

Silvia is 34 years old, and has one child and a partner. She alternates her daily activities with her business running a grocery store. She has had this business for a good while, and does well at it, thanks to the determination she puts into the business each day.
