She hopes to keep working in order to continue supporting her family.

She seeks a loan for the purchase of rice and sugar, among other things.

The members in general are grateful for the loans provided, and promise to comply with the established payments.

[The person whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank.]

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar among other things.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es: Oscar de 23 años de edad, vive junto su grupo familiar que está conformado por sus padres y una hermana, él es un joven trabajador que  se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una fábrica de ropa la cual está ubicada cerca de su comunidad y es así como con el sueldo devengado el ayuda a mantener la economía  y velar porque en el hogar no falte todo lo necesario. Oscar es un joven visionario que además siempre busca el bienestar de su familia y además busca forma de que  su vivienda cada vez más se vea más bonita y que le brinde la comodidad necesaria. Por lo anterior Oscar con la intención de brindar a su familia una mayor higiene en el hogar desea realizar la construcción de un servicio sanitario lavable ya que actualmente cuenta con uno el cual es de fosa seca y no le brinda la salubridad necesaria que el necesita en su humilde vivienda, por esta razón es que él ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales necesarios como: cemento, hierro, tuberías, inodoro, lavable, ladrillo, etc., y así iniciar lo más pronto posible con dicha construcción.
texts.en:
Oscar is 23 years old and lives with his family which is made up of his parents and one sister. He is a young, hard worker who works offering his services in a clothing factory which is located close to his community. With the salary he has earned, he helps support and care for his family and the household economy so that they do not lack basic necessities in their home.

Oscar is a young visionary who, along with always looking out for the wellbeing of his family, also looks for ways for his home to look nicer and provide the necessary comforts. Oscar, with the intention of providing his family with better hygiene in their home, hopes to build a bathroom as they currently have one that does not have a septic tank and does not provide them with the necessary sanitation that they need in their humble home. For this reason, he has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to buy the necessary materials such as cement, iron, pipes, a flush toilet, bricks, etc. and with this, start with the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, pipes, a flush toilet, bricks, etc. for the construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Cidalia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Cidália tem 46 anos de idade, casada, mãe de três filhos que frequentam o ensino primário e secundário. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Com o financiamento vai comprar fardos de roupa usada e carvão vegetal para revender. O sonho dela é construir um muro na sua residência para sentirˍ se protegida e o desafio é pagar o crédito sem entrar em moras e solicitar outros financiamentos para seus projectos.
texts.en:
Cidália is 46 years old. She is married with three children who attend grade school and high school. She lives in a house that she owns and she doesn't have any other dependents.
With this loan she will buy used clothes in bulk and vegetable charcoal to resell. Her dream is to build a brick wall around her home for security and her challenge is to repay her loan on time and be able to request future loans to complete her projects.

loans.use: to buy used clothes in bulk and vegetable charcoal to resell

loans.name: Ester

texts.pt:
A Sra. Ester tem 48 anos de idade, casada, mãe de três filhos. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta uma nora e uma neta. 
Ela é professora e negociante e com este empréstimo, pretende comprar peixe, camarão, lagosta para revender. Vai aplicar também na compra de novas balanças e apetrechar o próprio mercado.
Ela sonha em fazer o mestrado e doutoramento e o desafio é trabalhar mais para poder materializar o seu sonho.
texts.en:
Ester is 48 years old. She is married with three children. Besides her children, she supports a daughter-in-law and a granddaughter. 
She is a teacher and a businesswoman, and with this loan she wants to buy fish, shrimp and lobster to sell. She will also use the loan to buy new scales and equip her very own booth.
Her dream is to obtain her master's or doctorate and her challenge is to work harder to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, lobster to sell.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS ORQUIDEAS” está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Rosana tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente con 04 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento su bodega en vivienda hace muchos años. En el cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Ella cumple la función de presidenta en el grupo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas abarrotes productos lácteos y bebidas al por mayor. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Rosana es la primera del lado derecho. El grupo tiene como invitada a la esposa de uno de los integrantes del grupo. Ella es la que tiene a sus bebe en brazos.
texts.en:
"Las Orquideas (The Orchids)" loan group is made up of members dedicated to retail.

Rosana is 39 years old, she has a partner and 4 dependent children. She installed her store in her house many years ago. In the store she offers staple items. She carries the role of President in the loan group.

She will invest the loan into buying more groceries, dairy products and soft drinks at wholesale prices. The group thanks the KIVA lenders for the given loan.

Rosana is the first to the right, and there is a guest wife of one of the members of the group in the picture. She is the one with the baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy products and soft drinks at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Chroep

texts.en:
Chroep, 41, lives in a community of Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. She has five children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business. She primarily grows cassava and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers and customers in the market. So far, she has been in this business for around twenty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 3.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. She is thankful to lenders for the financial support.

She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Yoxaja 4 Group

texts.es:
Antonia (la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa color celeste) es emprendedora, entusiasta con la visión de superación y su mayor anhelo es que su familia tenga lo necesario, ella dese hace varios años se ha dedicado a la agricultura y con el afán de incrementar su cultivo tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo con el que tuvo la oportunidad de darle el mantenimiento de su cultivo de banano que en ese momento necesitaba mantenimiento, afortunadamente  le fue muy bien con la cosecha y logro venderlos en su mercado regional, con las ganancias que obtuvo logro comprar una cuerda de terreno donde actualmente se encuentra cultivando café que en estos días se ha dado cuenta que es muy necesario su mantenimiento, es por ello que nuevamente solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.
El gran sueño de Antonia es seguir aumentado su cultivo de café para prosperar con su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia (the first woman on the left in the blue blouse) is an entrepreneur who is enthusiastic of the vision of improvement. Her greatest wish is that her family has all that they need. For many years, she has worked in agriculture. With the desire to increase her crop, she made the decision to get a loan with which she had the opportunity to maintain her banana crop which needed it at that time.

Fortunately, her harvest went very well and she was able to sell the bananas in her regional market. With the profits she earned she was able to buy a plot of land where she is currently growing coffee. In these days, she has realized that maintenance of her coffee crop is very necessary. It is because of this that she is again asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and to pay for labor. Antonia's big dream is to continue expanding her coffee crop in order to prosper with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Marlon Ernesto

texts.es: Marlon tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa humilde pero de su propiedad junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando con el deseo de llegar a ser algo importante en sus vidas. Marlon es un padre ejemplar quien apoyado en su trabajo el cual consiste en prestar sus servicios como vendedor en una ferretería en su municipio logra llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, además también recibe un ingreso extra ya que cuatro veces por semana lo contratan como motorista para transporte de diversas mercaderías a diferentes puntos de su municipio y sus alrededores. Marlon con el sueño de ver mejorada su condición habitacional y brindar mayor seguridad y protección a su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito  a FUSAI para la compra de materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, y demás materiales para iniciar la construcción de paredes de su casa las cuales actualmente son de lámina.
texts.en:
Marlon is 31 years old. He lives in a humble house, but on his own property, with his wife and two children, who are 8 and 6 years old and in school with the hopes of becoming something important in their lives.

Marlon is an exemplary father who, supported by his job, which consists of serving as a clerk in a hardware store in his town, manages to bring home the daily bread. He also receives an extra income, because four times a week, he is contracted as a bike driver to transport various merchandise to different points in his town and the surrounding areas.

With the dream of seeing his living conditions improved and giving more security and protection to his family, Marlon has made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, brick and other materials to begin building the walls of his house which are currently made of metal sheets.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick and other materials to begin building the walls of his house which are currently made of metal sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof of his home and the front of his house, which is currently metal sheeting that is deteriorating.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to improve the roof of her kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Aroma Group

texts.es:
Doña Adela es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora tiene 52 años y es madre soltera de tres hijos de los cuales ya solo uno depende de ella y se encuentra estudiando su educación secundaria. 

Desde hace 25 años doña Adela se dedica a la cría de animales como pollos, pavos, patos, cerdos y borregos; recientemente ha solicitado un crédito para comprar 4 cerdos más y láminas para remodelar el corral donde los conserva ya que la temporada de lluvias ha comenzado y necesita mantener a los animales en las mejores condiciones. 

Ella decidió iniciar esta actividad ya que es una costumbre en la comunidad donde vive, además porque necesitaba hallar la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Adela aprendió la actividad gracias a su madre, lo que la hace muy preciada ya que también obtiene ingresos y de cierta forma ayuda a la comunidad al vender animales de mejor calidad ya que son cuidados en casa. Unos de los retos más grandes que presenta doña Adela es cuando los animales enferman por lo que siempre necesita invertir parte de sus ganancias en vitaminas y veterinarios. Con las ganancias, Adela también logró comenzar a vender dulces y botanas. Las ganancias de esta actividad las invierte completamente en la educación de sus hijos. Por si fuera poco VFMéxico la apoyó para tener un huerto familiar y ha comenzado a vender algunas verduras en la comunidad.

La meta de Adela es que todos sus hijos terminen de estudiar una carrera profesional que además puedan ejercer. Recientemente su hijo José Luis terminó su Licenciatura en Educación logro que también atribuye al apoyo de los créditos de VFMéxico que le permitieron continuar con su actividad. "Gracias a los préstamos ahora tengo mis animales, mi puesto de botanas y el huerto que me otorgo la institución".

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Maria Maura, Agripina y Angélica quienes invierten en pollos y pavos; por su parte Ma Lourdes, Maria Teresa y Adriana, en cerdos; Magdalena, en herrería y Elma Edith, en borregos.

 *La fotografia fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosco del municipio, Adela es quien viste el suéter morado y está ubicaada en la parte superior.
texts.en:
Adela is a very happy and hard-working person. She is 52 years old and a single mother of three children, of which only one depends on her and is in secondary school.

Adela has worked raising animals such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, pigs and lambs for 25 years. She has recently asked for a loan to buy 4 more pigs and metal sheets to remodel the farmyard, because the rainy season has begun and she needs to keep her animals in the best condition.

She decided to start this job because it is custom in the community that she lives in, as well as because she needed to find a way to support her children. She learned the work thanks to her mother, making her very precious because she also receives earnings and in a way she helps the community to sell better quality animals because they are cared for at home. One of the biggest challenges that Adela has is when the animals get sick and she has to invest part of her earnings into vitamins and veterinarians. With the earnings, Adela also managed to begin to sell sweets and snacks. She invests the earnings from this work completely into her children's education. If that were not enough, VFMéxico supported her to have a home garden and she has begun to sell some vegetables in the community.

Adela's goal is that all of her children finish studying a professional career that they can put into practice. Recently, her son José Luis finished his Teaching Certification, an achievement that she can attribute to the support of the loans from VFMéxico, who allowed her to continue with her work. "Thanks to the loans, I now have my animals, my snack stall and the garden that the institution gave me."

The other members of the group are Maria Maura, Agripina and Angélica (chickens and turkeys), Ma Lourdes, Maria Teresa and Adriana (pigs), Magdalena (ironworks), and Elma Edith (sheep).

*The photo was taken on the stairs of the town kiosk. Adela is dressed in a purple sweater and is positioned in the back.

loans.use: to buy 4 more pigs and metal sheets to remodel the farmyard.

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children. One child is still in school and the other one is still young. For six years, Stella has been selling plain chips as well as chips with meatballs, with chicken and with eggs. She works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly income.

This will be Stella's sixth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a large frying pan, a big charcoal stove, additional meat, chicken and eggs, sacks of Irish potatoes, containers of cooking oil and sacks of charcoal for cooking the chips. She is doing great with these loans and appreciates Kiva for supporting her and her group.

She has used her profits to pay for school fees. She also bought a TV set, a radio and a sofa set. In addition, she repaid her loans and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy eggs, meat, chicken, Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

Stella will make sure that she pays back her loan within the scheduled time. She dreams of expanding her business by opening another place to sell chips.

loans.use: to buy eggs, meat, chicken, Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
Don Rosalio es originario de una comunidad muy apacible arraigada en la cultura y tradición mazahua. Aún existen habitantes que conservan su lengua materna y que son dignos de admiración por preservar la cultura. Las actividades que dominan la economía son la cría de animales y el cultivo de maíz.
   Además de ser una persona responsable y trabajadora, Don Rosalio se distingue por su profunda amabilidad. Para él no existe mayor motivación que su familia integrada por su esposa María del Rosario y sus tres hijos pequeños quienes estudian distintos niveles escolares. Para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar decidió poner en práctica los estudios que cursó en mecánica y ahora lleva quince años a cargo de una refaccionaria, además continúa actualizándose, "hace algunos meses tomé otros cursos que me han ayudado a mejorar el servicio" comenta. No obstante al principio no fue sencillo abrir su negocio ya que, aunque contaba con los conocimientos, no tenía el capital suficiente para invertir en él; sin embargo, con ayuda de sus hermanos logró inaugurar el negocio y ahora todos se benefician del mismo.
   Por otro lado, los préstamos adquiridos con VFMéxico han sido de gran ayuda ya que con ellos mantiene una gran variedad de mercancía en la refaccionaria. Del tal modo que está muy agradecido con VFMéxico y KIVA pues el número de clientes sigue en aumento e incluso planea abrir un nuevo local dentro del municipio. En esta ocasión necesita comprar aceites y lubricantes; productos que ocupa con mayor frecuencia. 
   Con sus ingresos ahora es capaz de pagar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos sin complicaciones. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Don Rosalio.
texts.en:
Don Rosalio is from a very peaceful community that is rooted in the Mazahua culture and tradition. There are still residents who preserve their mother tongue, and are worthy of admiration for preserving the culture. The occupations that dominate the economy here are raising animals and growing corn.

In addition to being a responsible and hardworking person, Don Rosalio is distinguished by his profound kindness. For him, there is no greater motivation than his family, which is composed of his wife, María del Rosario, and their three young children who are studying in different grades in school.

In order to cover the household expenses, he decided to put his mechanic's studies into practice, and now he has been in charge of a repair shop for fifteen years. And, he continues to stay current: "Some months ago, I took other courses that have helped me to improve service", he comments. Even so, at the beginning, opening his business was not a simple matter, because although he had the skills, he didn't have enough capital to invest in it. However, with the help of his brothers, he was able to launch the business, and now everyone is benefiting from it.

Moreover, the loans acquired with VF México have been a great help, as he maintains a great variety of merchandise in his repair shop with them. So, he is very grateful to VF México and Kiva, as the number of customers continues growing, and he is even planning to open a new repair shop within the municipality. On this occasion he needs to purchase oils and lubricants, which are the products he uses most. With his current earnings, he is capable of paying for his household expenses and his children's education, without complications.

*The photograph was taken at Rosalio's business.

loans.use: to purchase oils and lubricants.

loans.name: Sokleng's Group

texts.en:
Sokleng, who is a married mother of a dependent child, is 47 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. The main source of her family’s income is from growing rice, which she has been doing for years. The crops, which were expected to produce good yields, were destroyed by pests and drought.

Sokleng is a new borrower leading a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to build a decent house for her family. She hopes to have a better place to live so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent house for her family.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt: O Sr. José tem 39 anos de idade, casado, pai de seis filhos dos quais dois são menores de idade e os restantes frequentam a escola. Trabalha numa empresa como operador e como o salário não chega para suprir as despesas de casa, faz fogões, grades e presta serviços de canalização, trabalho este que faz aos fins de semanas e feriados. Com o empréstimo pretendido, vai comprar varões, chapas de alumínio para fabricar grades e fogões para revender. Sonha em concluir a sua casa e melhorar a dieta alimentar. O desafio que tem é reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en: José is 39 years old. He is married with six children, 2 of them small and the rest attending school. He works for a company as an operator and his salary is not enough to cover his household needs, so he builds grills and cookers and he also works as a pipe layer on the weekends and holidays. With this loan, he will buy beams and aluminum sheets to build grills and cookers to sell. His dream is to finish his home and improve his food diet. His biggest challenge is to be able to repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy beams, aluminum sheets, to build grills and cookers to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 42-year-old married mother of four and a Palestinian refugee. A year ago, she opened her own clothing shop. She has eighteen years of experience in this domain because she used to sell clothes from her house to help her husband cover the needs of their beloved children.

Lina is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who has a good reputation in her region. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her stock of merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.

Lina hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem, 30, lives in the community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland located near her house. She has been in this type of business for around 10 years. On average, she is able to make an income of $5 (US) per day.

Kem wants to improve her family's general living conditions by having a latrine, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing through Kiva to build a latrine.

By doing so, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation and promote their health as well as help lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for this loan, which is granted through Hattha Kaksekar at a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Ranchería Group

texts.es:
Para cierta comunidad del Estado de México la lluvia es un regalo vital de la naturaleza pues con ella los cultivos crecen grandes y frescos mientras que el césped se torna abundante y alimenta a los animales. De allí son originarias cinco mujeres cuyo sello característico es que conservan las tradiciones y lengua de la cultura mazahua, de tal modo que es sumamente interesante escuchar como conversan entre ellas.
      María Luisa estaba convencida de que en el momento de formar una familia necesitaba igualmente tener una actividad que aportara ingresos a su hogar. La cría de ganado representó la mejor opción para alcanzar su objetivo ya que, adicionalmente a las ganancias, tenía el tiempo necesario para cuidar de sus hijos. 
   En un inicio no contaba con un corral debidamente establecido además de criar sólo pocos ejemplares, ahora tiene un corral bien cimentado y una mayor producción en gran medida gracias al apoyo de VFMéxico. "El préstamo me ha ayudado a mejorar mi negocio y aportar para solventar los gastos de mi hogar" comenta contenta María Luisa. Con la nueva oportunidad de crédito podría comprar tres ovejas pequeñas ya que son los animales que mejor se venden en la comunidad sobre todo por las personas dedicadas a realizar la tradicional barbacoa mexicana.
   La meta que tiene en mente es ampliar su clientela para percibir mejores ganancias y poder ahorrar para su retiro. No obstante, no planea hacerlo pronto ya que el trabajo es la única manera de sentirse vivo según comenta. 
 Yolanda, Maria Luisa C, Maribel y Maria Manuela invertiran en borregos.
*La fotografía fue tomada enfrente de la iglesia municipal, Doña María Luisa F. es quien viste el traje típico de la región.
texts.en:
For a certain community of the State of Mexico, rain is a vital gift from nature because, with her, the crops grow big and fresh while the grass becomes abundant and feeds the animals. There are five women who are from there and whose characteristic seal is that they conserve the traditions and native language between them.

María Luisa was convinced the moment she started a family that she also needed to have a job to bring income into her home. Raising animals looked like the best option to achieve her goal because, adding to her earnings, she had the time she needed to look after her children. At the beginning, she did not have a duly established farmyard and only raised a few animals. Now she has a well-cemented farmyard and a greater production, thanks to the support of VFMéxico in a large degree.

"The loan has helped me improve my business and contribute to paying the household expenses," says a happy María Luisa.

With the new loan opportunity, she can buy three small lambs, which are the best-selling animals in the community, especially to the people who make a living making traditional Mexican barbacoa. The goal that she has in mind is to increase her clientele to receive better earnings and be able to save for her retirement. However, she has no plans to retire soon because work is the only way to feel alive, as she says.

Other members of the group are Yolanda, Maria Luisa C, Maribel and Maria Manuela, who will invest into lambs.

*The photo was taken in front of the town church. María Luisa F. is dressed in traditional clothing from the region.

loans.use: to buy lambs for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 47 years old, married and supports three children. She is a small-scale farmer earning an income of KES 16,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 25,000 to assist her in adopting modern farming techniques such as a greenhouse to improve her productivity to earn more income.

She plans to use the gained profits to expand her farming activity and educate her children. She hopes to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to adopt modern farming techniques such as a greenhouse to improve her productivity to earn more income.

loans.name: Razhden

texts.en:
Razhden is 44 years old. He lives with his wife, two children and his pensioner father in the small village of Tkhilnari. Razhden is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he cultivates family-owned agricultural land to grow fruits and vegetables. In addition the family runs a husbandry business. They have cows and sell produced dairy products.

Razhden decided to start a more stable business alongside his agricultural activities and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of GEL 6,000. With the received credit he will purchase a truck and will work on transportation activities in order to generate a stable income. Razhden is very hardworking and motivated to increase his family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to use for transportation in order to generate a stable income

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été créé le 14 Décembre 2010, lors l’inauguration du dit banc villageois. Ce groupement vient d’entamer son neuvième cycle et  compte des femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Kadiatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants  dont 02 garçons et 02 filles. Elle est vendeuse de denrée alimentaire. 

Son nouveau prêt va lui permettre d’acheter 03 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme à 60000f et 02 paniers de poissons fumés à 10000f le panier pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices réalisés, lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de scolarisation de ses enfants et d’assurer la dépense quotidienne de ses enfants
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' was created on December 14, 2010. This group just started its 9th cycle and is composed of women all living in the same village. They enjoy getting along well with one another and have good team spirit. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Kadiatou (standing at the far right with a hand raised) is the group’s featured borrower. She is a married mother of four children (two boys and two girls). She sells grocery items.

Her new loan will enable her to purchase three 20-liter containers of palm oil at 60,000 francs; and two baskets of smoked fish at 10,000 francs per basket, to sell retail.

The profits earned will enable her to meet her children’s schooling needs and to cover their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and  smoked fish to resell retail

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 47 years old, is married and supports three children. She is a hardworking small-scale farmer earning 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Alice has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Visionfund Kenya to purchase modern sweet banana suckers to improve quality banana production. She plans to use her profits to have a stabilized banana plantation and educate her children. Alice hopes to buy a dairy cow to supplement her farming activity and eventually improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase modern sweet banana suckers to  improve quality banana production.

loans.name: Teang

texts.en:
Teang is a 22- year-old woman living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Memot district. Teang is married and has two dependent children who are too young for school. Growing cassava and rice have been the primary sources of her family’s income for three years. She can earn income of about 23,000 KHR per day. After her expenses, she is able to save around 10,000 KHR each day.

This is Teang’s third cycle with VisionFund. She repaid her past loans completely. The previous loans helped her family with sufficient foods. Now she is requesting a new loan to buy pesticides for her farmland and to plow the field. She hopes to gain high crop yields in order to sell her crops for a good price so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province, Phat is 40 years old and a married mother of four children, two of whom are relying on her. She grows rice as the main source of her income and she has been involved in this business for 22 years. Raising pigs for sale is her additional source of income to complement her family’s needs. She earns less income than before because her farm produced low outputs while the price of organic fertilizer and fuel keeps rising in the market.

This will be her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she will use her loan to buy fuel for a pumping machine and organic fertilizer to support the farmland. She hopes she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fuel for a pumping machine and organic fertilizer to support the farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Yoeut's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Siem Reap province, Yoeut is a mother of two dependent children who are both in school. To make a living, she grows rice as her main source of income. Besides this, she earns additional income by raising ducks and chickens. She can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting her daily expenses. Low crops being destroyed by insects is the main challenge for her business.

She has never been with VisionFund before. She is leading her group to ask for a Kiva loan. Yoeut will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve her living standards and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Tang Rat

texts.en: Tang Rat is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She is a married mother of two kids, one of whom is in school. The other child is too young for school. To support her family’s living, for 17 years she has worked as a paid worker who extracts latex from rubber trees. Her daily income earns her around 23,000 KHR per day. Tang Rat has never been with VisionFund before. This is the first time she has applied for a Kiva loan of 2,500,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to fulfill her dream of having a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lin's Group

texts.en:
A woman, 45, is a married mother of four dependent children living in Battambang province. Nowadays, Lin farms rice and works for a labor fee to support her living conditions - she has done this for ten years.

Low crop yield is the main challenge for her business. Her daily business income earns her about 58,000 KHR per day.

She has never been with VisionFund before, and this is Lin's first cycle with VisionFund. She and her fellow group member are each going to take out a loan of 1,000,000 KHR with VisionFund.

As leader of their group of two, Lin will use her entire loan amount to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide, and to pay for plowing fees. Besides this spending, she will use some of the loan to buy pigs to raise for additional income.

She hopes to earn more income to expand her current business so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide, and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Yoxaja 4.2 Group

texts.es:
Francisca  (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto) es una mujer de 31 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia, ella se ha sacrificado mucho para brindarle a su familia lo necesario, Francisca cuenta que gracias al crédito al que tuvo la oportunidad de acceder logro darle a su cultivo de banano su mantenimiento que tanto le hacía falta, con esta producción a Dios gracias le fue muy bien porque pudo venderlo a un buen precio en el mercado regional, pero Francisca ahora tiene  la necesidad de  darle mantenimiento a cinco cuerdas de café, y una de sus dificultades es no contar con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra; a raíz de esta necesidad solicita otro préstamo para poder obtener una buena cosecha.
El gran sueño de Francisca es poder comprar otro terreno para seguir incrementado su cultivo.
texts.en:
Francisca (the first on the left in the photo) is a 31 year old married woman who has a beautiful family. She has sacrificed a lot to provide her family with what they need. Francisca says that thanks to the loan that she had the opportunity to receive, she managed to give her banana crops the maintenance that they needed. And thanks to God things went well for her as she was able to sell them at a very good price in the regional market. But now Francisca has to provide maintenance on her five cuerdas (a local land measurement) of coffee crops and one of her difficulties is not having enough money to be able to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. So because of this need she is requesting another loan in order to obtain a good harvest.

Francisca's big dream is to be able to buy another plot of land to continue to expand her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora and her husband, Pierin, both in their early 40s and parents of five children. They are photographed with their three younger adorable children. They are seeking your financial help for roofing for their little house. "It rains inside and is very cold, and soon the winter is approaching in our region. Thus, taking care of the roof is our priority at the moment," said Leonora to the branch assistant.

The family's focus for the past seven years has been on livestock. However, their earnings from that business has never been enough. They are indeed poor. As a result, local churches have helped them financially, and they also receive some assistance from the local government.

All in all, they have a dairy cow and a sow, from which they try to sell dairy and piglets. On the 3.5 dynym (units) of agricultural land that they own, they plant corn for the animals and seasonal vegetables for their own use.

loans.use: to put roofing on the family house, where five young children live.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina raises a small number of pigs to expand their daily needs. She really earned more than she had expected and was able to repay her loan. Now she decided to borrow a loan to buy feeds for her pigs. Together with her husband, they are helping each other to raise a few piglets until they reach their marketable age. She sells them to the market and also delivers them to her loyal customers.

Divina's plan for the future is to save more money to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Roda

texts.pt:
A Sra. Roda de 53 anos de idade, viúva, mãe de três filhos que estão na sua responsabilidade. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta mais cinco netos que frequentam o ensino escolar.
No empréstimo anterior aplicou na sua mercearia e com este empréstimo também vai aplicar na mercearia na compra de açúcar, farinha de milho, cerveja, refresco, arroz e outros produtos da primeira necessidade para revender.
O sonho desta senhora é desenvolver a sua actividade de forma rentável. O desafio é devolver o empréstimo dentro de prazo acordado.
texts.en:
Roda is 53 years old. She is a widow with three children to take care of. Besides her children, she supports five of her grandchildren who attend school.
She used her previous loan on her grocery store and she wants to do the same this time. She will buy sugar, flour, beer, sodas, rice and other basic products to sell.
Her dream is to turn her business into a profitable enterprise. Her challenge is to repay this loan on the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, beer, sodas, rice and other basic products to sell

loans.name: Elizaphan

texts.en: Elizaphan is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a dairy farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate animal feeds. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy animal feeds. His business goal is to buy more land and improve the dairy cow breed within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have the best breed of cows.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Sreav's Group

texts.en:
Sreav, aged 41 years, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of three children, two of whom are depending on her. She has been growing rice as the main source of income for 23 years and she is growing cassava to supplement her income. Her rice-farming business produced lower-than-expected outputs and the price of fuel and organic fertilizer keep rising in the market, which affects the family’s income.

This will be Sreav’s first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a three-member group, she will use her loan to buy fuel for a pumping machine and organic fertilizer to grow her crop well. She hopes to earn more income so as to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fuel for a pumping machine and organic fertilizer to grow her crop well.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 48-year-old mother of four children who lives in Kampong Cham province. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice growing and pig raising. Moreover, she can supplement her income via catching fish. She has been involved in her businesses for thirty years. She can earn about 38,000 KHR per day. Her crops have been destroyed by insect pests; this is the main challenge for her business.

Mao has been with VisionFund for one cycle already. She fully repaid the past loan. Now she is going to take out a new loan. Mao, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes to gain more income for supporting her business.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sumbath's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Sumbath, 47, is a married mother of eight children, seven of whom are dependent on her. Four of her children are in school and need her support. For 29 years, Sambath has grown rice as the main source of her family’s income. Her children also work in a factory to earn salaries to supplement the family's income.

A lack of working capital is the major challenge to Sambath's rice growing business. As a result, Sumbath has decided to form a group, comprising two members, to apply for a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is her second loan. Her previous loan was completely paid back and helped her have enough consumption to support her family.

As the group leader, she will use her loan to pay the plowing fee and buy organic fertilizer to increase her crop yield. She hopes to earn more income to buy household supplies and support her children’s studies until they graduate.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee and buy organic fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of two kids who lives in the Siem Reap district of Siem Reap province, Sokun is 50 years old. These days, she sells food to support her family. To earn additional income, she is also a land-broker. She has been involved in her current business for three years. She can earn income of about 50,000 KHR per day. After her family’s daily expenses, she is able to save around 25,000 KHR each day.

This is Sokun’s third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she paid back previous loans successfully. She improved her lifestyle through those past loans. In a group of five, she is the group leader. She will manage her entire loan portion to buy meat and pork to cook for sale and satisfy her customers. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy meat and pork to cook for sale and satisfy her customers.

location.town: Siem Reap district, Siem Reap province

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: La señora Herminia es una persona joven de 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada que llego a estudiar al grado de profesional pero cosas de la vida aun no puede ejercer su profesión cuenta tiene un hijo pequeño quien depende  económicamente de la señora, actualmente vive en la casa de su suegra, es de construcción de material de adobe con techo de teja y calamina, la casa no tiene puerta principal, se encuentra en la comunidad de Paracaya, provincia Punata, su actividad económica es la agrícola en la cual produce papa mismo que también es usado para autoconsumo, es por tal motivo que la señora Herminia requiere un préstamo para la compra de abono (galllinaza), semilla para poder ampliar su producción de tal manera pueda mejorar sus ingreso y la calidad de vida a sus hijo
texts.en:
Señora Herminia is a young person, age 33 and married. She earned a professional degree, but because of things in life, she cannot yet practice her profession. She has a little son who is economically dependent upon her.

Currently, she lives in her mother-in-law's house, which is built of adobe with a roof of tile and corrugated iron. The house does not have a main door. It is in the community of Paracaya, in the Punata Province.

She makes a living by farming, in which she produces potatoes that are also used for her household consumption. This is why Señora Herminia needs a loan: for the purchase of fertilizer (chicken droppings) and seed, in order to be able to increase her production so that she may improve her income and her child's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer (chicken droppings) and seed in order to increase her production, so that she may increase her income and her child's quality of life.

loans.name: Sam Ang's Group

texts.en:
Aged 31, Sam Ang is a married mother who resides in Kandal province with four dependent children, three of whom are in school. The remaining child is not yet old enough to go to school. She has been growing rice as the main source of her family’s income for 11 years and it earns her about 38,300 KHR per day to support their living. An insufficient water supply in the farmland caused the crops to produce low outputs.

Now Sam Ang is leading a group of two members to apply for a loan. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will use her loan to pay for the plowing fee, purchase organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to increase her rice yields. She hopes to get more yields from her business so as to upgrade the standard of living for the family.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, purchase organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to increase her rice yields.

loans.name: Grupo S Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy pequeña del Estado del México, se conformó una asociación de préstamo llamado "Grupo S". Marco es uno de los integrantes, él tiene 44 años de edad y está casado con la señora Elvira con quien dio vida a tres hijos, dos de los cuáles se encuentran estudiando. Anteriormente, Marco trabajaba en la capital del país, pero para evitar estar tanto tiempo lejos de su familia, decidió abrir un taller de autos. Además, para perfeccionar sus servicios, estudió tres años. Los clientes de Marco llegan al taller desde comunidades lejanas, pero son clientes leales que quedan satisfechos con el servicio ya que él siempre se esfuerza ya que sabe que las ganancias son principalmente para beneficio de su familia.  

Con el nuevo préstamo comprará más herrmientas como llaves, autoclear, "Realmente los prestamos me han ayudado porque gracias a las ganacias obtenidas pudimos levantar un habitación pequeña para los escáners de los autos" comentó muy alegre. La única dificultad que enfrenta por el momento es la falta de un terreno para ampliar su taller mecánico y equiparlo  muy bien. Su meta personal además de aumentar sus ganancias es continuar entregándose a su familia.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el taller, don Marco Antonio es quien viste playera blanca*
texts.en:
In a very small community in the State of Mexico, a lending group called "Grupo S" was formed. Marco is one of the members. He is 44 years old and is married to Elvira with whom he has three children, two of whom are in school.

Marco previously worked in the country's capital, but in order to avoid being far from his family he decided to open an auto repair shop. In addition, to perfect his services he studied for three years. Marco's customers come to his shop from distant communities, but they are loyal customers who remain satisfied with his service. He always strives hard as he knows his earnings are principally for the benefit of his family.

With the new loan he will buy more tools like socket wrenches. "The loans have really helped me because thanks to the income I've obtained we've been able to put up a small room for the auto diagnostic scanners," Marco happily noted. The only difficulty he faces at the moment is the lack of land to expand his mechanic shop and equip it well. His personal goal, in addition to increasing his earnings, is to continue providing for his family.

*The photograph was taken in the shop. Marco is in the white shirt.*

loans.use: to buy tools such as socket wrenches.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kuthea, 30, lives in Battambang province. Rice farming has been the family's primary source of income for six years. Kuthea's husband works as a labourer for a fee to supplement the family's income.

The current business earns her about 70,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day, and she can manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day. The main challenge for her business is a lack of working capital.

Kunthea has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back her previous loan, which she used wisely to support her business. She will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to collect a good yield to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to adopt modern farming techniques such as a greenhouse to improve her productivity to earn more income.

loans.name: Sok Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Age 28, Sok Moeun, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two dependent children, one of whom is in school and the remaining child is not yet school-aged.

She has been growing rice as the main source of her family’s income for nine years. To supplement her income, she sometimes works for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 47,200 KHR a day and manages to save about 19,400 KHR for future needs. Recently, her crop was destroyed by pests; this is the main challenge facing her business.

This loan is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s field partner); she completely repaid her past loan. From the past loan she has managed to expand her business and earn more income to better support her family’s needs.

As the leader of a two-member group, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost her crop yield. She hopes she can earn more income to enhance the rice farming business and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sokleang's Group

texts.en:
Sokleang, 41, is a farmer living in Sambour district of Kratie province. She is a married mother of six children. To earn a living she has been growing cassava as the main source of her family’s income. Sometimes her husband works as a paid worker to earn extra income. She has been with these businesses for 10 years. The low price of cassava at the market has been the main challenge for her business.

This is Sokleang’s second loan cycle via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully paid back the previous loan. Now, she is leading her group to seek a new loan. Sokleang will use her loan portion to buy seeds and pesticides to support her rice farming. She hopes to earn more income to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides to support her rice farming.

loans.name: Silva

texts.pt:
O Sr. Silva tem 32 anos de idade, casado, pai de 04 filhos dos quais três frequentam o ensino primário e um vai a escolinha.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar cerveja, refrescos, vinhos, sumos, lâmpadas arroz, pão, e outros produtos básicos para revender. Ele sonha em ampliar o seu negócio e o seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Silva is 32 years old. He is married with 4 children. 3 of them go to grade school and the last goes to kindergarten.
He wants to use this loan to buy beer, sodas, wines, juice, strings of lights, bread and other products to sell. He dreams with expanding his business and his challenge is to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, wines, juice, strings of lights, bread and other products

loans.name: El Dar Group

texts.en:
Wafika is the featured borrower for El Dar Group. She joined her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and, at the same time, earn their livings.

Wafika is a 62-year-old widowed mother of 2 children. 17 years ago, she started working in the cleaning field to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. Due to the low social and financial situation of her husband, she lived with her family in a very poor and miserable house. As her husband got ill, she worked hard to pay for his medical treatments and take care of him, as well as her children's needs. Throughout the years, and because of the continuous hard work she suffered from back pain.

Today, Wafika is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house and make it a better, decent, and healthier place. She is the lady sitting in the middle of the group.

With respect to the other group members, Nouhad is the lady on the left, and Hamda is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house and make it a better, decent, and healthier place.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow so as to apply farm yard manure in her farming activity to improve productivity.

loans.name: Ma. Angelie

texts.en:
Ma. Angelie is a 28-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has a 4-year-old son. Her husband is a public employee, while she is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for a couple of months.

Ma Angelie and her husband are working hard to earn a living. Aside from raising hogs, Ma. Angelie is engaged in selling food (snacks) in their place. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. She also wants to buy flour, cooking oil, and sugar for her food (snacks) vending business.

She dreams to increase her earnings in the future to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, flour, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina is from Bohol, Philippines. She is a 32-year-old woman and has five children. Her oldest child is 12 years while her youngest child is 1 year old. To earn a living, Rina is raising pigs while her husband works hard as a glass installer. They have been dreaming of sending all of their children to school to get a degree so that in the near future they could have a better means of living. As for now, Rina needs capital to continue her business. With that, she is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy piglets and feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Tun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Battambang province’s Sangkae district, Tun is a 64-year-old married mother of four kids.

She has been growing rice and cassava to support her lifestyle for thirty years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day.

Low cassava prices due to drought has become the main challenge for her business.

Tun has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already and she fully repaid her previous loans, which have helped her to better support her business.

She is now leading a group of two to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use some of it to spend on household supplies. She hopes to earn more income so as to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en: Japheth is a married man. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows maize and beans. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy animal feeds. His business goal is to buy more land for farming within five years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Tieng's Group

texts.en: Aged 51, Tieng resides in a rural village of Pursat province and is a married mother of seven children. To support her living condition, she has grown rice for 33 years. The main challenges for her family’s business are the drop of rice’s price and unhealthy rice crops. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles already and she repaid past loans completely, which have helped her better support her family’s living conditions. She is now leading her group of two to ask for a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income to enlarge the rice farming so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
Thon is a married mother, 53, living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. She has three kids. Thon has been earning income via growing cassava to support the family’s living for 34 years. Meanwhile, her husband is working for a labor fee to supplement her income.

Her daily business income earns her around 25,000 KHR per day, and she is able to save up to 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting her business expenses. The crops being destroyed by insect pests is the main challenge for her cash crops.

Thon has been with VisionFund for two cycles already. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. Thon will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to gain high yields to get more income so that she can improve her living more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Te Agradesco Señor Group

texts.es:
Grupo [¨Te Agradesco Señor[¨, es un grupo responsable quienes están con ADIM por 27 ciclos, demostrando ser capaces de dirigir sus negocios y salir adelante para el beneficio de sus familias.
Quien coordina el grupo es Leoncita, de 29 años, casada y con dos hijos de edades 2 ½ y 8 años. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de pollo y ropa usada, este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su suegro. Ahora  crédito invertirá en la compra de carne de pollo, pan, pantalones, shores, faldas y camisas para su variada clientela. Con esto asegura incrementara sus ganancias al aumentar su inventario.  Las otras socias son María de Jesús de 64 años, dedicada a la venta de hoja y Ana María quien a sus 50 años vende cosechas para poder tener ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The¨"Te Agradesco Señor" group is a responsible group who have been with ADIM for 27 cycles. They have demonstrated themselves as capable of directing their businesses and getting ahead for the benefit of their families.

The coordinator of the group is Leoncita who is 29 years old, married with two children aged 2 ½ and 8 years old. For four years she has been selling chicken and second hand clothing. She started this business with the help of her father-in-law. She will invest this loan in buying chicken meat, bread, pants, shorts, skirts and shirts for her varied clientele. Increasing her inventory will assure her of increasing her profits.

The other members are María de Jesús who is 64 years old who sells leaves and Ana María who sells harvests to have economic income.

loans.use: to invest in chicken meat, bread, pants, shorts, skirts and shirts for her varied clientele.

loans.name: Felizarda

texts.pt:
Senhora Felizarda tem 47 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, é mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 3 são independentes e 2 na sua responsabilidade frequentando o ensino secundário, é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família a qual sustenta com ajuda do esposo.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de capulanas, lenços, e outras roupas para revender aos seus vizinhos.
No futuro pretende construir uma mercearia e iniciar um negócio de venda de produtos básicos alimentícios de modo a aumentar a renda familiar visto que o rendimento actual não satisfaz as despesas da família.
O seu desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Felizarda is 47 years old. She is married with 5 children, 3 of them independent and 2 under her care who still go to high school. She is a businesswoman and she lives in a house that she owns with her family that she supports with the help of her husband.
She will use this loan to buy capulanas, headscarves and other garments to sell to her neighbors.
In the future, she would like to build a grocery store and begin a business selling basic products to increase her household income as her current situation doesn't allow her to cover her family expenses.
It is her goal to settle this loan on time, so she can have the chance to get more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy capulanas, headscarves and other garments to sell to her neighbors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut milk, yeast, glutinous and milled rice and utensils

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
La señora Apolonia vive y trabaja en Colomi, de estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos dependientes que estudian en el nivel primario. Se dedica a la actividad de agricultura conjuntamente con la familia, produciendo papa como el principal producto agrícola de mayor demanda en el mercado y en el lugar. Para esta actividad ocasionalmente contrata personal eventual para la siembra, labores culturales (aporque, deshierbe, fumigado) y época de cosecha. Los ingresos económicos obtiene a través de la producción y venta de papa que es también parte del sustento para su alimentación (autoconsumo). La señora Apolonia requiere el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) 2 camiones y semilla de papa (10 cargas). 
Por último, la señora Apolonia se sintió contenta al tener la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamos que se adecúa a sus necesidades y requerimientos; porque con la compra de insumos agrícolas, incrementará su producción y podrá mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Apolonia lives and works in Colomi. She is married and has 2 dependent children who are studying at the primary level. She works in agriculture with her family, growing potatoes as the main agricultural product with the highest demand at market and in the area. For this work, she occasionally hires temporary help for planting, cultivation (hilling, weeding, pest control), and harvest season. 

She gets her income from potato production and sales, and the potatoes are also food for her own consumption. Apolonia needs the loan to buy 2 truckloads of organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and 10 loads of potato seed. 

Apolonia was happy to have the opportunity to access a loan that meets her needs and requirements, because when she buys these agricultural supplies, production will increase and she will be able to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (hen droppings) to increase production and improve her income for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Nich's Group

texts.en: Originally from Snoul district of Kratie province, Nich is 42 years old and a married mother of three dependent children, only one of whom is in school. To make a living, she has been growing cassava as the main source of income for 24 years. She sometimes works as a paid worker to supplement the family’s income. The main challenge for her business is a low price of cassava. This is Nich's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is forming a group of five people to seek a new loan. Nich, who is the leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to keep her kid in school and to improve her living standard so that it is much better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Splendor School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is the head teacher of Splendor Education Services, a mixed school in the urban area of Kisasi in Kampala with 115 students. Splendor School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water-filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water-treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Splendor School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has been engaged in fish selling for 23 years. She is a 51-year-old woman and has three children. The oldest child is 19 years old while the youngest child is 14 years old. Her husband is a carpenter and works hard for their family. Rosita is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and a weighing scale used in selling. In the future, she dreams of being successful in her life. With that, she aims to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita has been running her business selling goods inside the school for five years and is really happy to know that it is earning very well. She was able to pay her previous loan and now she took a new loan to buy more goods to sell and so that she can be able to provide for the needs of her customers, especially the children.

Nenita's plan for her future is to save more money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, a married mother, is 37 years old and she has four dependent children, two of whom are in school, while the other one is too young to attend school.

Sokha lives in Kampong Cham province, where she has been growing rice for years as her main source of income. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement her income. The rice crop is producing lower-than-expected outputs, while the cost of organic fertilizer and fuel keeps increasing.

Since she does not have enough working capital, Sokha is now leading a group of four members to apply for a loan; this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy fuel for a pumping machine, rice seeds, and organic fertilizer for a fruitful crop. She hopes to gain more yields and earn more income to improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: to buy fuel for a pumping machine, rice seeds and organic fertilizer for a fruitful crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive y trabaja en Colomi, de estado civil casada, tiene 1 hijo dependiente de ella que estudia en el nivel primario. Se dedica a la actividad de agricultura conjuntamente con toda su familia, produciendo papa como el principal producto agrícola de mayor demanda en el mercado. Los ingresos económicos los obtiene a través de la producción y venta de papa que es también el sustento para su alimentación diaria (autoconsumo). Para esta actividad, a veces contrata personal eventual para la siembra y cosecha. La señora Juana requiere el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) 2 camiones, semilla de papa (12 cargas) y productos agroquímicos. 
Por último, la señora Juana se sintió contenta al tener la oportunidad de acceder a un préstamo que se adecúa a sus necesidades y requerimientos, porque con la compra de insumos agrícolas incrementará su producción y podrá mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana lives and works in Colomi. She is in a common law marriage with one dependent child in first grade. She works in agriculture with all her family. They grow potatoes as their principal agricultural product with the highest market demand. She obtains her economic income from the cultivation and sale of potatoes, which are also the basis for her daily diet (self-consumption). In her work she at times contracts with temporary help for sowing and harvesting.

Juana needs a loan to buy 2 truck loads of organic fertilizer (poultry manure), potato seed (12 loads) and agro-chemical products.

In closing, Juana is happy to have the opportunity to access a loan that is tailored to her needs and requirements, because with the purchase of supplies she will increase her production and can improve her income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to improve and increase her production as well as her income.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, sugar, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Sabina's business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy cereals, sugar, flour, and other items.

Sabina's business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy cereals, sugar, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Von, 41, is a mother of five children living in the Sambour district of Kratie province. Two of her children are in school. To support her living conditions, she has been growing rice and soybeans for 23 years. Beside this, she also works for others for a fee. She is able to earn income of around 57,000 KHR per day.This is Von’s first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is a resident of Kirinyabiggo, Kawanda -Wakiso District and a married man with five children. He is a third-time borrower, and his repayment record is amazing. He earns his living by rearing chickens. Mr. Muhammad buys 5-day-old chicks and rears them up to 7 weeks. Then he sells them to chicken meat roasters at a better profit. He appreciates the financial boost from Kiva lenders, which has enabled him to consistently sustain the business.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and to buy more birds.

loans.name: Sreyhun

texts.en:
Sreyhun is a 35-year-old mother of three children living in Kratie province. Growing soybeans and rice are the main sources of her family’s income. Sometimes her husband works for a labor fee to earn supplemental income. She has been involved in her business for 17 years. Her daily income earns her about 28,000 KHR per day and she is able to save around 10,000 KRH each day.

Low crop yield is the main challenge for her business. She has never been with VisionFund before and she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Josephat, who is in his late 40s, is married with one child who is still at school. He has been running two projects, driving a taxi and maintaining a retail shop for two years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make small monthly profit.

This will be Josephat's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling at a retail shop and he serviced his taxi. He has paid back all of his loans successfully. He is happy with the loan. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to service his taxi and to increase his shop inventory. He dreams of building his own house.

Josephat will share this loan with his loan group New Africa which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to service his taxi and to increase his shop inventory.

loans.name: Abdul Karim

texts.en:
Abdul Karim is an 18-year-old single young man who opened a motorcycle repair shop two years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and ambitious man who has a good reputation among his region for his professional skills in this domain.

Abdul Karim is trying hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy motorcycles in order to sell them. He hopes to keep on expanding his business to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorcycles in order to sell them

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is from Getashen village in the Armavir region, where she lives with her husband and six-year-old son. Nelli is a nurse by profession and from time to time when her co-villagers need some medical treatment, Nelli is there for support. Together with her husband, Nelli is also involved in farming activities. They keep a cow and hens and cultivate different vegetables and fruits (tomato, sunflower, peach, apricot and cherry). The couple sells the gathered harvest in local markets and gets income for covering their daily costs. Nelli applied for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation.

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, Nelli was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Nelli and her husband will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng, 59, is a farmer living in a rural village of Battambang province. She is a widowed mother of four kids. Growing rice has been her primary source of income for six years. Sometimes she works for others for a fee to get additional income. Her business earns her about 34,000 KHR per day and she can save around 16,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family’s expenses.

Due to lacking of working capital to support her business, she decided to take a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR, which is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan has enabled her to support her family’s needs. She will use this loan to buy seed and fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to increase the crop yields. She hopes that the crops gain her more output than before so that she can earn more income to update her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to increase the crop yields.

loans.name: Yasmin Elena

texts.es: Yasmin de 39 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes desea costearles sus estudios profesionales y gracias a su trabajo ha logrado ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida; ella encontró en el comercio la oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales para su familia, actividad que inició hace 19 años, cuando decidió invertir en una limitada cantidad de artículos, los cuales ofreció a sus amigas, con gran éxito que logró tener encargos adicionales, así poco a poco, su clientela fue ampliándose.  Tiempo después invirtió en planes de celulares y colocó una venta minutos en su vivienda y su hijo la atiende. Yasmin está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar prendas de vestir, calzado y recargas a celular.  Con esta inversión Yasmin podrá incrementar sus utilidades al ofertar mayor surtido de productos que estimulará las ventas. A futuro desea continuar en su negocio más consolidada y con más clientela.
texts.en:
Yasmin, age 39, is the mother of two minor children. She wants to fund their professional education, and thanks to her work, she has been able to offer them a better quality of life.

In business, she found the opportunity to generate additional income for her family. She started her work nineteen years ago, when she decided to invest in a limited quantity of items that she offered to her girlfriends with great success, so much so, that she was able to have additional orders, and thus her customers gradually increased. Sometime afterward she invested in cell-phone plans, and put a small shop for selling minutes in her house, which her son takes care of.

Yasmin is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to purchase clothing, footwear, and cell phone recharges. With this investment, Yasmin will be able to increase her profits by offering a larger stock of products that will stimulate sales. In the future she wants to continue establishing herself in her business, with more customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, and cell phone recharges.

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kratie province, Phanny is a 21-year-old young mother of two dependent kids. To support the family’s living, she has grown soybeans and rice for three years. She can earn income of around 28,000 KHR per day. The main challenge for her business is unhealthy crops resulting from lacking of working capital.
