This is Phanny’s first loan cycle with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is seeking a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes to sell it at a good price in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to support her farmland.

loans.name: Gleen

texts.en:
Gleen has been running her business for five years. It is good to hear that she was earning. She was able to sustain the needs of her child in sending her to school. She was also able to pay her previous loan. Now she has decided to get a new loan to buy fertilizer for her bananas. This will help her produce more bananas for the market, which will generate more income.

Glee's plan for the future is to save money and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her bananas.

loans.name: Saweria

texts.en: Saweria is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as God fearing. She operates a farm where she keeps cows. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her family's challenge to be inadequate water supply. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Senhor Fernando tem 41 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, é pai de 3 filhos frequentando o ensino primário e secundário, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de fardos de roupas usadas para revender no mercado local de modo a garantir o sustento da família.
No futuro pretende construir uma mercearia e iniciar mais outro negócio de modo aumentar o rendimento visto que as despesas estão cada vês mais aumentando.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Fernando is 41 years old. He is married with 3 children who attend grade school and high school. He is a businessman and he lives in a house that he owns with his family.
He will use this loan to buy used clothes in bulk to resell at the local market to secure the support of his family.
In the future, he wants to build a grocery store to start a new business and have a better income as his expenses have increased over time.
His biggest goal is to repay this loan on time and be sure to have access to future loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy used clothes in bulk to resell at the local market

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 27-year-old Syrian young woman who has been living in the Lebanese mountains of Chouf since she was 15 after her parents moved from Syria to Lebanon looking for better living conditions.
Huda is now married and lives with her husband in a rented house. She works from home, in knitting, while her husband is a full-time construction worker who specifically works in concrete.

Huda is asking for a 1,851,680 Lebanese Pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. Having been knitting for several years, she has a very loyal network of clients in the area. She plans on using the loan to buy wool and some equipment to improve the quality of her products. That way, she will increase the revenue from her business as well as her household's income.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Kimsrong

texts.en: Kimsrong, 62, is a farmer who lives in Kratie province. She is a married mother of five kids. The main source of her income is from growing corn and sesame for 44 years. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn additional income. She can earn income of about 32,000 KHR per day. This is Kimsrong’s third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She successfully repaid all her past loans, which has improved her family’s living conditions. She will get a new loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, soft drinks, juice and other items to start her business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Senhor Jorge tem 52 anos de idade, é divorciado, pai de 2 filhos dos quais um independente e o outro sob sua responsabilidade frequentando o ensino superior, é negociando explorando ultimamente um bar próprio, vive em casa própria não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de refresco, sumos, bebidas carnes, batata, cebola e outros produtos para revender no seu bar.
No futuro pretende abrir uma mercearia de modo a diversificar os negócios, colocando um pouco de todos os produtos junto aos compradores.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos na instituição e consequentemente acelerar os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 52 years old. He is divorced and he has two children. One of them is independent and he still supports the second one who goes to high school. He lives in a house that he owns and he doesn't support anybody else. 
He has been trying to open his own bar so he will use this loan to buy soft drinks, juice, meat, potatoes, onions and other products to sell at his bar.
In the future, he would like to open a grocery store to diversify his business, and have a variety of products to offer to his customers.
His biggest goal is to repay this loan on time and make sure he has access to future loans from this organization which will help him finish his projects faster.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juice, meat, potatoes, onions and other products to sell at his bar.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana de 32 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de su familia la cual está conformada por su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 14, 8 y 3 años de edad. Roxana se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de semilla de marañón preparada, maní dulce y maní salado, los cuales los comercializa de forma ambulante en diferentes puntos de su municipio dentro de los transportes colectivos, es así como ella se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida logra solventar la mayoría de gastos de su hogar. Roxana desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para poder construir una pila para almacenaje de agua para el uso y consumo diario de su hogar y al mismo tiempo piensa construir un baño en su residencia. Por lo anterior con el monto solicitado ella comprara los materiales necesarios como son: cemento, ladrillo, arena, grava y además pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Roxana, who is 32 years old, lives in her own house with her family, which is formed by her life companion and their three children, ages 14, 8, and 3. For 15 years, Roxana has worked selling prepared cashew nuts, sweet peanuts, and salted peanuts, which she sells as an itinerant vendor at different points in her township within the public transportation services. This is how she earns a living and, along with her life companion, manages to pay the majority of the household expenses. 

Roxana wants to improve their living conditions, for which she has made the decision to apply to FUSAI for this loan to be able to construct a washing and water storage area for storing water for the use and daily consumption of her household, and at the same time she is thinking of building a bathroom in their residence. For the above, with the amount she has applied for, she will buy the necessary materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and gravel and also pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and gravel and also to pay for labor to construct a bathroom and a washing and water storage area to store water for her house

loans.name: Ana Emperatriz

texts.es: Ana de 69 años es una empresaria independiente que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en la comercialización de mercancías varias entre ellas artículos para el hogar, prendas de vestir, calzado y productos para el aseo personal.  Ella cuenta con una larga trayectoria en esta labor, la cual inicio el año 1982, al considerar que podría generar ingresos para su familia sin dejar de cumplir con sus compromisos en el hogar.  Hoy en día, tiene una excelente cobertura en diferentes barrios del municipio de Barranquilla y la ayudan a responder oportunamente a la demanda dos vendedoras que contrató. Ana está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir nuevos diseños de prendas de vestir, calzado y artículos para el hogar como tendidos de cama y toallas, también productos como shampoo, colonias y cremas corporales. Con esta inversión abastecerá a sus clientes y así tendrá mayores oportunidades en ventas.  Su meta a futuro es continuar creciendo y personalmente obtener los ingresos necesarios para la construcción del segundo piso de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana, age 69, is an independent businesswoman with ample experience selling various merchandise, including household items, clothing, footwear, and personal hygiene products. She has a long history in this work, which she started in the year 1982, upon considering that she could generate income for her family without neglecting her household duties.

Nowadays, she has excellent coverage in different neighborhoods in the municipality of Barranquilla, and she has hired two salesladies to help her meet the demand in a timely manner.

Ana is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to stock new designs of clothing and footwear, household articles such as bed sheets and towels, and also products such as shampoo, cologne, and body cream.

With this investment, she will satisfy her customers, and thus have greater sales opportunities. Her goal for the future is to continue growing, and personally obtain the income needed for the construction of a second floor for her home.

loans.use: to stock new clothing designs and footwear; household articles, such as bed sheets and towels; and products such as shampoo, cologne, and body cream.

loans.name: Anisio

texts.pt:
Senhor Onísio tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é pai de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frequentando o ensino primário e outros sem idade escolar, é carpinteiro e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de madeira com finalidade de fabrico de mobiliário, portas e aros de janelas para a venda.
No futuro pretende transformar a sua carpintaria numa grande indústria de modo a fornecer grande quantidade de  mobília.
O seu grande desafio é de ultrapassar as dificuldades financeiras, e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos e consequentemente realizar mais rápido os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Onísio is 34 years old. He is married with 4 children. 2 of them attend grade school and 2 are too small to go. He is a carpenter and he lives with his family in a house that he owns.
He will use this loan to buy wood to build furniture, doors and window frames to sell.
In the future, he would like to turn his woodworking shop into a big factory to be able to build furniture in large quantities.
It is his biggest challenge to overcome his financial difficulties, but his goal is to repay this loan on time and make sure he has access to future loans to finish his projects faster.

loans.use: to buy wood to build furniture, doors and window frames to sell.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.pt:
A  senhora Carolina  de 61 anos de idade, é casada, mãe de  04 filhos  destes  3 já maiores de idade  1 a frequentar o ensino primário sustenta sua mãe que vive com ela na casa própria.
Diz  que com o valor pretende comprar  cimento, varões,  e fazer blocos para melhorar as condições de sua banca actualmente e feito de material precário e quando chove passa mal.
O seu maior sonho é ampliar a sua casa e crescer no negócio  e que com os empréstimos anteriores conseguiu melhorar as condições de sua casa.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de fundos e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Carolina is 61 years old. She is married with 4 children. 3 of them are of age and the last is attending grade school. She also supports her mother who lives with her in a house that she owns.
Her goal is to use this loan to buy cement and beams to make bricks to make home improvements. Her home is currently made out of precarious materials and it has problems when it rains.
Her dream is to expand her home and grow her business. She was also able to make home improvements with her previous loans.
Her biggest challenge is her lack of funds, so her goal is to ask for more loans to fulfill her plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, beams to make bricks

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio, el cual es la venta de abarrotaría en general, esto lo realiza desde su casa de habitación hace mas de 9 años, su negocio se ubica en la calle principal de su comunidad, donde le tránsito de personas a diario es alto, también abastece de producto a toda su comunidad y principalmente a las personas que esperan el bus.
Doña Ana solicita el préstamo para la compra de producto como ser: azúcar, refrescos, manteca, jabón, arroz, pastas, café, pan, huevos, queso, etc. espera que con esta inversión pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y esto le permita obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Ana sueña con tener un local bien surtido con todo lo necesario para la buena atención de sus clientes, el préstamo se solicita de manera grupal y los demás integrantes son:
Doña Elvira que se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y tortillas hace más de 10 años.
Doña Ramona vende nacatamales y platos de comida en su casa de habitación hace más de 12 años.
Doña Blanca vende golosinas afuera de la escuela de su comunidad.
Doña Bertilia se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir hace mas 15 años.

 Danli, Honduras - Julio  del 2015
texts.en:
Ana is a very hardworking woman who is devoted to her business, which is selling groceries. She has done this job from her home for more than 9 years. Her business is located on a main street in her community which has a high stream of people every day. She supplies products to her entire community, mostly to people who wait for the bus.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy products such as sugar, soft drinks, butter, soap, rice, pastries, coffee, bread, eggs, cheese, etc. She hopes that with this investment she can satisfy her customers' demand. This will allow her to generate more income in order to get her and her family ahead. Ana dreams of having a well-stocked shop with everything that her customers need.

This is a group loan and the other members are:

Elvira, who has been selling nacatamles and tortillas for more than 10 years.

Ramona, who has been selling nacatamales and food dishes in her home for more than 12 years.

Blanca, who sells snacks outside the school in their community.

Bertilia, who has been making clothing for more than 15 years.


Danli, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, butter, soap, rice, pastries, coffee, bread, eggs, cheese, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Watuku Farmers Field & Life School Group

texts.en:
The member raising her hand in this photo is Peris, 62 years of age, married, and a mother of five children. She is a member of Watuku Farmer’s Field and Life School which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in the year 2012 and has successfully undergone enterprise development and financial management training by HiH-EA.

Her enterprise is dairy farming and she is borrowing from Kiva to buy feeds for her dairy cow and also repair the cowshed. Peris anticipates more profit which will enable her to cater for her family with better clothing and food.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for better production that will enable her to get more income for food and school fees for her children.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be a go getter.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soda, flour, bread, cooking fat, and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, salt, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP micro-finance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Grupo A. M. Group

texts.es:
Grupo A. M. es una asociación nueva y muy pequeña, es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo a VFMéxico, por lo que se sienten un poco nerviosos ya que tampoco habían tenido crédito en otra institución. Al mismo tiempo se sienten emocionados porque para ellos el dinero también representa una oportunidad para hacer crecer sus negocios.

Los integrantes viven en una comunidad pequeña de zona mazahua que se caracteriza porque gran parte de la población se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías como gorros, bufandas, guantes, entre otros. 

Zacarías es muy amable y lo caracteriza su buen humor, tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero. Desde hace un año inició un pequeño taller de costura ya que es la actividad familiar. El taller se ubica en su casa donde tiene instaladas las máquinas de coser "Aunque tengo muy poco tiempo en este negocio me he hecho de clientes muy buenos. Este crédito me ayudará a comprar materia prima como tela, cierres, hilos y agujas". Zacarías necesita aprovechar la época del nuevo ciclo escolar y confeccionará los uniformes para los niños, afortunadamente ya tiene varios pedidos.

Este joven emprendedor explica que aprendió la actividad con tan sólo ver, recuerda que hace apenas dos años ni siquiera la contemplaba para dedicarse a ella. Sin embargo, las personas de la comunidad lo animaban a aprender el negocio, legado de su familia.

El sueño de Zacarías es hacer crecer su taller de costura para también dar empleo a otras personas de su comunidad.
Los integrantes del grupo son Rodolfo quien tiene un taller de costura; Eva Ángeles, quien vende accesorios para autos y Blanca Estela, quien cría pavos y pollos.
texts.en:
The A.M. Group is a new small association. This is the first time that they request a loan from VFMexico, which makes them a bit nervous, as they have not received loans from anywhere else. They also feel excited, since the borrowed money represents an opportunity to help their businesses grow.

The members of the association live in a small community in the Mazahua region, where the majority of the population works making handcrafts such as hats, scarfs and gloves, among others. 

Zacarias is a very nice man who is known for his good humor. He is 24 years old and single. A year ago, he started a small sewing workshop, which is his family's traditional occupation. The workshop is located in his house, where he installed the sewing machines. "Even though I don't have a lot of time in the business, I already have very good customers. This loan will help me buy materials such as fabric, zippers, thread and needles." Zacarias needs to take advantage of the new school cycle to make uniforms for the children -- luckily he already has some orders.

This young entrepreneur explains that he learned this activity just by watching others. He comments that even two years ago he was not even contemplating going into this field. However, people in the community encouraged him to learn this occupation, which is his family's tradition.

Zacarias' dream is to grow his sewing workshop to also provide employment to others in the community. 

The association's members are: Rodolfo, who has a sewing workshop; Eva Angeles, who sells car accessories; and Blanca Estela, who grows turkeys and chickens.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, zippers, thread and needles.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia, 29 years old, is married and supports three children. She is a hardworking small-scale farmer earning KES 15,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase modern banana suckers so as to have improved quality banana production.

She plans to use the gained profits to stabilize her banana farming activity and educate her children. She hopes to buy a dairy cow to supplement her farming activity and eventually improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase modern banana suckers for improved quality banana production.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open a hairdressing training school within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big salon.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is 35 years old and lives in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district. Farming rice is the main source of her income. Beside this, she also works as a garment worker and sometimes she raises chickens to earn extra income. She has been involved in these businesses for 17 years.

Low crops being destroyed by insect pests is the main challenge for her business. Sophy has never been with VisionFund before and this is the first time for her to apply for a Kiva loan. She will spend her loan to buy more chickens to raise. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Chom's Group

texts.en:
Chom is 56 years old living in Battambang province and she has four children. The main sources of her family’s income is from growing cassava and rice farming which she has done for ten years. She can earn additional income via wedding embellishments. Lack of funds to support her farmland is the main challenge for her.
This is the first loan cycle for Chom with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. As the group leader of five women, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to grow her crop well. She hopes to gain high yields so that she can earn more income to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to grow her crop well.

loans.name: Theavy's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural village of Kandal province, Theavy is 31 years old. She has worked at a garment factory to support her living condition for 11 years. She can earn an income of about 39,000 KHR per day. After her expenses, she is able to save around 15,000 KHR each day.

Lack of working capital is the main challenge for her business. She successfully repaid all past loans and it has supported her family to have enough household supplies. Theavy has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for five cycles and she completely paid back the loans.

Now, she is leading her group of two to seek for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for supporting her farmland to produce good yields. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more yields so as to update her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for supporting her farmland to produce good yields.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

Charity will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: Jai Vadjai Mata Mbg-A Group

texts.en:
Minabai, 41, is a dedicated and hard-working micro-entrepreneur. Her area of work is sewing, offering third-party services. She is the one standing to the middle in the photograph and hails from a small village of Maharashtra, India.

She has a small family comprised of her two daughters and a son. Her husband works as a carpenter in the same village and the income of her and her husband is used meet the daily expenses of her family.

Minabai does not have a toilet facility at her home. She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan of 45,000 INR. Minabai will use her portion of the loan amount to build a new toilet and promote cleanliness and hygiene in her home. The loan will allow her to lead a healthy and happy life with her family.

loans.use: to build a new toilet

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 37 years old, married and supports three children. She is a hard working small scale farmer earning 10,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase modern banana suckers so as to have an improved quality banana production.

She plans to use the gained profits to have a stabilized banana plantation and educate her children. Lilian hopes with a banana plantation she will be able to supply quality bananas for financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase modern  banana suckers so as to have an improved quality banana production.

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda has been engaged in vegetable production and was able to repay her previous loan.

Now she has been operating her sawmill. It is the only thing that they had in order for them to earn and to be able to provide for their daily needs.

With the help of her husband who will be the one to help her in operating this machine, she decided to take a loan for the machine repair and maintenance of her sawmill so that they can operate again with their services.

Maylinda’s plan for her future is to save money for sustaining their daily needs and for the education of her children.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance of her sawmill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy machinery and raw materials to produce sportswear and more formal clothing to generate better sources of income for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood and beams to repair the ceiling of the hallway of his home.

loans.name: Bugambilia Group

texts.es:
La venta de artículos para limpieza es una de las actividades que más se realiza en una comunidad del Estado de México. Los vendedores salen de su plácida localidad mazahua hacia otros Estados de la República para obtener mejores ingresos. 
   El grupo Bugambilia está formado por seis mujeres entusiastas y alegres que se dedican a vender distintos productos: Feliza, Florina y Alicia invertirán fantasía, Araceli y María de Lourdes invertirán en vasos de licuadora. 
 Laura es muy joven, a pesar de su corta edad tiene grandes aspiraciones en la vida, es muy amable y platicadora, tiene 21 años de edad y está casada con Gustavo; juntos han formado una familia con dos niños los cuales aun no asisten a la escuela.
Desde hace cinco años, Laura y su esposo iniciaron su negocio de comercialización de vasos de licuadora. Los padres de ambos son comerciantes por lo que ellos también optaron por seguir sus pasos. “Desde muy temprano nosotros viajamos a las plazas, mercados y tiangis para iniciar el día, algunas veces estamos muy cerca de nuestra casa y otras tenemos que viajar más lejos para obtener mejores ingresos”. El nuevo préstamo le permitirá comprar más vasos y continuar con su actividad.
Laura platica que no tiene un lugar estable donde vender, aún camina entre las calles para ofrecer su mercancía pero le agrada este modo de trabajar ya que piensa que llega hasta donde están sus clientes. Su gran dificultad es el clima ya que cuando llueve, es casi imposible seguir vendiendo y obtener las ganancias del día. La competencia también es otro factor en contra ya que muchos comerciantes venden el mismo tipo de artículos, sin embargo Laura siempre trata de dar un buen servicio y los mejores precios.

El sueño de Laura es hacer crecer su negocio para poder generar más ganancias construir una casa propia ya que por el momento viven con sus padres. 

*En la fotografía aparecen las integrantes en el reloj principal del municipio, Laura es quien carga a su bebé en brazos*
texts.en:
Selling cleaning items is one of the most common kinds of work in a community of the State of Mexico. Those who are selling household products go outside their peaceful Mazahua community to other states of the republic to increase their income.

The Bugambilia group was organized by six cheerful, enthusiastic women who earn a living selling various products. Feliza, Florina and Alicia will buy novelty items, while Laura, Araceli and Maria de Lourdes will invest in blender containers.

Laura is very young but despite her youth has great hopes in life. She is very friendly and talkative. Laura is 21 years old and married to Gustavo. Together they have formed a family with two children who are too young for school.

Five years ago, Laura and her husband began their business of selling blender containers. The parents of both work in sales, so that they decided to follow in their footsteps. "Early in the day we travel to the plazas, markets and bazaars to start the day; sometimes we are near our home and other times we must travel farther to gain more income." The new loan will allow them to buy more containers and continue their work.

Laura talks about their not having a fixed place for sales; they even walk the streets to offer their merchandise, but she does like this way of working since it lets them go where their customers are.

What's really difficult is the weather since when it rains, continuing to sell and get a profit for the day becomes almost impossible. The competition is another factor that affects them since many sales people have the same kind of things to sell. Nevertheless, Laura always tries to provide a good service and the best prices.

Laura's dream is to make their business grow so as to earn more profit and build a house of their own, since for now they live with their parents. "In the photograph, the members appear near the main clock of the town. Laura is the one carrying her baby in her arms."

loans.use: to buy blender containers for resale

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec,San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Elsa

texts.pt:
A Senhora  Elsa é divorciada, vive na casa propria com a sua filha mais nova e três netos não tendo outros dependentes. Ela é comerciante e agricultora, com o presente empréstimo vai adiquirir recargas para celulares, bolachas, rebuçados, carne, cerveja, refrescos para aumentar o volume do seu negócio, tem uma barraca na sua residência. 
Seu maior sonho é ter uma casa melhorada e oferecer melhores condiçoes de vida a familia, tem tido dificuldades financeiras para sustentar a familia
texts.en:
Elsa is divorced. She lives in a house that she owns with her younger daughter and three grandchildren and she doesn't have any other dependents. She is a businesswoman and a farmer. With this loan she will buy cell phone credit cards, crackers, candy, meat, beer, sodas to increase traffic to her business. She has a tent set up outside of her home.
Her biggest dream is to improve her home and offer better living conditions to her family, as she's had financial difficulties to support them.

loans.use: to buy cell phone credit cards, crackers, candy, meat, beer, sodas to increase traffic to her business

loans.name: Novedades Brayan Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Novedades Brayan” está conformado por tres mujeres que trabajan por brindar las mejores oportunidades a su familia. Ellas viven en una comunidad muy tranquila donde la mayor parte de la población se dedica al cultivo de maíz y muchos otros tienen un pequeño negocio.

 Maricela es una chica muy trabajadora tiene 23 años de edad y está casada con Miguel Ángel quien trabaja como comerciante, juntos han formado una familia con un niño el cual aún no asiste a la escuela.
Mari, como le dicen de cariño, platica que desde muy pequeña su mamá le enseño a trabajar y vender algunos artículos para el hogar. Ahora que ella decidió formar su propia familia quiso ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Desde hace dos años se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de mochilas y zapatos. cuando inició el negocio no tenía mucho capital para invertir así que poco a poco comenzó ahorrando "Ahora es más sencillo gracias al préstamo de VFMexico porque cada vez que lo recibo lo aprovecho al máximo". Actualmente, Mari también tiene un negocio estable en un local, aunque las rentas son un poco elevadas es más seguro vender de esta manera para evitar riesgos de ser asaltada. Con el nuevo apoyo económico Mari comprará mochilas y zapatos para aprovechar la época de regreso a clases de los niños. Su gran meta es seguir creciendo su negocio para generar mas ganancias y abrir otro local. 

 Las integrantes del grupo son Doña Emma y Raquel quienes invertirán en ropa.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardin del municipio, Mari viste un chaleco café*
texts.en:
The “Novedades Brayan” group is made up of three women who work to give their families the best opportunities. They live in a very calm community where the majority of the population grows corn, and many others have small businesses.

Maricela is a very hard-working girl. She is 23 years old and married to Miguel Ángel, who works as a salesman. Together they have started a family, with a little boy who doesn't attend school yet.

Mari, as they call her affectionately, says that since she was little, her mother taught her to work and sell some items from their home. Now that she decided to form her own family, she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.

For the past two years, she has worked buying and selling backpacks and shoes. When she started the business, she didn't have much capital to invest, so little by little, she started saving. "Now it is simpler, thanks to the loan from VFMexico; every time that I receive it, I make the most of it." Currently, Mari also has a stable business at a permanent location, although the rent is a little high. This is a safer way to make sales, to avoid the risk of being assaulted.

With the new loan, Mari will buy backpacks and shoes, to take advantage of the back-to-school season. Her big goal is to continue growing her business in order to make more income and open another location.

The other members of the group are Emma and Raquel, who will invest in clothing.

*The photo was taken in the city garden. Mari is wearing the brown vest.*

loans.use: to buy shoes and backpacks

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Lina Del Carmen

texts.es: Lina de 48 años es una microempresaria que desde la comodidad de su hogar ofrece para la venta comidas corrientes, actividad que inició hace cinco años con la ayuda de sus padres quienes les proporcionaron su vivienda para la preparación de las comidas.  Así mismo sus tres hijas han jugado un rol muy importante, pues han sido sus colaboradoras para cumplir con su sueño de prosperidad.   Ella elabora deliciosos platos típicos de la Región Caribe como pescado frito, arroz con coco, patacones, refrescos y sancochos, que sus comensales le solicitan por encargos y en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la comprar de víveres; arroz, aceite, verduras, carnes y abastecerse lo suficiente para ahorrar en transporte y tiempo. Su meta a futuro es organizarse mejor y atraer más clientes, para continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Lina is a 48 years old small business owner, who from the comfort of her home offers regular meals for sale. She started this business five years ago with the help of her parents who provided her with her home to prepare the meals. Also her three daughters have played a very important role, as they have been her partners in fulfilling their dream of prosperity.

Lina cooks delicious dishes typical of the Caribbean, such as fried fish, coconut rice, plantains, soft drinks and stews, which diners will request made-to-order. Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in the purchase of food, including: rice, oil, vegetables and meats, and to stock up enough to save on transportation and time. Her goal for the future is to organize herself better and attract more customers, in order to continue providing a good living for her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of food supplies, including: rice, oil, vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have a big shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and improve her living standard. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use.

loans.name: Jennette

texts.en:
Jennette is a young woman of 22 years. She works hard for her two children, aged three and six. She raises hogs and does manicures and pedicures for her clients. She also operates a sari-sari store business in her neighborhood at Talibon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed, soft drinks, liquors, canned food, sausages and hot dogs. Jenette hopes to expand her business and include a restaurant someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, soft drinks, liquors, canned food, sausages and hot dogs.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kandal province, Sophy has three children and she is 55 years old. For her living, she grows rice as the main source of her family’s income. Moreover, her husband is a taxi driver to earn additional income for supporting his family. She has been involved in her business for 11 years.

For Sophy, she has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already and she repaid her past loans completely. With the previous loans, she could support her family living’s conditions much better. Due to a lack of working capital to operate her business, she is deciding to take out a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR via VisionFund again. With this loan, she is going to buy a proper motorbike for commuting. She hopes that this loan will enable her to have a decent motorbike so as to reduce on motor-taxi expenses.

loans.use: to buy a proper motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is 26 years old, single and supports two children. She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 25,000 to buy a cow so as to supply milk for income as well as applying farm yard manure in her farming activity to improve productivity.

Callen plans to use the gained profits to repay her loan and educate her children. Her hope is to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a cow so as to supply milk for income as well as applying farm yard manure in her farming activity to improve productivity.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be very jovial. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be animal diseases and pests.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be able to do large scale farming within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 19 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 21 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche. 
SALY debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 garçons et 1 fille. 
Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter divers produits car elle tient une table ou elle vend du café et des beignets. Elle achète du café le kilo à 1500 FCFA voire 2 000 FCFA. Elle achète aussi du sucre pour le café, 1 kilo et demi à 900 FCFA. Pour la fabrication des beignets, elle achète 2 kilos de farine le kilo à 400 FCFA, du sucre vanille 200 FCFA, de l'essence de banane la bouteille à 750 FCFA, du lait en poudre à 1500 FCFA. Pour la vente elle met dans des sachets de 25 et 100 FCFA.c'est une activité qu'elle fait tous les jours.  
Les bénéfices vont lui permettent de s'occuper d'elle même et aussi d’épargner.
texts.en:
This group is made up of 19 members who are a part of the banc villageois that was created on 21 December 2009. The women come from the same village and surrounds, and they work primarily in commerce and livestock farming. They get along well.

Saly, who is standing on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children--two sons and one daughter.

With this loan, she is going to buy various products, because she runs a table where she sells coffee and beignets. She will buy coffee by the kilogram for 1,500-2,000 francs CFA. She will also buy 1.5 kilograms of sugar, for the coffee, for 900 francs CFA.

To make the beignets, she will buy two kilograms of flour for 400 francs CFA per kilogram, vanilla sugar for 200 francs CFA, a bottle of banana essence for 750 francs CFA, and powdered milk for 1,500 francs CFA.

She sells the beignets in bags for 25 and 100 francs CFA.

Saly works everyday. Earnings will allow her to take care of herself and save.

loans.use: to buy coffee and other products used to make beignets

loans.name: Lucyline

texts.en:
At 33 years of age, Lucyline (pictured above with her child in the background) has gone through various circumstances and difficulties in her life. Just to mention one of them, she doesn’t have a formal job. But her courage, perseverance, and desire to succeed make her get up every day to work on her poultry business.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last thirteen years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in other small personal business.

The Chuka area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets, and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Yacine's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 21 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche. 
ASTOU  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est agee de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 5 garçons et 3 filles. 
Avec le prêt reçu elle envisage d'acheter divers produits pour sa boutique qu'elle tient chez elle. Elle achète en gros ses marchandises et les revend en détail. Elle achète du sucre le sac de 50 kilo à 28 000 FCFA et revend le kilo à 600 FCFA. Elle achète du lait en poudre le paquet de 25 sachets à 2 250 FCFA et revend le sachet à 100 FCFA. Elle achète du thé le paquet de 10 boites à 850 FCFA et revend la boite à 100 FCFA. Elle achète aussi du riz le sac de 50 kilo à 13 000 FCFA et revend le kilo à 275 FCFA. Elle achète enfin de l'huile le bidon de 20 litres à 15 500 FCFA et revend le litre à 850 FCFA. C'est une activité qu'elle fait régulièrement dés que son stock commence à s’épuiser.  
Les bénéfices vont lui permettent d’épargner, s'occuper de sa famille et aussi rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
This group of three members is part of the banc villageois that was created 21 December 2009. The women are from the same village and surrounds, and they work primarily in commerce and livestock farming. They get along well.

Astou, who is standing on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is 54 years old. She is married and has eight children--five sons and three daughters.

With this loan, she plans to buy various products for her shop which she runs from her home. She will buy the goods at wholesale and resell them at retail.

She will buy a 50-kilogram sac of sugar for 28,000 francs CFA and resell it for 600 francs CFA per kilogram. She will buy a box of 25 sachets of powdered milk for 2,250 francs CFA and resell each sachet for 100 francs CFA. She will buy a carton of ten boxes of tea for 850 francs CFA and resell each box for 100 francs CFA. She will also buy a 50-kilogram sac of rice for 13,000 francs CFA and resell it for 275 francs CFA per kilogram. She will, finally, buy a 20-liter drum of oil for 15,500 francs CFA and resell it for 850 francs CFA per liter.

As soon as her stock begins for run out, she procures more.

The earnings will allow her to save, take care of her family, and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, powdered milk, tea, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Safarmo

texts.ru:
Сафармо 60 лет. Она уроженка района Фархор. В свои 60 лет Сафармо имеет шестерых детей и 2 гектара земли. Она занимается земледелием, вот уже многое лет она продвигает растениеводческую деятельность.
   Сафармо решила начать новую деятельность, она будет работать в сфере животноводства. Сейчас у нее одна корова. Сафармо намерена купить еще одного скота и построить коровник. Она надеется, что сможет совершить эту операцию благодаря кредиту. Поддержите Сафармо.
texts.en:
Safarmo is 60 years old. She is a resident of the Farkhor region. In her 60th year, Safarmo has six children and two hectares of land. She works with field crop cultivation, and has done so for many years already.

Safarmo decided to start a new business. She will work with livestock breeding. Currently she has one cow. Safarmo intends to purchase another cow and build a cowshed. She hopes that she will be able to do this with the loan. Please help Safarmo.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to build a cowshed

loans.name: Mbore's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de quatre femmes a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois.Ses membres sont unis par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Mboré est la responsable elle est mariée ,âgée de 53 et mère de sept enfants .
Mboré s'active dans le commerce par la vente de légumes .Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l 'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.
Avec son nouveau crédit de cinq cent mille francs cfa elle va se payer des sacs de carottes choux oignons et pommes de terres qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier. 
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires sanitaires de ses enfants mais de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, which was created during the first cycle of the banc villageois, is made up of four women. They get along well, both socially and professionally.

Mboré is the leader of this group. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of seven children.

She works by selling vegetables, and she does well because of her long experience in this domain.

With this new loan [and her portion] of 500,000 francs CFA, she is going to buy sacs of carrots, cabbage, onions, and potatoes, which she will resell at retail in her area.

Earnings from this work will allow her to feed her children and provide for their healthcare. She will also be able to save more in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy sacs of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 06 Décembre 2010 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  

Madame Aminata (assise à l’extrême gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 21 ans et  mère de 05 enfants dont 02 filles et 03 garçons. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des habits et des chaussures.

 Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des tissus teintés d’un montant de 100000f  et 20 paires de chaussures à 7500f la paire et paie un transport de 20000f pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices sont destinés à la scolarité  des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created 6 December 2010 during the inauguration of the banc villageois. The group is made up of women who mostly have acquired a solid base in small-scale commerce, which is their primary work.

Aminata (who is seated on the far left with her hand raised [in the photo]) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 21 years old, married, and the mother of five children--two daughters and three sons.

Her business consists of buying and reselling clothing and shoes. This new loan will allow her to buy dyed fabric for 100,000 francs CFA and 20 pairs of shoes for 7,500 francs CFA. She will also be able to pay the cost of transport, 20,000 francs CFA. She makes her sales at retail.

Earnings will go towards her children's education.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabric and 20 pairs of shoes, and to pay the cost of transport.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 3 коровы, 3 овцы и лошадь. На 0,50 Га земли выращивает клевер, заготавливая его в качестве корма для скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнур обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Айнур планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и образование ее детей.
texts.en:
Ainur successfully repaid her previous loan, after having used it as intended. She thanks Kiva and all who helped her with the financing.

Ainur currently has three cows, three sheep and a horse on her farm. She grows clover on 0.50 hectares of land, harvesting it to be livestock feed. The monthly income is around 17,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Ainur turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep for fattening and reselling. Ainur plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and in educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening in the fields and subsequently resell

loans.name: Altynai

texts.ru: Алтынай, 45 лет, в разводе, мать 2 детей. Она в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается торговлей товарами хозяйственного назначения на рынке. Помещение магазина арендует. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 19,500 сом (KGS). Алтынай успешно занимается бизнесом и одна воспитывает своих детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение оборотных средств в торговле. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Алтынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en:
Altynai is 45 years old, divorced and the mother of two children. As a source of income for her family, she works with selling household goods at the market. She rents premises for the store. The monthly income is around 19,500 som (KGS). Altynai is successful in her business, and she is raising her children alone.

With an aim to further develop her business, Altynai turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) to increase the working capital of her business. She plans to invest the proceeds from the business in further improving it, which will allow her to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase products for selling in her shop, in order to help boost her income.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 30 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche. 
HELENE assise à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 3 garçons et 5 filles. 
Avec le prêt reçu elle envisage d'acheter 2 veaux et 3 moutons. Elle achète le veau à 150 000 FCFA et le revend après élevage à 200 000 voire  250 000 FCFA. Elle achète le mouton à 25 000 FCfa et le cède à 40 000 voire 45 000 FCFA après élevage. Elle achète aussi de l'aliment de bétail au total 5 sac l'unité à 7 000 FCFA. Elle supporte des frais de vétérinaires qui s’élèvent à 7 000 FCFA. 
Avec les bénéfices elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en achetant de la nourriture et aussi des vêtements pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of four members belongs to the Banc Villageois which was set up on 30th December 2009. It is made up of women who come from the same village and surrounding areas and who get on well together. They are mainly active in trading and raising animals.

Hélène, who is sitting on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 58 years old. She is married and mother to eight children, three boys and five girls. With the loan she has received, she is planning to buy two calves and three sheep. She buys a calf for 150,000FCFA and resells it, once she has raised it, for 200,000 - 250,000FCFA. She buys a sheep for 25,000FCFA and sells it for 40,000 - 45,000FCFA after raising. She also buys food for her livestock, a total of five sacks at 7,000FCFA each. She pays vets' fees of 7,000FCFA. With the profits she makes she is planning to improve her family's living conditions by buying food and clothing for her children.

loans.use: to buy two calves and three sheep.

loans.name: Plateros Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy pequeña del Estado de México con muy pocos habitantes pero muy conocida por las artesanías elaboradas en plata se conformó el grupo de préstamo "Plateros", nombre que hace referencia a la actividad antes mencionada.

Doña  María Luisa es una mujer muy amable, pero sobretodo muy trabajadora, tiene 70 años, ya es viuda pero tiene una gran familia de 11 hijos, 30 nietos y 10 bisnietos.

Desde hace 18 años abrió su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, pero platica que previamente vendía pescado y pan en las calles de su comunidad, con el tiempo ya no le convencía mucho este negocio así que decidió vender frutas y legumbres. Tiempo después escuchó hablar de VFMéxico y decidió solicitar un préstamo para finalmente emprender su tienda. “El crédito me ha ayudado mucho a levantar mi negocio y en su momento cuando mis hijos eran pequeños”. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en productos enlatados, refrescos, carnes frías, entre otros.

A pesar de que doña María Luisa tiene mucha competencia alrededor, sabe que también cuenta con clientes leales y el entusiasmo de brindar más variedad de productos, además de la mejor atención. Su único sueño es seguir creciendo su negocio aunque ya no tiene tantos gastos como antes, pero le agrada sentirse independiente y cubrir sus propios gastos.

Las integrantes del grupo son Guadalupe quien invierte en antojitos Mexicanos, Cleotilde en plata y Rosa en borregos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Doña Maria Luisa es quien viste el suéter blanco.
texts.en:
In a small community in the Estado de Mexico, with very few inhabitants, but well-known for their handicrafts made of silver, the loan group “Plateros” was formed, a name which references the previously mentioned activity. 
Maria Luisa is a very kind woman, but above all, very-hardworking, she is 70 years old. She is now a widow, but she has a big family, including 11 children, 30 grandchildren, and 10 great-grandchildren. 
She opened her small grocery store 18 years ago, but she says she previously sold fish and bread in the streets of her community. After some time, she was not sure of this business, so she decided to sell fruits and vegetables. Some time later, she heard of VFMexico, and decided to ask for a loan to finally open her store. “The loan has helped me a lot to open my business and in a moment when my children were young.”
She will invest the new loan in canned products, sodas, cold meats, among others. 
Although Maria Luisa has a lot of competition, she knows she has loyal clients, and she has the enthusiasm to bring a larger variety of products, and also her best customer service. Her only dream is to keep growing her business, although she does not have as many expenses as before, but she likes to feel independent and cover her own expenses. The members of the group are Guadalupe, who will invest in traditional Mexican fried snacks, Cleotilde in silver, and Rosa in sheep.
*The photograph was taken in the municipal garden; Maria Luisa is wearing a white sweater.

loans.use: to invest in canned products, sodas, cold meats, among others.

loans.name: Mariama Talisma's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 06 Décembre 2010 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale. 
 
Madame Mariama Talisma (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 48 ans et  mère de 04 enfants dont 02 filles et 02 garçons. Elle a une boutique d’alimentation générale.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des denrées telles que : 03 sacs de riz à 13000f le sac , 02 sacs d’oignons à 10000f le sac 20 litre d’huile raffinée à 1000f le litre  pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices sont destinés aux soins médicaux et scolarité  des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created 6 December 2010 during the inauguration of their banc villageois. The group is made up of women who, for the most part, have acquired a solid base in small-scale commerce, which is their main form of work.

Mariama Talisma (who is seated on the far right with her hand raised [in the photo]) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four children--two daughters and two sons.

Mariama Talisma runs a general grocery store. This new loan will allow her to buy foodstuffs such as three sacs of rice at 13,000 francs per sac, two sacs of onions for 10,000 francs CFA per sac, and 20 liters of refined oil for 1,000 francs CFA per liter. She will resell these goods at retail.

Earnings will go towards her children's schooling and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, such as rice, onions, and refined oil.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 06 Décembre 2010 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois, le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  
Madame Aminata (assise à 
l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 30 ans et  mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles et 01 garçon. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des habits et des chaussures.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 prêts à porter à 6000f l’unité et des chaussures d’un montant de 40000f et paie un transport de 20000f pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales, surtout à la scolarité de ses enfants et aider son mari à la location de la maison.
texts.en:
The group was set up on 6th December 2010 at the same time the Banc Villageois was created. The group is made up of women, the majority of whom have built up a sound experience in small trading businesses which are their main activity.

Aminata, who is sitting on the extreme right with her hand raised, is the star borrower of the group. She is married, 30 years old and mother to four children, three girls and a boy. She has a clothes selling business and this new loan will enable her to buy ten ready-to-wear outfits at 6,000 francs each and 40,000 francs worth of clothes for resale on a retail basis; it will also enable her to pay 20,000 francs for transport.

The profits she makes will allow her to contribute to the family's expenses, above all her children's education, and to help her husband with the rent on the house.

loans.use: to buy 10 ready-to-wear outfits at 6,000 francs each and shoes to a value of 40,000 francs to resell on a retail basis, as well as paying 20,000 francs for transport.

loans.name: Malado's Group

texts.fr:
Créé depuis le 10 Décembre 2012, les femmes du B.V sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué. Elles ont comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Malado,(debout à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse  une dame très engagée dans la gestion du groupement ainsi que de ses activités génératrices de revenu. Mariée et âgée de 31 ans elle est mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et deux garçons. Elle s’active dans le commerce de fruits qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre en détails.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt elle désire acheter 10 sacs de fruits à 100000f pour les revendre à 120 000 f.

Les bénéfices lui permettent de d’augmenter son épargne et d’aider ses enfants dans leurs habillements et leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
Created on 10 December 2012, the women of this banc villageois mostly work in small-scale commerce. They get along well and, because of their work, they have been able to develop a strong group spirit.

Malado, who is standing on the far right [in the photo], is a borrower who is very active in the group's management and its income generating activities. Married and 31 years old, she is the mother of four children, including two daughters and two sons.

Malado works selling fruits at retail, which she buys from the weekly markets. With this new loan, she wishes to buy 10 sacs of fruit for 100,000 francs CFA, which she will resell for 120,000 francs CFA.

Earnings will allow her to increase her savings and to help provide her children with clothing and an education.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacs of fruit.

loans.name: Ruperto

texts.es:
RUPERTO TIENE 69 AÑOS , CASADO, CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO POR LA LABOR DE VENTA DE LECHE EN LA MISMA ZANA MONTECRUZ RAFAN Y MOCUPE, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA CON SU CONYUGE Y NIETO EN EL CP. LAGUNAS, DISTRITO DE MOCUPE, RPOVINCIA CHICLAYO, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

RUPERTO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE LECHE EN LA MISMA ZONA. DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS, CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORESLES DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS Y CLIENTES.NECESITA EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN MANTENIMIENTO DE SU CULTIVO DE ALFALFA DONDE SE ALIMENTA SU GANADO, DE ESTA MANERA PODRÁ OFRECER LECHE DE MEJOR CALIDAD, AUMENTANDO SU VOLUMEN DE VENTAS, SU NIVEL DE INGRESOS Y POR ENDE SU NIVEL DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Ruperto is 69 years old, he is married. He is known for his work selling milk in the same area, Motnecruz Rafan y Mocupe. 
He lives in his own home with his spouse and grandchild in Lagunas, District of Mocupe, Province of Chiclayo, in the northern coasts of Peru.

Ruperto’s occupation is the sale of milk in the same area. He has done this work for more than 10 years, and has very good personal and work references from his neighbors and clients. He needs the loan to invest in the maintenance of his alfalfa crops where his cattle graze. In this way, he will be able to offer milk of better quality, increasing the volume of his sales and therefore their standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his alfalfa crops.

loans.name: Dienaba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Le groupe compte des femmes qui en majorité ont acquis de solides expériences dans le petit commerce qui se trouvent être leur activité principale.  Elles habitent toutes le même village, et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles font aussi de la culture sous pluie. 

Madame Diénabou (debout à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de quatre enfants dont 02 filles et 02 garçons. Son activité consiste à vendre des produits alimentaires : riz légumes huile etc. Elle jouit d’une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des légumes d’un montant de 30000f par semaine 01 sac de riz à 16500f et 20 litres d’huile à 25000f pour le revendre en détails.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer activement à la gestion des charges familiales et surtout à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created 17 May 2011 during the inauguration of the banc villageois. The group is made up of women who, for the most part, have acquired a solid base in small-scale commerce, which is their main form of work. They also practice rain-fed agriculture. The women all live in the same village and share a sense of solidarity and mutual aid.

Diénabou, who is standing on the right with her hand raised [in the photo], is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of four children--two daughters and two sons.

Diénabou works by selling food products, such as rice, vegetables, oil, etc. She does well with this work.

This new loan will allow her to buy vegetables worth 30,000 francs CFA per week, one sac of rice for 16,500 francs CFA, and 20 liters of oil for 25,000 francs CFA. She will resell these goods at retail.

Earnings will allow her to help cover her family's expenses, especially her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and oil.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 52 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonila is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leonila has been raising pigs for one year and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 57 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolita has been raising pigs for one year and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Narcisa is 60 years now.

Narcisa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Narcisa has been in this business for four years. In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Aissatou Fily's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 10 Juin 2002, à l’inauguration du dit banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou Fily (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide des oignons et des pommes de terre. 

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 03 sacs d’oignons à 10000f le sac, 05 sacs de pomme de terre à 10000f le sac et 03 sceaux de patte d’arachide à 12000f le sceau pour le revendre en détails.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Created 10 June 2002 during the inauguration of their banc villageois, this group is made up of women who are very experienced in how a banc villageois works. They work primarily in small-scale commerce, and they share strong ties of solidarity and mutual aid.

Aissatou Fily, who is standing on the far right with her hand raised [in the photo], is the featured borrower of the group. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of five children.

Aissatou Fily works selling groundnut paste, onions, and potatoes. With this new loan, she plans to buy three sacs of onions for 10,000 francs CFA per sac, five sacs of potatoes for 10,000 francs CFA per sac, and three buckets of groundnut paste for 12,000 francs CFA per bucket. She will resell these goods at retail.

Earnings will allow her to support her husband to cover the daily expenses and her children's healthcare needs.

loans.use: to buy onions, potatoes, and groundnut paste.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 55 years old and widowed with six children.

She is in an agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Adelia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adelia has been in this business for 20 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Avegail

texts.en:
Avegail is 20 years old and married with two children.

She is in an agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Avegail is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Avegail has been in this business for two years and earns additional income from weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: corn, beans, eggs, oil, ham, detergent, rice, sugar, candy, shampoo, sweet bread, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: G.s Esforzándonos Por El Mañana Group

texts.es:
La señora María es una mujer  emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos provienen de su negocio que es la venta de sandalias, este negocio lo atiende de manera personal y se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes.
Doña María esto lo realiza desde hace 18 años, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus principales clientes son vecinos de su comunidad y otras comunidades ya que sale a vender de manera ambulante, solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de sandalias, blúmeres, bóxer, calcetines, etc. espera que esta le permita salir adelante con su negocio.
Doña María sueña con poder extender su negocio y poder vender más variedad de productos a sus clientes y así poder mejorar su fuente de ingresos, solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas:
Doña Érica se dedica a la venta de abarrotería, desde hace 6 años.


Danli, Honduras – Julio del 2015
texts.en:
Maria is an entrepreneurial woman and dedicated to retail. Her main source of income comes from her business, which is the sale of sandals. She tends to this business in a personal way and gets up very early to attend to her clients.
Maria has done this work 18 years, her business is located in the house where she lives. Her main clients are her neighbors in the community and other communities, as she also works as a street vendor. She asks for the support of the loan to buy sandals, bloomers, boxers, socks, etc. She hopes this will allow her to get ahead with her business. 
Maria dreams of being able grow her business and be able to sell a larger variety of products to her clients, in order to improve her source of income. She asks for the loan as part of a group with the following:
Erica, who has worked in a grocery store for 6 years. 

Danli, Honduras, July 2015

loans.use: to buy sandals, bloomers, boxers, socks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Dienaba's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 10 Juin 2002, à l’inauguration du dit banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide et ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diénaba  (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 25 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide pour les revendre en détails. 

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 10 sceaux de patte d’arachide à 12000f le sceau pour le revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de faire ses dépenses quotidiennes, veiller à la santé de ses enfants et aider son mari dans la gestion financière de leur famille.
texts.en:
Created 10 June 2002 during the inauguration of the banc villageois, this group is made up of women who now have experience in how a banc villageois works. They work primarily in small-scale commerce, and they share strong ties of solidarity and mutual aid.

Diénaba, who is standing on the far right with her hand raised [in the photo], is the featured borrower of the group. She is 25 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She works selling groundnut paste at retail.

With this new loan, she plans to buy 10 buckets of groundnut paste at 12,000 francs CFA per bucket. She will resell these at the weekly markets.

Earnings will allow her to cover the daily expenses, ensure her children's health, and help her husband with their family's finances.

loans.use: to buy groundnut paste to resell in the weekly markets.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 39 years old and has eight children. She is married and has six of her children are in school.

Rona is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rona has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Grand Yoff Diabir Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 28 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est composé de vingt un femmes qui évoluent dans le commerce. Madame Sanou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 52 ans et mère de sept enfants dont trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente d'habit prêt à porter hommes et femmes depuis quatre ans. Elle a une bonne clientèle. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à payer la scolarité, la nourriture et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en: The Banc Villageois was inaugurated on 28th May 2001. This group is made up of 21 women who are building up trading activities. Sanou, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is married, 52 years old and mother to seven children, three of whom are boys. She has been selling ready-to-wear clothes for men and women for the past four years and has a good customer base. The profits she makes will be used to contribute to her children's schooling, food and health costs.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mesa Del Aguita Group

texts.es:
Alegría y sonoridad es lo que puede describir a una comunidad del Estado de México con los riachuelos que se forman en los campos de siembra y que terminan en el río, mismos que producen surcos de tierra que se logra ver en las orillas del río. Más allá de todo esto es una comunidad muy tranquila, los habitantes no dejan de ofrecer un saludo o sonrisa a cualquier visitante.

Rosa Elena es una mujer capaz, responsable, generosa, pero sobre todo dedicada, que se esfuerza junto con su pareja Samuel para dar a sus 4 hijos una mejor oportunidad para sobresalir. En la cría de pollos Rosa, ha encontrado una forma eficiente y práctica para velar por los intereses de su familia sin descuidar su hogar.

Por ahora Rosa se ha comprometido a hacer más grande el negocio vendiendo los animales en comunidades aledañas y no sólo en la suya. En el futuro le gustaría comprar máquinas como tanques de gas y comedores para aumentar la producción de pollos y huevo. Aunque aún queda mucho por hacer, ella comenta “Vale la pena seguir luchando día con día para poder darles a mis hijos la vida que se merecen”.
