Actividad que realiza en las afueras de su domicilio, con un par de sombrillas para cubrir el sol y muebles nuevos que compré con el préstamo anterior, “mi negocio está mejorando, ya cuento con muebles ahora necesito insumos de cocina…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas de comida son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reponer los insumos de cocina. Su sueño es tener un restaurante conocido, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor, como; carne, aceite, fideo, arroz, yuca, chuño, etc. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Soledad solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para reponer su inventario y continuar cocinando.
texts.en:
Soledad continues with her business selling food. The previous loan was invested in the purchase of tables, chairs and kitchen utensils. Her payments were punctual because her business didn't have any problems. She specializes in traditional food such as majadito (dried meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), locro (soup made from dried meat, chopped meat, yucca and eggs), chicharrón (fried wild pig), and more. She does this work outside her home, with a pair of umbrellas to shade the sun and new furniture that she bought with the previous loan. "My business is improving, I have furniture and now I need cooking supplies..." she says. The advantage of her business is that the food sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to replace the cooking supplies. Her dream is to have a well-known restaurant. She wants to purchase cooking supplies in bulk such as meat, oil, noodles, rice, yucca, freeze-dried potato, etc. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she has done this work.

The these reasons, Soledad asks for a loan to purchase cooking supplies in bulk to replace her inventory and continue cooking.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies in bulk to replace her inventory and continue cooking.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una pequeña productora de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Se dedica principalmente a la caficultura, con lo cual ha sacado adelante a sus  hijos. La producción promedio de café que ha obtenido esta productora en los últimos tres años es de 140 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales maneja bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade.

El mayor desafío que ha enfrentado en la producción de café, es la presencia de plagas y enfermedades, lo cual está segura logrará mantener bajo control con un plan de fertilización adecuado. 

Por tal razón, está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitirá darle un adecuado mantenimiento a sus plantaciones. Su meta es continuar mejorando su finca bajo un plan de manejo integrado que le permita continuar invirtiendo gradualmente en el desarrollo y diversificación de su finca, lo cual está segura logrará con una buena toma de decisiones y su dedicación al trabajo para poder seguir sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is a small producer in the northern part of Nicaragua. She primarily works as a coffee grower, which she has used to get ahead with her children. The average production of coffee that she has obtained in the last three years is 140 bushels of raw coffee, which is below the level required for Fair trade certification.

The biggest challenge that she has confronted while producing coffee is the presence of pests and diseases which she is sure she can keep under control with an adequate fertilization plan. Because of this, she is seeking a loan to purchase supplies and fertilizers that will allow her to adequately maintain her plantations. Her goal is to continue improving her farm under an integrated management plan that will allow her to continue investing gradually in the development and diversification of her farm. She is sure to accomplish her goal by making good decisions and through her dedication to the work needed to be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers that she will use to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Lucero De La Villa Group

texts.es:
Erika continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa usada. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque sus clientes de temporada compraron la mercadería. La principal necesidad de su negocio es la reposición de la mercadería, esta se compra por mayor y se debe seleccionar la ropa de temporada, géneros, edades, etc. “el anterior préstamo me ayudo bastante a consolidar a mis clientes, mis ventas mejoraron y necesito abastecer mi negocio con mercadería nueva...” comenta. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa usada por mayor para abastecer su negocio y cumplir con sus clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Erika solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abastecer su negocio y continuar alimentando a su familia.
texts.en:
Erika continues with her business selling used clothing. Her previous loan was invested in the purchase of second-hand clothing in bulk. The payments were punctual because her seasonal customers bought the merchandise. Her business's primary need is replacing the merchandise, which is bought in bulk and one has to select seasonal clothing, gender, ages, etc. "The previous loan helped me a lot to strengthen my customer base, my sales improved and I need to stock my business with new merchandise..." she says. Her dream is to open a clothing store, she wants to purchase used clothing in bulk to stock her business and satisfy her customers. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Erika asks for a loan to purchase second-hand clothing to stock her business and continue feeding her family.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothing in bulk to stock her business and continue feeding her family.

loans.name: Rufina Clementina

texts.es:
Rufina es una mujer de 61 años de edad, viuda, tiene 2 hijos independientes de 30 y 33 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. 
Ella es independiente, constante, activa, fuerte, atenta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chasquipampa’ caracterizada por ser la antigua parada de los chaskis (en el tiempo del imperio inca), donde se encontraron tumbas incaicas, cerámica y piezas de oro de esa época. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 3-17 grados centígrados.
Rufina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de sus hijos que trabajan y tiene sus familias, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio dónde; refrescos, pan, azúcar, golosinas, papel higiénico, etc., “inicié mi negocio cuando mis hijos estaba estudiando en la escuela, ellos ya tienen sus familias y negocio continúa…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas duran toda la semana, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio y refaccionar su tienda. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, refaccionar las paredes y pintar la fachada, ella desea surtir su tienda y refaccionar la entrada y el techo para mejorar su visibilidad y atractivo para el público. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Rufina solicita un préstamo para surtir su tienda, refaccionar la entrada y el techo para mejorar su visibilidad y atractivo para los clientes.
texts.en:
Rufina is a 61-year-old woman, a widow, who has 2 independent children, ages 30 and 33, and her business is the sales of basic items and foods in her neighborhood store.

She is independent, persevering, active, strong, attentive, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is located in the Chasquipampa zone, characterized by being the ancient chaski stop (in the time of the Incan empire), where there are Incan tombs, ceramics and gold pieces from this epoch. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies daily between 3-17 degrees centigrade.

Rufina has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she keeps braided, is short, has a robust physique, her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and her business. She enjoys her life with her children who work and have their own families. They live in their own house, built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a wood floor which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is the sale of basic foods and products in her neighborhood store which is located in her house. She has soft drinks, bread, sugar, candies, toilet paper, etc. "I began my business when my children were going to school, now they have their families and the business continues..." she says. The advantage of her business is that the sales last the whole week, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock her business and repair the store. Her dream is to expand her business, repair the walls and paint the facade. She wants to stock her store and repair the entryway and the roof to improve its visibility and attractiveness to the public. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years that she has been doing this work. For these reasons, Rufina asks for a loan to stock her store, repair the entryway and the roof to have better visibility and attractiveness for the customers.

loans.use: to stock her store, repair the entryway and the roof to improve its visibility and attractiveness to the customers.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Marcelina vive en el área rural con su pareja en calidad de casados con una nieta, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda es rustica de adobe con techo de calamina, que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su esposo para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura,  en esta actividad lleva 46 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa sus producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de Tiraque y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, haba, cebada  y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Marcelina se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo económico para la compra de semovientes de bovinos (una yunta), ya que con la ayuda de una yunta realizar trabajos de remover la tierra y de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcelina lives in a rural area with her common-law spouse and a granddaughter. She completed her studies up through the primary level. Her home is made of rustic adobe with a corrugated iron roof and it lacks certain basic services. Marcelina is a hardworking person and with a lot of optimism she works everyday, together with her husband, to obtain economic earnings for their own sustenance.

She works primarily in agriculture. She has approximately 46 years of experience with this activity where she grows and sells what she produces. What she obtains she brings to sell in the provincial markets of Tiraque and nearby times. The primary products that she plants are a large quantity of potatoes, beans, barley and other items in small quantities which are generally for her own consumption. Marcelina needs to seek this economic loan to purchase cattle (a yolk) because with the help of a yolk she can complete the work of turning the soil and in this way she will be able to increase her production, continue with her sales, and obtain income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle so she can increase her farming production and her sales to obtain income to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Gonzalo Ismael

texts.es:
Gonzalo continúa con su negocio de fabricación de zapatos. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de materiales de confección de zapatos. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio marchó bien. La confección artesanal de zapatos es un oficio que poco a poco va desapareciendo debido a las grandes industrias que nos envían zapatos de menor calidad y a menor precio, “los invito a ponerse en estos zapatos para viajar directo al baile de Carnaval, con esta bota altísima y súper flexible que permite distintos usos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas constantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de cuero por mayor. Su sueño es comprarse maquinas industriales para soldar el calzado, él desea realizar la compra por mayor de cuero para fabricar botas de mujer para las fiestas de carnavales. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gonzalo solicita un préstamo para la compra de cuero por mayor para confeccionar botas para las bailarinas de carnavales.
texts.en:
Gonzalo continues with his business of making shoes. He invested the last loan in buying materials to make shoes. He paid his installments on time as his business went well. The handcrafted production of shoes is a trade that is disappearing little by little due to the large factories which send out shoes of lower quality at a lower price. "I invite them to put on these shoes and go directly to the Carnival dance with this high and super flexible boot which allows distinctive uses", he commented.

The advantage of his business is that he has constant sales, his disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy leather wholesale. His dream is to buy industrial machines to put the footwear together. He wants to buy leather wholesale to make boots for women for the carnival festivities. This is his second loan with the institution in the 10 years he has done this business.

For these reasons Gonzalo is requesting a loan to buy leather wholesale to make boots for the dancers at carnival.

loans.use: to buy leather wholesale to make boots for dancers at carnival.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is hurrying to finish her first Kiva loan as she already has one idea and needs one more: a Kiva partnership.

Siranush lives with her family in the village Ddmashen of the Gegharkunik region.

Siranush has cows, pigs, a calf and also chickens on her farm. The income from the sale of her farm products (milk, cheese, macun, which is a national dairy-product, curd, meat and eggs ) is the only source of income for her family as her husband is unemployed. She also sells her land’s potatoes to her regular customers.

Siranush hopes that again she will be supported by Kiva lenders. With her second loan, she wants to buy a lot of animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: 2 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
Deysi es una mujer de 48 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 9 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dinámica, contante, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un mercado conocido, ubicado al lado Norte de la ciudad, caracterizado por sus múltiples ofertas como; salones de belleza, ropa, zapatos, carteras y accesorios, joyas, flores, regalos, abarrotes, lácteos y embutidos, carnes y derivados, electrodomésticos, celulares -comidas, snacks etc. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Deysi es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la tercera de la derecha, viste blusa azul y pantalón celeste, usa una cartera marrón). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor se encuentra en el kínder, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación por la necesidad de pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, taller de llaves, venta de carteras y bolsos, venta de maní, venta de productos naturales para la salud, artesanía en yeso, venta de carne, venta de bisutería y venta de lácteos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), majao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), ají de panza (panza de res, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), “cocino desde siempre, pero este nuevo negocio se lo debo a mi hijo porque no tengo otra manera de cuidarlo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; carne, charque, yuca, arroz, fideo, aceite, etc. Su sueño es ser el puesto de comida elegido por la mayoría de los clientes de la zona, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para cocinar y pagar los gastos preescolares de su hijo menor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Deisy solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para cocinar y pagar los gastos preescolares de su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Deysi is a 48-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has three children who are 5, 9, and 14 years old. Her business is selling traditional foods. She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, dynamic, friendly, responsible and very hard working. She runs her business in a well-known market, located in the northern part of the city, which is known for its many offerings such as: beauty salons, clothes, shoes, purses and accessories, jewelry, flowers, gifts, groceries, dairy products and cold cuts, meat products, household appliances, cell phones, food, snacks, etc. The warm, sub tropical climate of the area has varied temperatures throughout the day between 21 – 35 degrees Celsius.

Deysi has an olive-skinned complexion, brown eyes, long brown hair, is short, thin, and her mother tongue is Guarani which is spoken in the area. Because of the general culture and to run her business, she also speaks Spanish. (She is the woman, third from the right, wearing a blue blouse and light blue pants, with a brown purse). She lives with her partner who works as a driver and her children; the two oldest children study in school and the youngest is currently in kindergarten. They live in a rented room built of bricks and cement with a metal roof and cement floor. Their home has electricity, potable water, and plumbing.

Her desire to improve, due to the necessity of paying the academic expenses of her children, led her to join the community bank of people with businesses such as: sale of secondhand clothes, a key-making workshop, sale of bags and purses, peanut sales, sale of natural health products, plaster handcrafts, meat sales, sale of jewelry, and sale of dairy products, in order to ask for a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling traditional foods such as: rice with cheese (rice, milk, and cheese), “majao” (ground jerky, boiled plantains, and rice), peanut soup (a peanut-based soup), “ají de panza” (beef, onions, tomatoes with rice). “I have cooked forever but I have this new business because of my son because I don’t have another way to care for him,” she says.

The benefit of her business is that the sales are daily and continuous. The disadvantage is that she is lacking the capital to buy cooking supplies such as: meat, jerky, yucca, rice, noodles, oil, etc. Her dream is to have the food stall most favored by the majority of clients in the area. She hopes to buy the cooking supplies to cook and pay for the preschool expenses of her youngest child. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the five years that she has had this business. For those reasons, Deysi is asking for a loan to buy cooking supplies to cook and pay for the preschool expenses of her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies in order to cook and pay for the preschool expenses of her young child.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells solar lamps, combs, torches, and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of torches, solar lamps, combs, brushes, and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of torches, solar lamps, combs, brushes, and other items.

loans.name: Grand Yoff Diabir Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 28 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est composé de huit femmes qui ont comme activité le commerce. Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 54 ans et mère de neuf enfants dont six garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente d'huile de palme, du citron et de la bouillie(Fondé)depuis plus de quinze années. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité 15kg de mil, 20 bidons de 20 litres d'huile de palme et 30 bidons de 20 litres de citron. Elle est la seule dans son entourage à développer cette activité qui très fort. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à l'éducation et à la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en: This banc villageois was inaugurated on 28th May 2001. The group is made up of eight women who all run their own businesses. Mariama, the woman to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a 54-year-old widowed mother to nine children; six boys and three girls. She has been selling palm oil, lemon juice and porridge for over 15 years. With this loan, she is going to purchase 15 kg of millet, 20 20-litre containers of palm oil and 30 20-litre containers of lemon juice. She is the only person in her group who runs this kind of business, which is going very well for her. The profits will be used to make sure that her children are looked after and that they receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, lemon juice and millet

loans.name: Oriente Petrolero Group

texts.es:
Cinthia es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de cereales.
Ella es buena madre, solidaria, optimista, generosa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona sur de la ciudad, considerada zona peri urbana. Creada debido a un desborde del río, en la que más de 3000 familias quedaron sin hogar, y con las pocas pertenencias que llevaban tuvieron que asentarse en unos terrenos baldíos, para empezar una nueva vida.  De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
CINTHIA es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la primera de la derecha, viste color rosa). Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que trabajan y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de arena que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos, formó una banca de personas con negocios, como; venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de productos naturales para la salud, confección de tejidos, artesanía en cuero, taller de soldadura, taller de carpintería y venta de abarrotes, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de cereales como; Frejol Carioca, Soya, Quinúa Orgánica, Chuño Negro, Frijol rojo, Maíz, Sorgo y otros. Actividad que realiza de forma ambulante visitando ferias y comercios del área, “camino bastante empujando mi carrito de 2 ruedas, la venta la realizo por peso y salgo con una carga de cereal por día…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son continuas durante todo el año, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de cereales por mayor. Su sueño es estabilizar y mejorar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de cereales por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad a mejor precio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Cinthia solicita un préstamo para la compra de cereales por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a 28 year old single woman who has an eight year old son. Her business is selling grains.

She is a good mother, supportive, optimistic, generous, patient, responsible and very hard-working. She does her business in the southern part of the city which is considered a semi-urban area. It was created due to a flood of a river that left over 3,000 families homeless. With the few belongings they still possessed they had to settle in these barren lands and start a new life. It has a hot sub-tropical climate with a daily temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

Cinthia is dark-skinned, with brown eyes, long black hair, short in stature and of robust build. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (in the photo she is the first to the right, wearing pink) She shares her life with her family who work and with her son who goes to school. They live in their own room built of wood with a metal roof and sand floor which has electricity, running water and sewage.

Due to the need to improve her income she formed a communal bank with people with businesses like: selling second-hand clothing, selling natural health products, weaving, leather handicrafts, a welding shop, a carpenter shop and the sales of groceries to request a loan and improve their businesses.

Her business is selling grains like; pinto beans, soya beans, organic quinoa, black potato flour, red beans, corn, sorghum and others. She does her business itinerantly visiting markets and businesses in the area. "I walk enough pushing my two wheeled cart. I sell by the weight and go out with a load every day" she comments. The advantage of her business is that her sales are consistent throughout the year, her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy grains wholesale. Her dream is to stabilize and improve her business. She wants to make the purchase of wholesale grains to offer a greater variety at better prices. This is her first loan with the institution in the five years she has worked in this business.

For these reasons Cinthia is requesting a loan to buy grains wholesale to offer a greater variety at a better price.

loans.use: to buy grains wholesale to offer a greater variety at a better price.

loans.name: Grand Yoff Diabir Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 28 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est composé de huit femmes qui s'activent dans le commerce. Madame Aissatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 52 ans et mère de six enfants dont trois filles. Elle s'active depuis deux ans dans la vente de fruits et de l'huile de palme. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité 20 litres d'huile de palme et des fruits en quantité. Elle est douée en la matière et elle a des clients qui lui sont fidèles. Les bénéfices vont servir à assurer la scolarité de ses enfant et à prendre à charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: This banc villageois was inaugurated on 28th May 2001. The group is made up of eight women who all run their own businesses. Aissatou, the woman to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a 52-year-old widowed mother to six children; three boys and three girls. She has been selling fruits and palm oil for two years. With this loan, she is going to purchase 20 litres of palm oil and a large quantity of different fruits. She has a gift for her trade and her customers are loyal to her. The profits will be used to make sure that her children receive an education and that her family's needs are meet.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and palm oil

loans.name: Nongtaaba Peele Group

texts.fr:
Mr YOUSSOUF est responsable du groupe NONGTAABA PEELE. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 18 mois. 01 enfant va à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charges.
Mr fait de l’agriculture depuis 20 ans. Il pratique aussi l’élevage. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 02 moutons et 01 boîte d’herbicide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son élevage et les revenus de ses activités. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssouf is in charge of the Nongtaaba Peele group. He is married and the father of five children between the ages of 18 months and 15 years. One of his children goes to school and he has seven total dependents. 

Mr. Youssouf has been a farmer for twenty years. He also does livestock farming. He buys his supplies in the neighboring markets. 

With the money he earns, he will buy two sheep and one box of herbicide. He would like to use the money from his loan to grow his livestock farming business and his revenues. He would like to buy a parcel of land.

loans.use: buy two sheep and a box of herbicide.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 29 years old and he lives in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. Karen is married and he lives with his wife, small daughter, and retired grandmother.

Karen now both does farming and works as a welder. He has a nice farm where, with his wife, he takes care of a cow and sheep. He also has a vegetable garden where he cultivates cabbages, potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. All his farm goods he sells locally to his neighbors and regular customers.

Now with the hope of more income, Karen has an idea and he hopes for Kiva support. With his loan he wants to buy a hay mowing machine and he will start taking orders from his villagers to work in their farms (to mow the hay fields) with his machine and in this way he will have a new source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a hay mowing machine.

loans.name: Grand Yoff Diabir Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 28 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est constitué de huit femmes dynamiques qui évoluent dans le commerce. Madame Clémentine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du Groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 62 ans et mère de neuf enfants dont trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de friandises depuis plus de trente ans. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité de l'huile de palme, des fruits, haricot et autres. Les bénéfices vont servir à payer la scolarité, la nourriture et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en: This banc villageois was inaugurated on 28th May 2001. The group is made up of eight women who all run their own businesses. Clémentine, the woman to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is a 62-year-old widowed mother to nine children; three boys and six girls. She has been selling confectionery for over 30 years. With this loan, she is going to purchase palm oil, fruits, beans and other ingredients. The profits will be used to make sure that her children are well-fed and healthy and that they receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients to make confectionary

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 20 years old and her youngest is four years old. Her husband is a chainsaw operator. Elizabeth has been running a vegetable farm for 20 years. Elizabeth and her husband work hard to earn a living. In the future, they dream of improving their livelihood for a better standard of living. As for now, Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 3 y 10 años y una hija de 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas y masitas.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Sacaba’ se encuentra a 14 km. de la ciudad, tiene como principales atractivos turísticos: la localidad de Ukuchi, el templo de Bella Vista, la laguna de San Isidro, el circuito de Motocrosss de Quintanilla, la casa de Hacienda de Tocopona, el templo de Melga, el camino del Inca, entre otros. De clima templado y húmedo, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-27 grados centígrados.
Vilma es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al comercio de carne y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y los 2 menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe y ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cerámica que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de empanadas y masitas; con un poco de harina, una cucharadita de levadura química tipo Royal, leche tibia, aceite de oliva suave, una pizca de sal y un huevo para pintarla, hornea deliciosas empanadas y masitas, “La masa casera para empanadas no puede ser más sencilla de hacer y tiene la grandísima ventaja de estar elaborada con una grasa saludable como es el aceite de oliva…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con carro para realizar la venta ambulantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor. Su sueño es vender empanadas por mayor a supermercados y tiendas de barrio, ella desea realiza la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor para la venta de empanadas a tiendas de barrio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Vilma solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de empanadas y masitas por mayor para la venta por mayor a tiendas de barrio.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her partner and three sons who are 1, 3, and 10 years old, and her 13-year-old daughter. Her business is selling empanadas and masitas (pastries).

She is a good mother, strong, a fighter, consistent, optimistic, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the town of “Sacaba” which is 14 kilometers from the city, with the main tourist attractions of: the town of Ukuchi, the temple of Bella Vista, the San Isidro lagoon, the Motocross track in Quintanilla, the house of the Hacienda de Tocopona, the Melga temple, and the Inca trail, among others. The climate of the area is temperate and humid with temperatures varying throughout the day between 18-27 degrees Celsius.

Vilma is dark-skinned, with brown eyes, long, black hair, which she wears in a braid, is short, thin, and uses traditional dress (hat, mantle, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in the area. Because of the general culture and to run her business, she also speaks Spanish.

She lives with her partner, who works selling meat, and with her children; the oldest two study in school and the younger two still are not old enough to go to school. They live in their own home build of adobe, brick, and cement, with a metal roof and tile floor. They do not have a sewage system but have well water that is extracted with a pump, and electricity.

Her business is making and selling empanadas and pastries. With a little bit of flour, a teaspoon of Royal-brand baking powder, warm milk, olive oil, a pinch of salt, and one egg to brush over, she bakes delicious empanadas and pastries. “The homemade dough for empanadas couldn’t be easier to make and has the great advantage of being made with healthy fats like olive oil,” she says.

The advantage of her business is that she has a car which she uses to make deliveries and the disadvantage is that she is lacking capital to buy cooking supplies in bulk. Her dream is to sell empanadas in bulk to supermarkets and neighborhood stores. She hopes to buy cooking supplies in bulk to sell empanadas to neighborhood stores. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the two years she had had this business. For those reasons, Vilma is asking for a loan to buy supplies for empanadas and pastries in bulk to sell to neighborhood stores in bulk.

loans.use: to buy supplies for empanadas and pastries in bulk to sell to neighborhood stores in bulk.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a retail business where he offers laundry services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy soap and water. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy soap and water.
